title: Central Location to Times Square
text:
Very convenient location for New York City. 
Breakfast good. 
Rooms were small however, the bathroom was very small. Difficulty to manoeuvre around

title: What sets the Hotel Edison Apart
text:
I absolutely LOVE the Hotel Edison! This hotel is a New York classic set in the heart of Times Square. There is a lot to love about this one of a kind property- the location, the art deco decor, the restaurants-Friedman’s, The Rum House, Bond 45- the rooms, the gym and the list goes on and on- but what really sets this hotel apart is their top notch hospitality. I live in NYC, but I send all of my out of town guests to stay at The Edison, because I KNOW they will be made to feel welcome in a city that can sometimes be unwelcoming. 
I have to call out one individual by name, who just always goes above and beyond to make guests feel welcome and handled- Rommel Gopez. Rommel is always making everyone feel special, whether remembering a name or sharing a friendly word- and I have to mention the Edison Wine Hour! The last time I had friends staying at the hotel, they had cast members from the Barry Manilow’s Broadway Musical “HARMONY” performing! WOW!  
Needless to say I will continue to send my friends, family and colleagues to stay at The Hotel Edison! 🙏🏻

title: only for the location
text: rooms are so small and very old and worn, dark and gloomy and grey. no water pressure so the shower trickles, air conditioner is so loud and walls are so thin everyone walking the hallway sounds like they are in your room.  staff were unhelpful and unfriendly.

title: Another Good Visit!
text: We had a lovely stay at the Hotel Edison last week.  The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, and we were appreciative of the advice and suggestions from the staff.  We always stay at the Edison when we are in New York, and they never disappoint!

title: Great Location - Loosy Breakfast
text:
The worst breakfast experience I ever had! 
Apart from all other issues I had with the breakfast service, probably the worst thing was that the people servicing breakfast were not friendly at all and I had to start my with them!

title: Für kurze Besuche in Ordnung
text: Wer eine Sightseeing Tour machen für 3-4 Nächte plant und Zentral gelegen sein will ist hier sicher richtig. Für längere Aufenthalte viel zu laut und voll . Hotel etwas in die Jahre gekommen aber zum schlafen reicht es und die Betten sind bequem

title: Central location and handy for everywhere!
text: Hotel Edison is centrally located close to Times Square but not right in the middle of the noise. The rooms are cosy, a little short on space, but I would expect that with such a central location. The facilities were all clean and the beds were very comfortable - extremely important. Even on the 14th floor, the noise from the street was fairly loud so I'd recommend remembering your ear plugs to help block out the taxis honking!

title: Best of New York
text: My week-long stay at the Hotel Edison was enjoyable and satisfying in every way. The accomodations were roomy and comfortable. The hotel's location is fantastic, within quick walking distance of theaters, attractions, restaurants, and subway lines. Checking in and out was expedited and hassle-free. The service staff was always accommodating and responsive to every request. Such attention to detail makes the Edison a memorable and rewarding destination, one to which I will continue to return. Thanks to the hotel staff for their warm and gracious hospitality!

title: Value for money and centrally located
text: At a stone’s throw away from Times Square, this hotel is great value for money. Spacious and well-maintained rooms plus great choice of bars and eateries (including breakfast) at ground floor.

title: Great location, good breakfast to go, nice toiletries, lacking in basic room amenities
text: Great location in Broadway district, close to subway, theatres, restaurants and cafes and places of interest. Nice breakfast to go package. Restaurant does not cater to hotel guests with hotel voucher. No coffee/tea/fridge in rooms unfortunately. Fridge can be rented for $30/night.

title: My favorite NYC hotel
text: I love the Hotel Edison, and have been staying there often on my NYC visits since 2009. Perfectly located close to Broadway theatres and restaurants, this lovely art deco hotel has a great atmosphere and comfortable rooms. The staff are helpful and accommodating, and I like that they offer two options for breakfast that extend to the afternoon, unlike other hotels where breakfast ends at 9:30. It is a short walk away to various subway stations and the Port Authority. I feel safe and taken care of at the Edison.

title: Our New York home -- reasonably price, great location, still fantastic!
text:
We have been staying at the Hotel Edison since 2002, and it's better than ever.  The location is perfect for us -- in the middle of the Theater District.  It is an historic, Deco-era hotel.  Yes, it's old, but I don't go to New York to sit in the hotel room, and it has huge character.

I recommend spending the money if you can for a Signature room rather than the Classic ones (not renovated).  The latter is OK -- when we had less money, we loved the bargain! -- but the Signature Queen or King rooms are far more comfortable.

We'll be back in the fall -- if not sooner.   Love this place!

title: Second time, not as good as the first
text: I went mid week and the place felt like a circus. I requested a king room, received a queen. Upon checkout they asked me why I didn't bring it to their attention. I found that a bit insulting. It was clearly in my reservation and the coordinator made a choice. The price was nearly double of my last visit. Not sure I'd stay here again.

title: Great location
text:
All the staff were very welcoming and the room was clean and tidy upon arrival. We loved the decor of the hotel and the rooms. 
Very comfortable beds, only downside for us was the noise from outside of the constant sirens and car horns. The windows were sealed shut but not enough to prevent noise coming through, even with ear plugs in.
Perfect location for Broadway and Times Square and access to the shops. Central Park and Bryant Park were both just a 15 min walk away.

title: Location in the heart of it all!
text: Great location but rather noisy at night. Thin walls and rooms on the small side. However, friendly doormen, security and concierge who are willing to help.

title: Jenn’s 55th Birthday Trip!❤️‍🔥
text: Our  first girls’ trip to New York City. Chose Hotel Edison because of the price, history, location!, and amenities. The two restaurants and bar within the hotel are great! The live music in The Rum House was fantastic. The staff very accommodating and friendly. The rooms were very clean and the beds super comfortable. We had two connecting rooms with four ladies in each on the 10th floor with a nice view. Would highly recommend the hotel. Loved all the fine decor details. This will be our hotel home each time we return. Thanks Hotel Edison!

title: Review of Edison Hotel
text: Breakfast not included despite the deal was with Breakfast -  they had offered grab & go Breakfast with only Tea or Coffee  with one fruit, One sandwich Epc

title: Wonderful return trip
text: Another superb stay at Hotel Edison. Had good fortune of meeting the owner who was warm and gracious. Staff including Rommel and Bobby were fabulous and all staff greet with warm smiles and appreciation for staying with them. They are upgrading the wifi which is sometimes difficult to access early in the day.

title: Short trip
text: Staff friendly. Room was ok, no frills. Bathroom was ridiculously small, toilette seat squeezed between sink and tub, it was a tight fit to use it. A big person would not be able to sit on it.

title: Would stay here again!
text: I definitely would stay again! Great location and loved everything offered inside hotel. It was also a very cute hotel!

title: Perfect location for all Broadway shows
text: This hotel is perfect for first time New York trips! It's in the center of all the tourist spots and just minutes away from central park. Perfect location for anyone seeing a Broadway show.

title: Great Visit to NYC and Broadway
text: Edison offered a great location to plan to see 2 Broadway shows and a concert at Radio City Music Hall.  Rooms were nice and hotel was clean.  Had better breakfasts at other hotels but not bad.  Only in room mornings and evenings due to taking advantage of what NYC has to offer.  Great visit and would stay there again.

title: Great experience!
text: Had the best experience staying at this beautiful Art Deco hotel!  We drove to NYC and from the first person we met, Bobby, the doorman who welcomed us like we were coming home and took care of parking our car, to the security staff, front desk staff, housekeepers and managers, it was just an awesome experience!  Our requests were met quickly and efficiently. If we had a question about where to go for a meal or how to best get around since a member of our group uses a mobility scooter, advice was readily available.  This hotel is located right in the heart of the theater district and just a short walk from Times Square. It was a perfect location for us to get everywhere we had wanted to go. Had an amazing suite on the top floor, bed was extremely comfortable, and the room was very clean and tidy. I truly cannot say enough good things about our stay at The Edison. But maybe this will say it all, we plan to make another NYC trip in the future and will be returning to this hotel. We won’t have to look anywhere else!  Thanks Edison for a great stay!

title: Great location for stay near theatres
text: Hotel Edison is centrally located in the theatre district with restaurants and the subway not that far away. Room was clean, nicely appointed and had comfortable bedding. Room was small as is common in NYC, but we didn't spend much time in the room. I anticipate booking rooms here in the future.

title: Best location
text:
The hotel impresses with its location on Times Square. For this reason alone, I would stay here again and again. Slowly but surely, however, some things should be renewed, e.g. a hanging device for the bath towels in the bathroom would be helpful. In general, not everything is very up to date. Bathroom and bed were very clean, the rest has probably not seen a duster from nearby for some time. 
Staff very friendly and helpful. 
Always happy to return.

Translated with DeepL.com (free version)

title: Broadway
text: Great location, felt the welcome not adequate, no information given to make it easier to check in. Room was clean.

title: Disappointed
text:
I requested a refrigerator and never got it..the room was too small and the pull out was very uncomfortable and the sink was stopped up.
Mold around the sink

title: Only location
text: The staff were very rod, and the breakfast was very bad and very limited and was the same for all days, I booked bed with breakfast and if you want to take breakfast in restaurant you have to pay 6.5 $ / person which not clear in the booking, I asked for early check in before I travelled and they told that will be according to availability, and when I arrived it was available but they want me to pay 95$ more, the hotel was very expensive and not worth it, I’m not recommended it to anyone.

title: The only place you should stay in NYC!
text: This is the perfect hotel for a trip to New York City! It was in the perfect location! The staff took great care of us and the room was wonderful! I liked that I could walk to most sites and then retreat to a wonderfully comfortable room at the end of the day.

title: Hotel Edison is awesome!  Location, accommodations, and staff all great!
text: Our 3rd stay at Hotel Edison, and we hope to be back again!  Great accommodations and location, staff, and love their dining in Friedman's!  Staff:  Bolivar, Bell; Juana Hskpg; Friedmans: Julia, Brian; Broadway Rose - Food great and service fabulous - Sandrine; Breakfast allowance should be extended to full menu; WiFi in certain areas of the hotel not very fast (lobby e.g.)

title: Very good stay, nearby Time Square
text:
Nice hotel, very good en comfortable beds, cleanless was superb!
In the heart of the city. Everything you want to experience nearby!

title: Great location - 30 seconds from the heart of Times Square; Great value for family
text: We got connecting rooms that would have allowed us as many as 10 people.  This is by far the best priced hotel for that size and this location.  Our family of 6 was very comfortable and enjoyed our stay.   Gym is decent.  Breakfast each morning was a nice perk.  Clean rooms.  Comfortable beds.  No complaints worth mentioning.

title: Todo muy bien.
text: Muy bien todo perfecto. El hotel ubicación ideal limpieza muy buena y habitaciones cómodas no exageradas de grandes pero muy bien .

title: Art Deco Delight
text: Staff and service are excellent; rooms are adequately sized and clean; Grab and Go Breakfast is most convenient; location is great being just off Broadway and near subway; priced competitively; Tuesday Wine Social Hour is entertaining; Rum Bar has great Jazz; and, it's fascinating to encounter so many nice foreign tourists from so many different countries-Walking through the lobby is like passing the Tower of Babel.

title: Great location but airport shuttle not included contrary to hotel description
text: We booked this hotel over another option that was $200 cheaper specifically for the shuttle service, presented as service included, but it’s not included and not available

title: Great location
text: Great location. Friendly atmosphere. Great rooms. Just small problem working the heater. Would return

title: Family holiday
text:
Great staff, lovely rooms with everything needed for an enjoyable and comfortable stay
Excellent location

title: 4 night in NYC
text: Great location and hotel with the qualification that we had an issue with the room AC during the night. Unfortunately this was not resolved and was the only negative on an outwise great stay in New York.

title: Recommend
text: Very friendly and a convenient location. Right by times square and close to the Metro. Would stay again.

title: Royalty at the Hotel Edison
text: From the minute I pulled in my minivan to the Hotel Edison I was greeted with smiles 😀 by doormen (Bobby & Franklin). They parked the car and took my luggage to Fehat✨ . He is in charge of welcoming guests and taking care of luggage. At the  front desk , I was greeted by Marco 🥂 Then after checking in , I met Rommel who is in charge of Guest Relations ⭐️My hotel room was beautiful and in the heart ❤️ of Time Square. All I can say is If  you want to be treated like Royalty, book the Hotel Edison 👑

title: Au cœur de New York
text: Personnel aimable, prestations conformes à nos attentes. Très bon emplacement géographique. Tout le monde est bien attentionné…

title: Amazing Experience at Edison Hotel
text: Amazing hotel!! Perfect location, just 1 or 2 minutes away from the Time Square. The personnel was very kind and helpful, always with a smile in their faces. Beds were soooo comfy and their breakfast really good, specially their croissants! If you’re going to NY, I highly recommend to stay here

title: A great experience
text: The hotel was very nice. Even though our room was across the hall from the elevators we slept soundly. The staff was so friendly and welcoming. Ava in the Bond restaurant was great in helping us decide on a dessert. Hotel Edison is right in Times Square and provides easy access to theatres. We’ll definitely be staying at Edison in the future.

title: Perfect location for theater-goers!
text: I had the best week at the Hotel Edison with my daughters. Our beds were comfortable, breakfast was great and was so convenient, and the staff was so friendly.  Hanniel especially went out of his way to be helpful and kind during our stay, and even remembered my name the next day. I can’t wait to come back!

title: Highly recommend the Hotel Edison!
text: This hotel is perfect for visitors to New York who want to be close to Times Square and are looking for a place where visitors are treated well. The rooms are very clean and well-appointed. There is a choice of restaurants, and a beautiful lobby. The staff, from the Front Desk, Customer Relations,  Security, to the  Concierge and people who work in the Restaurants make the hotel a welcoming and special place to stay.

title: Good Hotel, but there are other options
text: By price should offer more comfort table or desktop in the room (2 people), option for sitting in breakfast is expensive when you including the breakfast in the price. Little space in room is compensated with location.

title: 3 nights stay!
text: Great hotel, great location, rooms cleaned daily to a high standard. Staff kind and helpful, breakfast good, just the perfect NewYork stay. Will definitely return.

title: Good hotel, brilliant location
text: We booked this hotel due to Booking.com canceling our hotel at the last moment we chose this hotel due to location, which is superb if you want to be by the hustle and bustle of Times Square hotel we had a standard queen room room which was small but clean and tidy, and we didn’t spend much time there due to the sightseeing that we were doing I would recommend this hotel to anyone that wants to be in the mix of all the hustle and bustle of New York has to offer is close to everything that you needed

title: Home Away From Home
text: You won’t find a better stay in the city. From the moment you arrive, your importance is made known.  The staff is amazing.  From the doormen, the bellmen, the very efficient front desk staff, the hotel security, housekeeping, and maintenance…all are genuinely anxious to be at your service for anything. The rooms are well equipped, updated with great linens and amenities, comfortable and pristine clean.  The theaters are just a few steps away from the hotel. There are good restaurants at the hotel and all around the hotel. You will not find a better value in the city.

title: Good choice for Times Square.
text: Very close to theaters.  Nice personal welcome from the staff.  Well-appointed room.  Appreciated the art-deco history and theme.

title: Excellent séjour au cœur de New York
text: Conforme à nos attentes, au cœur de New York. Personnel aimable  et accueillant. Très bon petit déjeuner.

title: Excelente
text: Personal amable, en especial Melissa que nos ayudó tanto a resolver un problema que se nos presentó. Fue muy diligente y da ejemplo de lo que es un servicio de excelencia. Hotel está en un punto céntrico. Siempre que voy a Nueva York me quedo ahí.

title: Super séjour
text: Nous avons adoré nos cinq nuits à l'hôtel Edison. Les chambres sont propres et le personnel toujours serviable. Nous reviendrons très certainement dans cet hôtel.

title: Very disappointing
text: First time staying here. Go to check in at 6.50pm at night and our room isn’t ready which after travelling for 10hrs is not great. Eventually get our room, after the shock of you need to pay an extra $40 per night to cover things we didn’t want and it’s not an optional fee. So before we start we are $200 down.   The next disappointment kicks in when we get to the room. Very small, little lighting and if you put anything in the wardrobe you won’t be able to find it without your phone torch. Go for a shower, the water takes 10mins to get anywhere near warm. If you like a hot shower you will need to lower your expectation to luke warm at best. WiFi is one of the things included in the $40 extra per day package you are made to pay for, great if you can get it to work, very intermittent. Go to the Rumhouse for a drink, great atmosphere and the cocktails are amazing if you can get one. Felt so sorry for the lovely lady running around trying to serve everyone whilst her supervisor shuffled glasses around. She really tried her best.  Food was ok no major issues but nothing to get excited about. In summary don’t let the hotel website fool you by its pictures and write up it is a low 3* hotel at best defo no where near a 4*

title: Good location
text:
The hotel is in Times Square so it is easy to get around in the centre.
It was a bit busy but the hotel is big and the staff very kind and helpful. 
I found a bit strange to pay a deposit of 300$ for damages when that wasn't mentioned on the hotel site.
Luckily I had my money back in a few days after I was home.

title: NYC
text: We were satisfied with our stay here. Only disappointment was the breakfast. It was only available for two people even though I had a room reserved for four people.

title: Huge Disappointment
text: Stayed evening of 4/27 - Let me start by saying that this is the worst hotel that we've ever stayed at in NYC -- Big mistake staying here as I tried to book close to the theatre district and also Times Square and needed a room for 4 adults. The location was actually perfect, but the hotel was terrible. Let's start with Valet -- guys are friendly and kind, but website states $85 for large vehicle (Large SUVs or trucks) -- when we got there, they charged us $95 because we were in a Ford F-150 and they said it was considered a larger than large vehicle -- I guess a large vehicle takes up 2 spaces rather than just 1 like every other parking lot in America (insert sarcasm here). We arrived in the morning and I just wanted to leave our bags with the bell captain since I knew check-in wasn't until 3pm. I went up to the rudest reception I've ever encountered. I've honestly never seen a ruder reception staff in my entire life and we travel a lot and globally. She told me that room wasn't ready, which I already figured, and that they would text me when it was ready. OK, no problem at all... we left at 11am and went on about our day. Came back at 4:30pm and I went up to the unfriendly reception area again and told another rude staff member that I had already checked in that morning, but never received a call or text that our room was ready. She was annoyed at me and HAD to see my license and credit card AGAIN and finally gave us our room keys. We went up to our room and it was just terrible. The bathroom was ridiculously small - again, this is a room for 4 adults. No counter space for anything. There was no mini fridge in the room -- my father is diabetic and needs to keep his insulin refrigerated! What hotel doesn't have a mini fridge -- even something tiny?? I couldn't even believe it. Then the darn air conditioner sounded like an old lawnmower that wouldn't crank every single time it went off. We literally were kept up all night with the noise!!! (Room 1635) How is this even possible when we paid almost $600 for one night????? THEN, I paid for the breakfast included rate only to find out that breakfast was ONLY grab and go and you'd be charged if you wanted to sit and eat AND even though I clearly booked a room for 4 adults, we were only allowed 2 breakfast items for 2 people.... WHAT??? How much can you seriously nickel and dime people? I didn't even bother with them anymore and went to Friedman's for breakfast with my family. Terrible birthday accommodations!!

title: Excellent séjour !
text:
J’ai longtemps hésité à réserver cet hôtel en raison de nombreux avis négatifs mais je ne regrette pas !!!Hotel très bien situé, style rétro-américain.( façade en travaux actuellement dommage ça gâche la vue de l’hôtel)
Voiturier en costume traditionnel devant...
Literie très confortable, chambre petite propre (pour 6).
Lits refait tous les jours, avec changement de serviettes...
Personnel très agréable et sympathique.
Nous avions l'option petit déjeuner à emporter.
On pouvait choisir entre 1 croissant ou 1 fruit / 1 burger œuf-bacon ou végétarien / boisson au choix. Très bon copieux... nous le mangions dans notre chambre mais on pouvait s'installer à table si on voulait sans supplément.
Machine à café en chambre ! Café fourni très bon ! Frigo et bouteilles d’eau mises à disposition tous les jours . D’abord on en recevait que 3 pour 6 mais on pouvait en demander gratuitement à l’accueil puis on en a eu 6 en fin de séjour…

•Les points négatifs : La climatisation qu'on arrivait pas à faire fonctionner. Tous les jours un technicien passait dans notre chambre l'allumer.Des qu’elle s’éteignait plus moyen de l’activer… et pas possible d’ouvrir les fenêtres… il faisait vite chaud en chambre…
La Salle de bain était un peu petite pour 6 mais propre et fonctionnelle.
Je recommande cet hôtel

title: Great place to stay in Times Square!
text: Location, price, and cleanliness can't be beat. Love the art deco decor of the lobby area. A jewel in the heart of Times Square.

title: A uniquely NYC Experience
text: My wife and I have stayed at the Edison since the 1980’s. It remains at the top of our list and it icaptures the flavor of NYC

title: Excellent
text: Muy buen servicio , recomendado 100%… muy buena ubicación,, el personal muy amable y servicial,, con dos restaurantes conectados con el hotel… a media cuadra de time square….:):):)

title: Excellent  is was a good service and the staff was very nice
text: It’s was my daughter birthday and I was happy that they but a card and a bottle champagne the staff was very nice and make us very happy

title: Breakfast minus
text: Overall the experience was great. The only remark is about the breakfast. At the grab and go was mostly crowdy and the lines were too long. If i wanted to sit and eat, i had to pay 6.5 dollars, and that is a minus.

title: Nice Stay at the Hotel Edison!
text:
Staff was friendly.  Hotel was clean.  Bed was nice.  Great location in the heart of the theatre district.
.

title: Character
text:
Enjoyed our stay here and would book again!  Great staff, appreciated the grab n go breakfast, walking tours, and perfect location for the theaters! 

Lots of good touristy activities in walking distance including Rockefeller center, Radio City Music Hall, Grand Central Station, Bryant Park.

title: Très confortable et bonne localisation
text:
Un énorme hôtel situé en plein cœur de Time Square. Très confortable, nous avions une chambre Queen Room signature pour la moins chère, elle était très très spacieuse et tout confort. 
Le ménage est fait tous les jours si besoin et le personnel est très souple et très accueillant . Les petits déjeuners sont compris, mais ne sont pas à prendre sur place.
Je recommande à 100 %

title: Nice stay in this classic hotel
text: This is a classic hotel. Some of the rooms are dated but the common areas are well taken care of. Staff were very nice. They have a grab and go breakfast and the breakfast voucher allows you to pick fruit or a pastry, yogurt or a breakfast sandwich and a coffee or tea . This was very welcome. We enjoyed our stay.

title: Better than expected
text: Great location and art deco vibe. Had to pay $39 extra to check in 1.5 hours early. Clean, staff very nice and helpful,room very quiet. Very close to longacre theater where I went to see Lempicka

title: Girlfriend weekend
text: The Edison is in a prime location for Broadway shows.  The security is excellent and we always feel safe there.  Staff are friendly and helpful.  Restaurants are good.  It’s so nice to have the option for a quick bite at the hotel.  Housekeeping services are excellent.

title: Highly Recommended
text: Wonderful staff. Very professional, welcoming, and helpful. Clean room, comfortable bed. Great location for Times Square/theater tripping. Food at Friedman's was very good, and I enjoyed the singing wait staff!

title: Localisation très bruyante
text: Localisation centrale mais hyper bruyante. Isolation mauvaise. Bruit de la rue même la nuit, qui peut réveiller ou empêcher de dormir.

title: Stinky bedding
text: Disgusting pillows with sweat odour. Asked the front to replace the stinky pillows but didn't even bother for the full 24 hours. But still, the odour remained on the replaced pillows.

title: Second stay
text: Helpful and friendly staff.  Quite in the location of our room both stays.  Easy to get to restaurants and Time Square.

title: Basic rooms with no kettle or coffee. Abit dated. Excellent location and lovely staff
text: Basic room with no coffee or kettle. Excellent location right next to Times Square. Wall sockets abit dodgy. Very clean and comfortable beds and lovely and welcoming staff

title: Really wonderful customer service!
text: The customer service at Hotel Edison is absolutely above and beyond superior. I want to specifically call out and thank Shonda at the front desk who entirely made my day. My plans changed and she took the time to help me out and really saved me, when the fault was entirely mine. Thank you so much, Shonda!

title: Needs a little updating but can't beat the location
text: We had a three night stay over a long weekend in mid-April (MA school vacation week). The hotel location is perfect for catching shows on Broadway. The staff was nice and we enjoyed the evening wine hour on Friday. The room left a bit to be desired. We were in 1912 -- the 19th floor looked much more outdated than some of the floors we saw on the way up the elevator. Maybe it hasn't been renovated yet? The room itself (Standard King Suite) would have been fine but the pull out sofa bed (our two kids were sleeping on it) was missing a bunch of attachments holding the bed to the outside frame. We assumed it wouldn't be really comfortable (they never are) but didn't expect broken. Our bed (king) could have used a new mattress and quite a few of the drawer fronts on the bedroom dresser were held together with dark tape. The window screen was broken too -- sounds nitpicky, but when you take all of these odd / broken things together it feels a bit rundown. The price was reasonable for the area but not cheap. We loved the hustle and bustle in the lobby and the proximity to the theaters.

title: New York experience
text: Our room was recently renovated with new wallpaper and light fixtures. The room and bed were comfortable and clean. All the staff we talked with were helpful and friendly. They seemed to be proud of the Edison. Located off the north end of Broadway the location was great to experience midtown and get access to the south end.

title: Wonderful Stay; Helpful Employees
text: I had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Edison. The hotel is very centrally located and convenient, and the staff was extremely friendly. I forgot my car keys in the room and did not realize until after I was on a train back to Washington DC. The security team, specifically Danny, JB, Alex, Jahaida, and Jay, were all very friendly and very communicative in helping to ship my keys back to me!

title: No colmó las expectativas
text:
El hotel está bien ubicado. La atención en recepción de la Sra Marisela fue excelente y también la de la Sra Silvia del servicio de habitaciones. 
El resto del personal no trata con amabilidad ni es simpático.
Las camas son cómodas y las habitaciones están bien equipadas. 
El desayuno en el hotel es pésimo, pocas opciones, malas y con malos modos del personal. El desayuno en la esquina en Carve tiene variadas opciones, de buena calidad y con un trato excelente de su personal.

title: It was a great experience.
text:
I have stayed at Hotel Edison before and this time was just as wonderful. Hanniel at the front desk was fantastic when we were checking in.  He was very thorough in his explanations of various things.  He was also very patient with me as i had to make a call to help along the check in process he was not annoyed by this delay. 
He was amazing  and i thank him for that. 
The hotel is just great they are on top of the room cleanliness making sure all was stocked and clean for us each day.
The staff over all was great and easy to deal with.  
The resteraunt /bar attached to hotel was phenomenal as well.
Thank you Hotel Edison  i am sure you will see me again

title: Expensive for the condition and value
text:
If you want busy you are right in Times Square. 
It’s noisy, expensive for what you don’t get, bring a cooler. No coffee or fridge in room. Beds are hard, parking is $70/day. Does not include hot or buffet breakfast as they say. Includes egg and cheese sandwich to go or sit, drink and a fruit. Basic!  Hot discounted breakfast is at Friedmans. Paid $1300 for 3 nights in a room with one queen, no view just walls and debris and air conditioners. Lots of kids sports teams staying there. Was loud on our floor. Did NOT sleep well. Would probably choose a location out of Times Squareif there is a next time and just walk to Times Square as everything is within walking distance or subway.

title: Well located for sight seeing
text: The hotel is well located for sight seeing as it is very close to Times Square.  The rooms are a bit old and on the small side and dark.  The Hotel is very large with many big groups of people so unfortunately the noise level at all times of the night with people coming and going was loud.

title: Amazing hotel
text: We could not have asked for a better location, the staff at the front desk and at security stations were very friendly,  the toom was very clean and comfortable.

title: Nice location but a bit noisy
text:
The Edison hotel is just a few meters from Times Square, amazing location to enjoy Broadway and the shows of Times Square.
All the employees are nice and the rooms are comfortable and have a nice size to accommodate everyone.
The only thing on the down side was the noise from the outside AC blocks on the 46th…

title: Concierge misleading on tour voucher
text:
Hotel stay was generally OK, however, first night no sleep as room was extremely noisy, had to change rooms at 2am to quieter room. Grab and go breakfast disappointing and ran out of food prior to 11am cut off. Option to pay 6.50 dollars for sit down, rather misleading when saying breakfast included.
Conciege misleading us when paying for tour tickets totalling 350 dollars for a pair as twin towers museum not included and they specifically said it was. No apology when discussing on return to hotel and simply blaming everyon else apart from themselves.

title: Highly Recommend
text:
Great staff. Readily accessible for inquiries. 
 Comfortable, clean rooms. Location excellent for theater district and public transportation. Also close to many restaurant options. Love the art in the lobby.
Alos enjoyed the wine and music offered on certain nights.

title: HOtel Edison is the best
text: I love the "Gatsby" theme of this hotel, its location, the friendliness of all the staff.  It's my "always stay" place when I go to NYC to visit my son, shows, food, etc.!

title: Great Hotel Experience
text: Fun budget hotel, with interesting past.  Room small, but comfortable for 4 people. Very Times Square (crazy, but secure) atmosphere.  Loved both Bond45 and Friedman's restaurants, and appreciated the hotel vouchered breakfasts!  Free Times Square/Rockefeller tour with Sonya offered through hotel was high point of the trip!

title: Lost and Found
text: I left some souvenirs behind in the hotel room when we left to come home.  I reached out to lost and found and received a timely response about my items.  I was sent the instructions to follow and with help of Danny, JB, Alex, Jahaida, Jay, I received my items in the mail about a week or so later.  Great customer service!  Thank you so much!

title: Je recommande
text: L'hôtel est parfaitement placé et permet de voir Time Square dans tous ses états (jour, nuit, petit matin...). Au delà de son emplacement de choix je recommande cet hôtel pour son confort, sa propreté, l'accueil qui nous a été réservé (merci Christina 😉). Nous étions au 21 ème étage avec on mari, côté rue et entendions les sirènes de loin sans que cela ne soit gênant. Ma maman et mes enfants étaient au 12ème étage côté intérieur sans aucun bruit mais sans vue dans un étage totalement rénové. Les chambres sont parfaitement propres, la literie est hyper confortable !!! Nous avions de l'eau chaude sans aucunes difficultés, la chambre etait faite chaque jour... Seul bémol, le petit déjeuner. Vous avez le choix entre le petit dej au rez-de-chaussée de l'hôtel au Bond 45 où vous pourrez vous assoire gratuitement mais pas très bon ou le Brooklyn Deli bien meilleur, à 5 minutes à pieds où pouvez prendre à emporter sinon vous devez payer 6,50 par personne hors tips pour vous assoire.  Cependant Christina nous a offert les petits dej de la 5eme personne  alors que l'offre prévoyez 2 petit dej par chambre donc nous nousnplaigons pas. Superbe hôtel, je ne comprends absolument pas les commentaires vu avant mon arrivée. Je recommande et je reviendrai si j'ai la chance de revenir à New-York.

title: Excelente ubicacion
text:
El hotel tiene una excelente ubicacion.   A unos 100 metros de Times Square. En todo el Middletown. Lo que facilita el ver la ciudad sin perder el tiempo en traslados. 
Los empleados hablan español la mayoría. Eso es otro punto a su favor, ya que te facilita las cosas. 
El desayuno me decepcionó un poco. Te dan 3 opciones. La primera es a elegir un plátano, manzana o un croasant. La segunda eliges entre una especie de hamburguesa o un yogurt con arándanos y crispiss. Y la tercera opción es un café, te, zumo de naranja o agua. 
El desayuno es para llevar o tomarlo en el Salón y como llegues un poco tarde sobre las 10.00, ya no tienes para elegir, solo lo que queda. 
Aunque el desayuno no fue del todo de mi satisfacción hay que reconocer que desayunar fuera es carísimo. 
Por lo demás diría que es una buena opcion elegir este hotel.

title: Très bon hôtel
text: Situation parfaite. Chambre spacieuse et confortable mais beaucoup de poussière. Bagagerie payante!!!! Un dollar par valise. Jamais vu cela auparavant.

title: Birthday visit
text: If you are a tourist visitor this is the best location in New York,  have a block from Time Square,  close to all Broadway theaters,  good restaurants and bars around. Friendly and professional staff. Comfortable rooms, they clean and make the rooms daily.

title: New York City hotel Times Square
text: Great hotel, location is amazing to fill the whole New York  experience. I have stayed there three times all three times was happy as everything in there you need from a hotel.including great Restarant for breakfast and a great restaurant for dinner. Also a great bar for late night drinks. I will return and I recommend. PS, you literally step out your hotel in Tim Square.

title: Beautifully Friendly Experience
text: Beautiful hotel, with great restaurants, ver helpful and friendly staff. The breakfast at Friedman’s was plentiful and delicious, and the reduced rate vouchers were a nice touch!  Overall, a wonderful experience for my son and me at the Edison Hotel ☺️

title: Great for a Broadway visit
text: I really enjoyed my stay. Room was clean, staff was exceptionally helpful and friendly. Location is perfect if you are attending shows.

title: Good location but not again
text: Great location but heating did not work, no hot water, fridge not working, tiny room. Grab and go breakfast not great. They’ve received same reviews on booking and replied with the same response. Clearly they have not taken any action

title: great home base for our sight seeing trip with our kids age 12-18
text: plenty of room in our family sized room for 2 adults and 3 teen kids.  The housekeeping was impeccable, and we appreciated the restocking of water bottles each day for our daily outings.  We parents appreciated the very hip Rum Room for evening cocktails with the kids safely in the room!

title: Bas stay. Helpless staff of the hotel
text:
Room dors not corresponding to the reservation made on Booking.
Booking and the hôtel we re totally helpless

title: Love this place!
text: I got this place recommended to me by a friend and the location was perfect for my vacation so I booked it. It did not disappoint! Super friendly staff, very clean rooms, and the restaurants are amazing!

title: Polite workers
text: The front desk agent Christina was very pleasant and nice easy going and gave great information I hope she gets recognized for this review cause she deserves it.

title: Charming hotel
text:
The hotel is quite charming in a classic way, with beautiful golden era restaurants and bars.
This is steps away from Times Sq, so the area is very busy around the hotel.
The building itself is well maintained, but the room we were in was tiny, as expected, and the bathroom smaller than we wished for. It feels like a water closet, albeit with a working tub.

title: Highly recommend paying for a room upgrade!
text:
We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Edison, however we had booked with Love Holidays (UK) and I do have a couple of gripes with them.  

Upon booking (a year ago) we had paid extra for a room upgrade as this holiday was for our 25th wedding anniversary and a dream destination for us both, however what we received was absolutely tiny and extremely disappointing. (Room 223) It was nothing like the photo's that were advertised. It consisted of a tiny box room at the end of a long dingy corridor, with a bed that you could barely walk around and the smallest bathroom I've ever seen.   
We did speak to a man on reception (I wish I had got his name because he was excellent) who offered us an upgrade to a suite (Room 831).  We did have to pay an additional $229.50 for this but it was worth it as the room we were given was huge. It had a large bathroom, separate lounge with sofa, chairs, coffee table and tv, a huge bedroom with an enormous bed and tv, Air conditioning in both rooms, fridge, robes, coffee making facilities, hairdryer, extra pillows, safe etc.  It was absolutely lovely and made our stay extra special.  
It was just a shame that we had to pay twice for an upgrade. 

My other gripe with Love Holidays is that on booking we had also paid extra for the 'Bed and Breakfast' option.  Once we reached the hotel, we discovered that we had to pay a daily 'Facility Fee' ($40 plus taxes) which included the Grab and Go breakfast.  So why Love Holidays offered us an upgrade to include breakfast (at additional cost) is beyond me.  We asked the staff about it and they too were baffled. 
The grab and go breakfast was basically a coffee and a pastry (or $6.50pp to sit down and have breakfast with not much more choice on the menu) so we actually didn't use that at all anyway and headed to Juniors every morning.  

But this review is about Hotel Edison...
Over all the Hotel was great.  Very old fashioned but that was to be expected with the theme of the place.  

It was clean, comfortable and the hotel staff were very good. 

The location is amazing.  A stones throw from Times Square and just a short walk to Central Park.  Pretty much everything is in walking distance or a short train ride away.

NB: there is no roof terrace (Again shown in the photos) :(

Would we stay here again? Yes.

title: Avoid this hotel
text: The hotel is a dump, no hot water and low pressure in shower. Luke warm at best. Complained to manager and they said they had to send engineering to inspect room and that no one else complained. Funny how sink water was nice and hot. Don’t know if anyone ever did come to room after we were out as no messages or follow up from manager/staff. Wife pointed out how shower lever would only go part way limiting both hot shower temp and  pressure. See disgusting pic of bathtub. Toilet paper holder wedged behind toilet seat. No one thinking about hotel guests when they designed this place. Poor temperature control in room and flipped between a sauna or freezing with loud air conditioning. Thus sleep constantly disrupted. Our  floor stank of paint as they are painting some rooms. Should close floors under Reno as so not welcoming and offensive eye burning smell of paint While location is good, I recommend avoiding until they get their act together.

title: 2nd time around
text: I stayed here last year for my birthday and decided to stay here again for my birthday. I received the same great service from the staff. I'll be back next year.

title: Excellent hotel with superb customer service
text: one of our favorite hotels to stay at. Not only for location but mostly, for its customer service. During this visit, Christina greeted us and checked us in. She was SUPERB! She was caring, pleat and did everything to accommodate our last minute request. Excellent customer service!

title: Très bon emplacement. Peu bruyant, confortable, petit déjeuner à revoir.
text: The location of the hotel is perfect.  The family rooms are very good, the mattresses are comfortable and spacious.  No particular noise except for the modest air conditioning and a faulty refrigerator which made a high-pitched noise when it turned on forcing us to turn it off.  The cleaning was pretty well done with the exception of the dust on the furniture (after a week, it is particularly visible).  The reception staff at the hotel at check-in and check-out were friendly and welcoming, even knowing how to speak French!  Note one point of improvement: breakfast.  First of all, this is not actually included in the booking formula formulated as “breakfast included”.  This actually only gives access to a sit-down breakfast, the rest requires payment with little choice at a relatively high price.  With the exception of the waitress Alisson who was very good and attentive to her guests, all of the servers are not particularly well trained and act a little disorderly leading to waiting times and reformulations of  identical wishes to each of them.  Finally, it is not up to the standards of the hotel to make hotel guests wait in the corridor to get a table for breakfast when several tables are actually free.  Management and reception at this level need to be reviewed at least by distinguishing between hotel guests and external guests.

title: Our go to Hotel from now on!
text: Staff was extremely accommodating and hotel was beautiful. Each day we came back to an extremely clean room.  We appreciate all the care put into our stay!

title: Historic, Charming, and Secure
text: I love the Hotel Edison. I have stayed there about a dozen times starting in 2013.   It is right in the heart of the Times Square area so after a show I am always walking back to Times Square instead of away from it -- feels much safer. The hotel has 2 very good restaurants which is convenient. The employees are friendly and helpful.   I particularly like the Security Staff who are stationed at the elevators keeping watch on who goes up and down, in and out.  Most of the rooms have been refurbished as has the lobby.  Historic and charming.

title: Quite a nice surprise. Room reality didn't match reality in our case.
text:
The art deco and history were enough to catch our eye when looking for a hotel in the theater district. That and the hotel has valet parking. It was like taking a step back in time (they've left in the glass mail slots from when folks actually wrote letters). The lobby is small and busy, but the staff - bellhops and clerks - were up to the task. The two restaurants, Friendman's and Bond 45, were nice surprises; recommend making reservations on OpenTable because they're always packed. 

Not all is perfect. We reserved a "King Terrace" room based on the description on their website and, sadly, reality did not match the picture nor the description. There is a terrace, but the door to it is locked and the room was really quite small (the one in the picture shows much more walking space in the room than we had). Since this was our first stay, I'm hoping that other forms of the terraced rooms are closer to the picture. Also, the picture shows three sets of windows - our room had two but one had an air-conditioner unit in it. There was a space-header to heat the room. 

It that sounds a bit too much of a throw-back, there are modern amenities. The Wifi was excellent and security seemed very good (example, you need to show your card-key to a guard to access the elevators and you need to swipe your key in order to select a floor or to request an elevator from a floor).

title: Value and location
text: If you are looking for a central location in Times Square and a hotel that is on the lower end of pricing, Hotel Edison is great. If you are looking for a quiet, renovated room with a decent size bathroom, this is not your hotel.

title: Art Deco delights!
text: Hotel Edison was recommended to me because I love art deco design. Hotel Edison did not disappoint in that regard or any other. The grab'n'go breakfasts are tasty and well presented with some nods to ecology such as using a paper bag rather than plastic. The complimentary wine hour on Tues and Fri is such a hospitality plus. Our room was clean, bathroom well-appointed, staff very friendly, and the Rum Room was a pleasure to have as easy access before or after a Broadway show.

title: It was fine.
text: Great location. Room was clean. A chair would be nice. Lobby was chaotic at all times. Free breakfast was fine. Servers were pretty rude though.

title: Great service and security
text: Fantastic service great value and great location. The security much better than other properties in the area! Breakfast was an added bonus!!

title: Loyal return customer
text: Best location, fantastic staff, safe environment, good restaurant and bar with live music…very cosmopolitan atmosphere

title: Good stay
text: Overall happy with Hotel Edison. Lighting in our room was not good and sink didn’t drain well but overall was fine.

title: Great Location for theatre going
text: The hotel is right in the heart of Times Square, within walking distance of all the theatres.  Great restaurants right in the hotel.

title: Great Value hotel for seeing Broadway shows
text: Really enjoyed my stay at Hotel Edison. The location is ideal for seeing Broadway shows (all within walking distance) as well as Rockefeller Center.  The lobby area is beautifully finished in historic Art Deco style, and my room had high end finishes as well.  The room was very clean and comfortabe and staff was super friendly and helpful.  The concierge graciously helped me book a shuttle trip to LGA the day of my departure (lesson learned=book the day before!).  And Friedman's restaurant is a great value and delicious.  The staff is attentive there as well.  Highly recommend.  I'll stay here again on my next trip.

title: Always a joy, but this was the best stay!
text: Hotel Edison has been my consistent go to spot for my travels to NYC, just steps away from Times Square.  Hanniel warmly greeted me at the front desk after a long day of travel.  The check-in process was easy, and I was quickly on my way to my room.  To my great surprise, I was upgraded to a signature king suite on the top floor.  The suite was spacious and quite the treat with a bedroom, living room - both with TVs and temperature controls - and a huge walk in shower.  I always appreciate the breakfast vouchers.  While I heard some noises when sirens were blaring - they should be quieter at night! - the hotel and staff quality, convenient location, and consistently great experiences made a difference.  I will be back, again!

title: Small and Not the cleanest
text: The first one we got into was connecting rooms. My son walked over by the air conditioner, which is where you would have to get onto the bed and his socks got soaked not wet soaked then we went into the bathroom and the door knob fell off in our hand, so we waited 30 minutes for a room change when they cannot give us connecting rooms they gave us two rooms next to each other they did not include couches , the connecting rooms came with a couch in each room we got charged the same price as the connecting rooms. The new separate rooms were smaller One of the rooms had clean towels, but had paint or tar like stuff on them. I called down for towels and it took a day and a half to get new ones and only after  speaking to a manager we got some he did give us a small discount he was nice though .

title: Not Worth the Money
text: I had an AC that didn't work so I had to change rooms at midnight. No apologies. When I called the front desk on multiple occasions there was NO answer. I had to go downstairs to the front desk and, sure enough, there were two people just standing there. Once both card keys didn't work. The gym equipment is out of the stone age. I could go on...

title: Very noisy
text: The room let in a lot of noise even for New York Standards. Not my first time in New York. Garbage truck at 1:30am. Noisy construction in the morning. Trying to sleep with noise is not great when u been out all day. Otherwise staff was great and got me some ear plugs. I shouldn’t have to use ear plugs to sleep.

title: Hotel Edison Central Location
text: The location is superb if you are visiting for a musical and want access to restaurants, shopping, and the subway. Sure you can hear some city noises…but isn’t that part of the experience? They will store your luggage for a dollar which was very convenient. Grab and go breakfast was convenient. Thanks Cristian for your patience and help.

title: Great time
text: Christina at the Front Desk was very accommodating!  We had friends traveling with us and she did her best to get us all on the same floor.

title: Love Hotel Edison
text: Very clean and friendly!! The staff was very helpful with anything we needed! We will definitely be back to stay at Hotel Edison!!

title: Top hotel
text:
This was our 3rd stay at Hotel Edison all the staff from front desk to the cleaning team makes your stay pleasurable.
We will be back again soon 😁

title: Hotel Edison, you will not be disappointed
text: The Hotel Edison staff was awesome and took care of all of our needs. The hotel Edison location is second  to none and right on top of all the Broadway shows that we wanted to see, literally minutes away from each and every show. When we go back to New York, I guarantee you we will stay at Hotel Edison.

title: If you want to feel like Queens….
text:
From literally accompanying me to different rooms for the perfect selection, to assisting me at every point throughout my stay, the Hotel Edison staff made me and my daughter feel like their most important priority. I can’t express enough how willing they were to drop everything the second I had a request to focus on me and make sure my experience was absolutely perfect. They also had diligent security at all of the hotel elevator access points, which made me feel very safe traveling with my young child. We had a busy trip and opted to eat at the hotel most nights - because their restaurants are *incredible*. What an unexpected blessing for our slammed schedule!! Even after my stay, the staff helped re-route a package sent there for me. This kind of service is other-worldly!! 

If you want to feel like royalty, this is the hotel for you. I’ve already rebooked and can’t wait!! As an admittedly high-maintenance traveler as far as expectations, I’m rarely blown away. Hotel Edison gets ALL the stars. ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

title: Girls' weekend
text: What a great hotel! Perfect for our girls' trip. Christina was great with the check in process. Love the beautiful art deco decor! Great options for breakfast, perfect location just off Times Square. We will definitely be back for another trip!

title: Never Again
text:
From our '5 star stay in 2023 to one star in 2024.  The Edison caters to conventions and large groups which leaves individuals taking the leftovers.  

After traveling all day, it took four rooms to find one as a suitable last resort to the first three (and it required AC maintenance and safe replacement at move-in).  It proved that the online photos are not what you get and that the desk people have no idea about the rooms they assign. The first two ''terrace'' (a 2 foot suicide step out from the window) rooms were too small to photograph and thus, not part of their internet options.  The 3rd room they assigned us was under construction with materials covering 'every' window view (photos), though the windows in the accepted room were so dirty, it should have been embarrassing.  Note: our reservations were made 8 months in advance so there was plenty of notice prior to arrival.  Never again.

title: Great Stay in New York City
text: The rooms are small but the beds are comfortable and the staff is wonderful. We also had a great experience at the Rum House and Bond 45. I highly recommend trying both places. The location is great. Right next to Time Square, 20 min walk to Empire State Building, and 15 min walk to Central Park.

title: Location, location, location.
text: This hotel is 58 steps from Broadway and Times Square, and yes, we counted!! They are right in the theatre district steps away from the theatres, and restaurants. There are two restaurants in the Edison, although we usually go explore the city and find new restaurants. The staff members are always helpful and easy to work with.  The rooms vary in size, but are always clean and well kept up. While everything in NYC is expensive, I think we get the best value for our money with the Edison. Over the years we have tried a couple other hotels near Times Square and nothing compared value wise. It's a great place to stay!

title: Prime location, good value for price. Hits and misses.
text:
This is an iconic art deco hotel at a prime location and a very busy one.

Positives:
Location. Literally 10 steps from Time square. Two restaurants and a bar are in the same building. Breakfast discount vouchers are provided (set menu for discounted price but not included in room rate) and breakfast is very good.
Nice, comfortable bed, clean bathroom, clean and soft towels, good quality bedding.
Old style but nice furniture in the room.
Cleanliness ,while not perfect, is acceptable.
Good size tv, comfortable to watch from bed. Huge selection of channels including movie channels. 
Wi-Fi is good quality, good enough for streaming, too. Better than in most nearby restaurants where even google maps would load as Wi-Fi was spotty due to weather. So hotel’s connectivity is reliable.
Concierge is kind ( I met 2, it is true for both), helpful and professional.
Security by elevators and guests must show their keys to gain access.

Should be improved:
- heating up to 72F in daytime was a challenge, took hours and still did not reach the set temperature. No blankets are provided only the bedding. Having said that it wasn’t cold, it remained above 68F mostly. Was warmer in the evening.
- fan is very old, as loud  as a tractor plowing a field, nothing else can be heard while it’s on;
- they asked how many people in the room, looked at my passport and decided that I do not count for much ( based on the impolite tone of voice), then gave me a smaller than small sized room at a lower floor overlooking a noisy back alley service area,
- room does not resemble to the classic room they post the pictures of online;
- bathroom is clean enough but dated
As to the restaurants:
Friedman’s:
- Staff especially Julia and Allison are very nice and capable
- Food is of good quality. Everything I tried was excellent.
- For some reason they keep seating the hotel guest to the front by the windows where it is colder. But if asked they were willing to sit me elsewhere;
Bond45:
- had dinner here, ended up impressed by the ambiance and interior and unimpressed with the food. Interpretation of carbonara was a large portion of bland pasta silkily covered in egg mixture but without distinct taste of pecorino/parmesan and only 2,5 cubes of guanciale on top, none in the sauce. Interpretation of sautéed broccoli looked more life leafy greens and was cold.

title: Hotel Edison Check In
text: Christine was awesome on helping me check in I had a few errors on my bill. She remedied it right away. The hotel is in a great location right next to times square and Hells Kitchen. Lots of great restaurants close and walkable to everything times square.

title: You won't be disappointed!
text:
This hotel exceeded all my expectations! It was clean, comfortable, secure, had a fantastic location (close to so many theaters!) and every staff member I encountered was friendly and helpful. Latoya checked us in around 12:30 a.m. We were tired but she was kind and patient with us. She gave us an envelope with our meal vouchers and she took the time to wriur breakfast options and times they were available because she could clearly tell that our brains were fried!  Our room was missing the coffee maker and when we called down to see if we could get one ahead of the morning, they had it to us in 10 minutes! 

This was a Mother/Daughter trip so two moms and two teens. We booked a Signature 2 Queen Beds room and it was perfect. The bathroom is small but we made it work. There are also plenty of elevators so you aren't waiting forever to get to your room. This is an older hotel but is well cared for and has character.

We enjoyed a glass of wine during Wine Hour and if we had stayed longer would have done the walking tour. We enjoyed Friedman's sit down breakfast and Bond 45's Grab and Go breakfasts. I am gluten free so Friedmans was such a treat! We also had dinner there and enjoyed the singing waitstaff. They were all incredibly talented and fun.  I highly recommend checking out Gayle's Gypsy Rose. 

If you want a great hotel near the theaters and Times Square, you should definitely book The Hotel Edison.

title: NY NY
text:
A lovely hotel..situated in an excellent location minutes from Times square and all the theaters. The staff are friendly and helpful and the rooms are clean. 
Christina who received us when we arrived was amazing.. patient helpful and friendly.

title: Safe and Convenient - close to theaters, Times Square, subway and restaurants.
text:
I've stayed at and recommended this hotel a few times and always had a good experience.    

Clientele:    Lots of international school / travel groups and families.    

Location:   In the middle of the Theater District (literally next to Six and across the street from Hamilton).   1 block from Times Square.   A couple of blocks from two main subway stations - 50th or 42nd - that take you anywhere (straight to LGA, downtown to Staten Island Ferry, etc.).   

Airport travel:   From LGA, Q70 bus to Roosevelt Station and either the E or 7 train straight to the hotel area.   $3.25, safe and fast.   You can buy a single ride ticket at the station with cash or card.    Navigate with Google or Safari maps - no app needed.

Safety:   Went with a group of women and we never felt unsafe.   Only saw a couple of homeless people the entire time we were in Manhattan.   If there is a drug, homeless or immigrant problem here - we didn't see it.

Value:   There were 10 of us in 3 rooms (2 double queens with twin pull out and 1 double queen / King family room).    The rooms were clean and comfortable.    1525, 1510, 1511.   We got breakfast vouchers each morning to use downstairs for pickup breakfast (very good - fruit, egg /cheese bagel  or parfait / coffee or juice) or use throughout the city at designated places.

title: Prime Location, Yet Needs Management Refinement
text:
Hotel Edison boasts a prime location in the vibrant heart of Times Square, offering convenient access to Broadway shows and numerous attractions within walking distance. Its proximity to the subway ensures easy connectivity to other parts of the city.
The rooms are spacious and clean, providing a comfortable retreat after a long day of exploring the city. However, the mattresses may be too firm for some guests' preferences. While the bathroom amenities were adequate, it's worth noting that they were not replenished during our five-day stay.
For the most part, the staff was friendly and welcoming. Unfortunately, there were instances where security staff exhibited unacceptable behavior, including shouting at guests, which left a negative impression. Additionally, management could improve by considering group breakfast packages for larger parties, as our request for 18 breakfasts over five days was not accommodated.

title: Great Hotel and staff!
text: Good service from check in to check out. Maria at check in was great! Justin was very helpful as well. Room was very clean, bed comfortable, bathroom a little small but spotless. Issue with Ac was dealt with immediately. Wine hour and entertainment were great!

title: Great location and good room size for NYC
text:
Stayed at the Edison for 3 nights at the start of a much longer trip in the US. 

On first arrival it has to be said the hotel is somewhat chaotic with the reception area being in a bit of a walk through. The downstairs of the hotel is also not like other hotels where you would expect somewhere to sit and relax or a hotel bar. There is a bar but it’s not somewhere you would take kids. 

We booked a family suite and it was excellent. The kids room had two queen beds and loads of space for them. The other room had a good sized bed and and the bathroom. Really good size for NYC. 

The hotel is really well located, right on Times Square, which can get very very busy, so if you are looking for something a little less central and hectic then this wouldn’t be the place for you. 

If you book a rate that includes breakfast you are given vouchers for a couple of restaurants downstairs in the hotel. For the voucher you get a limited selection and coffee and juice. We only ate in the hotel once for breakfast and after that found some other options close by. 

Highlight of the hotel for me is Bobby the doorman! What a guy, so knowledgeable and also always happy to help. He also arranged a car to the airport for me, the family and luggage with 5 minutes notice. 

All in all a good place to stay and it won’t break the bank!!

title: 1st Time to Nyc
text: The room was very clean and comfortable.  Hotel is in a very central location to everything we wanted to see.  Received maid service every day.  Nice shower.  Good breakfast for $6.50.....the grab and go was also good.  If I go back someday, I would stay here again.  No issues at all.

title: Wonderful Hotel!
text: I have stayed at the Edison Hotel several times while visiting NYC from south Jersey. It’s my go to hotel in the Times Sq area. I feel safe there and the restaurant is fab. Eaten there many times at Friedman’s! The food voucher is great, too! I will be staying again next month in May, 2024. I find the hotel’s prices to be better than most. Value is great! Place is neat and clean. Location is superb and meets my needs.

title: New York Trip-Hotel Edison
text: I enjoyed my time in New York especially at Hotel Edison. The location was superb with it being walked distance from everything. Also the service was awesome with the concierge service as well. Food was delicious and prices were great too as well.

title: Hotel Edison, what’s not to love!
text: All the staff were very courteous and helpful and a pleasure to deal with, especially Michelle with housekeeping on the 20th floor and Hanniel at the front desk. We had every thing we needed and the took good care of my niece whose flight was delayed 15 hours. She got caring treatment when she did arrive finally at 5;30am.

title: Great for couples but not young families
text:
Great location for Times Square and nice and clean. Don’t bother with the breakfast, it’s not very good. We dealt with a couple of reception staff, some were excellent but there was one girl who was rude and just didn’t care.
The men who worked at the door were always friendly and super helpful!! I wouldn’t recommend the hotel for young families but great for couples/older families who need a base to explore

title: Terrible! Will NEVER go again nor recommend!
text:
We have just returned back to the UK from New York where we stayed at this hotel for the duration. On arrival the staff were not friendly at all! Very abrupt and cold welcoming! When we got into our room, the air con was not working so we called up and 2 maintenance guys came. They were actually very friendly and chatty which was nice. They couldnt fix it so temporarily fitted an air con unit in the window. Unfortunately we had to call them up again shortly after they did this as the unit was just too loud. But again, they were very lovely about it so we gave them a tip to show our appreciation.  The breakfast was not nice at all. It was "Grab and Go" which was included OR you had to pay £6.50 (US dollars) for a sit down breakfast which we tried one morning. Disgusting! Didnt have it again! The wait staff we had was quite nice but the food was not! 
We also had to pay additional facilities fee or over 200 dollars. I dont even know what that was for to be honest! But again, not friendly at all in the slightest! 
Everytime we came in, we had to show our car key to go up to our room which I do understand but one 2 occasions our mum had gone up to the room earlier, so we did not have the key on us. They were really funny with us about the fact we did not have our key nor ID. Were hesitant to even ring up to the room to our mum for her to bring us the key! 
We asked for a call to wake us up the morning we left, the lady was again, rude to us when we asked for this. Everything was like it was too much trouble and effort for them! The hotel is definitely not a 4 star either! I would say more 2 stay! Needs updating everywhere! 

Honestly, if it wasn't for the staff and how they were, the experience would not have been so bad! Would never go back here again, nor recommend!

title: On Stage With the Best Cast
text: Extremely personable and helpful staff at all levels and stations.  It was quite impressive.  Made for a most pleasant stay.  Lots of people staying there, being New York, but there was no sense of cookie-cutter service.  The location is just perfect for theater, which is why we go. We just learned that this was August Wilson's favorite Broadway hotel, which made us feel justified for it being our favorite Broadway hotel.

title: Hospitality at it's best!
text:
To say I am impressed with Hotel Edison is an understatement. We chose the hotel initially because it is in the heart of Times Square, and because of the reasonable room rates. We weren't expecting a 5-Star facility, because it seemed too good to be true at their prices. BOY, was I wrong!

Our room was immaculate and the view was superb. What I liked most about this facility is that the staff goes over-the-top in hospitality- every single one!

There was one specific gentleman, Fehat, who is a Bellman at the hotel, who treated us like VIP’s. When we got there before check-in, he did his best to make sure we were comfortable. He was going off shift but waited until he knew we were all set before he left. While we waited for our room, I noticed he was treating everyone with respect, asking how their day was, how their room was, and if they had any questions about the Big City.  Clearly, this is a profession he takes great pride in, as he seemed to genuinely care about the guests.

All I can say to anyone reading this review is that you won’t be disappointed with the facility or the staff. Hospitality at its best!

title: Attention à votre caution!!!!!!
text:
Hôtel passable et extrêmement cher. les chambres sont petites et les moquettes vieillottes, la Clim assourdissante le jour comme la nuit et ne parlons pas de la salle de la douche….humhumm
Bref, ce n’était pas grave, nous étions à New York pour notre voyage de noces.
Mais quelle surprise de retour en France! Nous sommes en avril 2024 et notre caution de 459$ ne nous a toujours pas été remboursée !! Après de multiples appels, mails etc….pas de rappel, pas de remboursement! Je suis écœurée par cette pratique qui malheureusement pour moi, je l’avais lu au sein des avis sur trip advisor mais je n’en ai pas tenu compte.
Déjà que pour un français payé 5000$ les 10 jours dans un hôtel à New York, ça fait cher, alors ne pas être remboursé ! C’est une honte… Mais je ne vais pas lâcher l’affaire, je vais faire mes recherches et d’autres démarches. Pour ceux qui souhaiteraient sejourner dans cet hôtel, on pourrait dire qu’il est bien placé, mais c’est tellement bruyant. Vous êtes au cœur de Time Square, génial ! Mais après une journée de marche ou de visites, on préférerait être dans une chambre au calme, tant le jour que la nuit , je vois remercie de m’avoir lu. En espérant que cet avis, les fera réagir!!???

title: A step into a genuine Broadway/Manhattan experience with a rich historical and cultural ambience
text:
This is the third time that I have stayed at the hotel with my daughter. When we come together, we want to enjoy athe whole Broadway experience and to be able to walk to museums and to Central Park. We are never disappointed at Hotel Edison.

We miss the old café, but we enjoyed the two restaurants on site, although we found the singing at Friedman’s a bit screechy. We much prefer the singing waiters and waitresses at nearby Ellen‘s Stardust Diner which we discovered many years ago before it became so famous. There were no lines, one just walked in! The Stardust servers don’t screech, and they don’t sing continuously; there are breaks in singing, and then happy interludes of merry song with the volume appropriate to people who are dining and talking. We would not go back to Friedmans’s for a meal, it was not relaxing.

We had a lovely large room on the 17th floor in a corner so windows on two sides. The king-size bed was super comfortable and everything was very clean. The only negative is that the doors are very loud when they open and close and so in the corner area where we were we were woken  up by doors slamming as people went in and out of their respective rooms (they weren’t intentionally slamming the doors, the doors are just loud per se). 

But what stood out for us? This time it was the cheerful and knowledgable professionalism of the main concierge at the Edison, Rolando Pagan. I had spoken with Rolando on the phone from Canada before we arrived, more than once, the second time because we were much delayed at the Halifax International Airport. Rolando was very helpful in getting us squared away so that we could be sure to get the airport shuttle service that the Edison offers even though we were six hours late arriving at the Newark airport.

Once at the hotel, we found Rolando extremely helpful in terms of directions for getting around to a variety of locations. He also encouraged me, a jazz aficionada, to visit the Rum House ( live music every night) for a jazz experience on the Saturday  night we were at the hotel. It was delightful. The musicians were excellent, and the ambience was warm and the people assembled here were musically sophisticated. 

We were sorry to miss the wine experience on Friday evening because of our late arrival, but we enjoyed chatting with people here and there— on the elevator, in the lovely art deco reception, area, and at the restaurants, bothFriedman’s  and Bond 45. We had a pasta meal at Bond 45 before we attended the musical, and the cuisine was exquisite. 

The grab and go breakfast worked pretty well. The coffee was spectacular.

All of the staff were pleasant and professional. As noted earlier, Rolando Pagan, the head concierge, represents the  jewell in the crown with regard to hotel staff. His able assistance at various times made the difference between a good stay and a superior stay.

title: The service & staff
text:
Excellent service. 
The staff always smiled, helped with everything and were very kind, especially Fehat Begolli who treated us with kindness and patience. 
In addition, the room was very clean, spacious and very quiet despite being in a central location on Times Square, New York City.

title: Não recomendo!
text: O hotel está em uma boa localização, porem o quarto é ruim, tinha até buraco no chão, o aquecedor não funciona, a janela não é vedada, nem para o frio, e nem acústico, ou seja, o barulho a noite da times square é enorme. Café da manhã péssimo e não é totalmente incluso, você ainda tem q pagar 6 dólares por dia.

title: People make the difference
text:
A beautiful hotel with a super staff. Our extended family had a great time in NYC over spring break the last week of March 2024. This iconic art deco hotel has everything we needed. Great location ("45 seconds from Broadway"), two restaurants, two bars, very comfortable rooms with incredible decor, and the hotel is filled with NYC history.  They also have many fun things going on in the lobby and on Good Friday, the Easter Bunny was walking around handing out candy and taking pictures with the kids.
The folks at the Edison really take good care of you. From the Doorman (who will arrange car service), to the Bellman, to the Front Desk and Concierge, they are all professional and top rate.  Our housekeeper was a real angel. One day my wife was sick and couldn't leave the room. She asked if we needed extra items, and asked how she was later. She always greeted us with a big smile and a warm hello every time we saw her and made us all feel very much at home. Our rooms (3 total, 2 joining) were always made up quickly, perfectly, spotlessly clean and well stocked. We all fell in love with her. Every hotel should have staff like her. The Hotel Edison was a big, fun part of our trip and we can't wait to come back.

title: crampt in ny
text: crampt, no view, no furniture, clean, location good, staff friendly and helpful, security good, the free breakfast line was minimal.  Near Bradway and MTA station.  Booking was satisfactory. Good place for families, convenience to times square good.

title: Rooms need an upgrade
text: The locations is ideal. The rooms need new mattresses. They were so broken down and lumpy. Carpet in the room felt so old and dirty. No one went out of their way to greet us or make us feel special. It just needs a full makeover.

title: City Holiday
text: Such a great location, easy walking distance to so many locations.  Signature Rooms are really clean and have all you need for a city holiday.  The staff are really helpful, especially Christina in reception who was extremely kind and helpful when we arrived with our three teenage kids.

title: Poor quality
text:
Cleanness and comfort issues!  
Mold in ceiling, shower clogged badly, windows unclean, fridge unclean, in 2nd floor impossible to sleep during nights not because of time square, the truck was loading construction materials in front of our window during midnight all 4 nights we have been there, and we couldn’t sleep well.

title: Mon avis sur L’hôtel
text:
J’ai séjourné dans cette hôtel en Mars 2023  pour 6 nuits l’hôtel est bien située très proche de Time Square  le petit déjeuner était  inclus dans la formule que j ai choisi il est bon rien à redire dessus j’ai pris celui de l’hôtel la chambre était faite tous le jours  le seul point négatif viens des clients qui ne respecte rien et qui claque les portes des chambres à tout heure du jour ou de la nuit … la chambre n’avait pas une vue de folie
Concernant le Tarif 875 e pour nous 2 ( enfant mineur avec moi )
Et concernant les taxes prélevées sur ma carte bleu  224 € 

Concernant le personnel rien à redire personnel agréable 

Je conseil régulièrement cette hôtel  pour les personnes qui partent à NY et je prévois  de repartir prochainement et je pense choisir le même hôtel  ce qui pourrait me freiner c’est l’augmentation des prix qui sont faramineux et c’est dommage

title: Hotel Edison  13 to 20 Mar 2024
text:
I stayed as part of a 42 strong group from Ireland for St Patrick's week from 13th Mar 2024.
