I could not explain how wonderful the staff, hotel management and everyone associated with the hotel were. Thank you to Bobby, Scott, Lundin, Fehat and the beautiful Jahaida 😘, everyone was so helpful and knowledgeable plus the Mean Fiddler was within walking distance. Home from home 😉
Thank you so much, I  won't be a stranger. 
Jim A

title: Welcomed by Christian
text: What an amazing welcome we received from Christina !! So positive and polite and a big welcoming smile. So accommodating she was and made myself and my boyfriend feel so welcome on our anniversary!!! ❤️ she’s a blessing to the staff in the hotel !!!

title: A March stay in Manhattan with the Edison
text: We found the staff to be very friendly, rooms were clean. Very convenient location steps away from everything, couldn’t ask for a better location. Rooms felt secure with key card scan in for the floors and security downstairs at all hours. Had a great time!

title: Great customer service
text: Christina at the front desk was a huge help she was able to switch our room configuration around for us. She was Very courteous and professional. Thank you for welcoming us to New York for our first time……………………………………………………………………………………..

title: Great location!  Great value!
text: Hotel Edison is a great place to stay for a trip to NYC.  It is conveniently located near the theater district, accessible to many of the tourist sites and near the subway.  The staff was friendly.  This was one of the few hotels that was able to accommodate our large family with their signature family room.  The room was clean, and the beds were very comfortable.    The complimentary water and Grab and Go breakfasts were very helpful.  The only issue we had was that the Wifi was spotty and the movies did not work on the TV.  Overall, we had a great experience and would highly recommend Hotel Edison!

title: I can’t wait to return to Hotel Edison
text:
Everything here is wonderful especially the people. Our bellman, Ferhat, was beyond great with us. He is so helpful!
He is a warm, wonderful and most enthusiastic person. He made my experience incredibly memorable. I already am promoting the Hotel Edison on Facebook and Instagram. I have thousands of followers so I expect my friends to make reservations here as well!!!! Thank you and Love, Pamela

title: Characterful hotel in the centre of theatre district.
text: Beautiful features in the middle of theatre district - but SOOO hectic. Polite helpful staff but lots of groups visiting.  Efficient lifts and lovely back room with theatre scenes for evening drinks, food or breakfast.  Certainly central and packed with a buzz.  Room was small but had a bath with shower and marble walls and excellent coffee and tea machine.

title: Beautiful hotel
text: Would highly recommend. Beautiful decor, comfortable rooms, great overall vibes. Felt like stepping back in time. Entire staff was friendly and helpful, seemed to love working there. Would stay here again and again.

title: Unfriendly & unhelpful staff throughout. Where has the service with a smile gone, everything seemed a hassle to them.
text: The hotel staff were just rude, a little ignorant & unhelpful, not the same experience we had last time. We asked for ear buds but the guy said no then we called from our room & got them. Unhelpful, unfriendly. Best thing was the bed, very comfy but the room lacked that little extra that you get in the Uk & other places around Europe that we’ve travelled to.

title: Above and Beyond Service
text: The hotel was phenomenal. I actually forgot something really important at the hotel, thank god for its security staffs good services, they were able to safely ship it back to me. Shout out to Danny, JB,  Alex, Jahaida, Jay, especially the security manager.

title: Clean Comfortable Great Location
text: Great location.  Clean rooms.  Staff was friendly and always available to help you.  We will definitely stay here again.  I loved the restaurants that were available to you without ever leaving.  Comfortable beds.

title: Favorite
text: The Edison!! Right in the middle of the theaters & Times Square, special history at this hotel, excellent Streetwise walking tour, welcoming staff & just an overall great experience —looking forward to next time.

title: Highly recommended
text: We just had a 5 day stay here! Just loved it!! Everyone so friendly and helpful. The hotel is spotless and the beds are the most comfortable ever, even the bed linen is luxurious! We had a problem with our heating and we were moved - within minutes! - to a new room! A kettle requested by us was also in our room within minutes! The staff are all really nice and helpful. Cannot fault the Edison at all! ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

title: Location, location, location
text: Hotel Edison is a prime property when it comes to location around Time Square. We were steps away from the hustle and bustle of time square where there is everything imaginable. Broadway shows are a shot walk, and Central Park is a nice morning walk. The restaurants in the hotel are very good with live music every night. I would recommend this hotel to any friends.

title: Great location, bit noise
text:
Location is great, right in Tme Square and Broadway, close to mayor attractions.
Pricey but it is NY
Coon 5th floor was noise,  outside sound. Hard to sleep.
14th floor where the rest of my family stay was peaceful. 
My shower was handicap I guess, do open no doors water splash all over rest of the bathroom, not the most enjoyable shower time for me.

title: A Wonderful Gem
text:
I stayed at the Hotel Edison for a quick get-away weekend trip to see a Broadway show (MJ the Musical).  The theatre is on 52nd and the Hotel Edison is on 47th.  The hotel is centrally located to all kinds of restaurants, shopping, and entertainment.  
The location - Excellent.  
The staff - Excellent.  
The room was good (this is my normal NYC place to stay when I go to Broadway shows), but there was a problem with my room and they upgraded me which changed this category rating to - Excellent.   
The breakfast (French Toast) at Friedman's - Excellent.  
5 out of 5 stars.

title: Coming back!!!
text: I absolutely enjoyed my stay at this hotel!!!! It was only one night for St. Patrick’s weekend, but Christina made my stay such a nice experience!!! She was extremely helpful and made the process smooth. Had a very nice breakfast the next morning! The room was extremely cozy and the bed was incredibly comfortable. I loved it so much, I’m returning Easter weekend! Looking forward to the great perks 💕!!!

title: Great Location
text: Hotel Edison met and exceeded all expectations. Great location to theaters! We managed to use the subway the entire trip with a station about a block away. Starbucks on each corner. We grabbed meals from Carve a few doors down from the hotel. Super friendly staff, and clean comfy rooms. Bond 45 grab and go breakfast was perfect for on the go. We will definitely stay here again.

title: weekend girls trip
text:
Stayed at Hotel Edison for a weekend girls trip, location is amazing. Room was small, very basic. Bed was comfortable. Grab and go breakfast was convenient. 
Location, Location, Location. if you live Broadway shows and Times Square, this is the place for you

title: Poor
text:
I was very disappointed with my stay. The bath was cracked and sealed with silicone. There was a socket loose out the wall. Only one socket working. The breakfast grab and go was repetitive and sickening by the end of the week. No tea and coffee in the room. I would not rate this an Irish standard 4*. We had a poor view room also. 
I spoke to a few people that seemed to have a nicer room. I booked through a travel agent and was hoping for better standard due to this as I payed a lot for this trip. 
However the bed was nice, big and comfortable with a tv in view. The staff were incredible and very helpful.

title: Business Trip
text: Christina at the check in desk was very professional and high energy.  Loved how she welcomed us in.  She definitely made the check in process very easy. She was very detailed in the restaurant ls that were free to us and provided locations for all.

title: excellent hotel
text: Best located hotel for theater and fabulous restaurants.  Easy to navigate, check in and check out processes were so convenient.  The grab and go breakfasts are substantial and tasty.  Rooms are small but clean and comfortable

title: Spend money somewhere else
text:
This hotel was not at all worth the price.  The room we were given still had mini m and ms candy on the floor.  The carpet was stained and had rolls in it that you could trip on.  The bathroom door barely shut.  Overall just a terrible experience.
The 6.50 cent additional breakfast even apple juice was an extra charge.

title: ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
text: First and foremost, thank you to CHRISTINA for rectifying a minor issue when we first arrived. She was so sweet and handled it quickly so we never felt any hiccup. Hotel Edison is always a nice stay and this time was no different :) gotta love the wine nights and breakfast !

title: Great for one night
text: We stayed here on a one night trip to the city. If you're exclusively visiting for the theatre district, it's a perfect location. But I would never stay there for more than a night mainly because the room was TOO HOT. Brutal and boiling even for winter in NYC.

title: Shabby room
text: Shabby room, wallpaper peeling off, water damage on walls and window shades. Very loud heating /cooling register. Toilet needed multiple  flushes. The bathtub back up with black stuff also. ( fire detector was covered with plastic and we had to ask that it be removed).

title: Fantastic Family Hotel
text: Hotel Edison was an amazing family friendly hotel in NYC. The staff was extremely courteous. The hotel was very clean. The free bottled water every day was a definite plus. Highly recommend for a family vacation.

title: Such lovely employees
text: Such a handy location. The Edison is blessed to have such great employees, they made us feel so welcome and you could also have the craic with them which was good!  Would recommend staying here if you are visiting New York.

title: Forever Curious Traveler
text: The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful.  loved my small room at the end of a short hall off a main hall on the sixth floor. I felt like I was in a safe cocoon.  Wonderful!  The hotel is so close to everything.  We are planning more trips to NY and will definitely be staying at the Hotel Edison.

title: Great location
text:
Although we were not in the room for that long aside from checking in and sleeping, the room was up to standard and the staff taking care of us were hospitable and friendly. However, we were a bit annoyed with the confusion surrounding room service for 10 p.m. - 3 p.m. 

On the barcode by the mini bar where it offered options pertaining to our stay, there was a partnership with a restaurant named Carve that had food for later hours. We got back to our room around 11 and were still hungry so looked into the option, but the website on the barcode didn't load and when we tried to call the front desk, which I had to do over the phone since our room phone didn't work, the front desk clerk didn't know what we were talking about and forwarded our call to the restaurant, which was closed. This was a minor thing in our stay which was overall nice, but definitely a bit dissapointing.

title: Excellent Hotel- Perfect Location and amazing staff and very clean
text: I was a little bit skeptical of a location or property, that I’ve never heard of. Once I arrived. The service, began from the Valet. All the way through check out, was absolutely amazing. The food is good at all of the restaurants, the service at the rum bar is amazing The rooms are clean neat the hallways are orderly. The staff is friendly they take great care of you ! I cannot wait to return to this property very very soon!

title: Great Location
text:
Hotel is in a great location, literally just a short walk to the top of the street and you’re by the steps in Times Square. Hotel room was average, definitely not luxury but a decent place to stay after walking 30,000 steps a day. Room was clean but a little run down with tears in the carpet, lots of visible screw plugs in the walls and cracked paint on the door frames. Not a lot of storage space, but there was a good sized cupboard to hang your coats in. 

Bed was comfy to sleep in, although on 4th floor, when someone went the toilet above it was very noisy and could wake you in the night. Shower water also took about 10 minutes to heat up to a decent enough temperature. Overall it was worth the money and I’d recommend if you wanted somewhere to rest as you’re up early and out until late.

title: Times Square Birthday Weekend
text: I celebrated my birthday in Times Square and stayed at The Hotel Edison. I was greeted by Christina at the reception desk and she was amazing during the check in process. She informed me and my cousin on all of amenities the hotel had to offer and  directed us to the wine hour. Thank you for a great stay!!

title: Good value, good location, small room.
text: Roughly $250 a day (group rate for a conference being held in the hotel), which include the room and the fees and the taxes and the surcharges and the taxes and the fees. The room was spotlessly clean, including the bathroom, the bath towels were soft and plush. The bed was firm but not hard and comfortable. Sheets so crisp and clean that I asked the maid to leave them on the bed. Great location for showgoers, right in the middle of the Broadway theatre area and only a couple of short blocks to Restaurant Row. Had something of a sour apple trying to check in, possibly because the administration had left her alone at the 3 PM check-in time. But overall, an excellent deal!

title: The best experience
text: I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York. It has everything you need for a great stay, including a convenient location, good breakfast, comfortable rooms. The hotel staff was very friendly, especially Manager Scott. He was very accommodating and made sure that we had a comfortable stay.

title: Stay at the Edison
text: We always enjoy our stay at the Edison. The rooms are very specious by New York standards. We love the convenience to the theaters. The staff is so helpful especially Fehat Begou. He is always there to go the extra mile. All of the staff is friendly and helpful. We always stay at the Hotel Edison when we go to New York City.

title: Perfect Location, Great Service
text:
I absolutely loved staying here. The hotel made sure to hook us up with perks when they found out it was my partner’s birthday, the location couldn’t be better, the Friday wine and music night was lovely and the room was comfortable and clean. 
We walked everywhere, were right by all the restaurants in Hell’s Kitchen and Times Square and were even close brought to Penn Station to walk to the hotel with our luggage. I’d stay here again in a heartbeat.

title: Best Hotel in NYC!
text: This is our favorite place to stay when visiting the city. The location is the best, and the staff is always super helpful and friendly. The rooms are always clean, and you have access to both 46th and 47th street. Highly recommend this hotel!

title: must visit hotel
text: This hotel is the gem of Times Square, the people are friendly the rooms are spacious and the food is excellent.  The new comedy club of the weekends just adds to how great the hotel is.  Try it and you'll never go anywhere else when you are in NYC!

title: Génial
text:
Nous avons séjourné dans cet hôtel en 2007 .et on en garde un très bon souvenir. Un point important super bien placé  juste à côté de time square .literie confortable. 
J'espère qu'ils ont remis au goût du jour les chambre car s'était un peu vieillot mais propre

title: Exceptional Service!
text: Exceptional!  I can’t say enough about Danny O’Brien and the staff at Hotel Edison.  My 19 year old son was visiting NYC for the first time with his girlfriend and her mother, and after an amazing stay, the mother had a medical emergency before checkout and had to be taken to a hospital by ambulance.  Danny stayed in the room while medic was there and spoke on the phone with me about what was happening.  He immediately put my mind at ease by telling me the kids could stay at the hotel as long as needed, and that he would keep an eye on them.  He made sure we all knew how to contact him if needed, and checked on the kids throughout the day.  When it became apparent that they would not be able to leave that day, and that additional family members were needed to assist with returning home, Danny arranged for everyone to remain at the hotel until they were cleared to travel the next day.  Following the trip, he also requested an update on how the mother was doing.  In addition to all of the wonderful things about the hotel itself, having professional, responsible, and personable staff like Danny O’Brien makes Hotel Edison the only choice when visiting NYC.

title: Great stay, ideal location and good value for money
text: Perfect location for seeing Hamilton at Richard Rodgers theater! Right across the street. Beds were comfy, rooms were clean, staff was exceptionally friendly. You can leave bags with the hotel pre/post checkout for $1 per unit. Super close to Times Square and very well located for taking transit around Manhattan.

title: Best Hotel in Times Square!
text: It is very hard to beat this location, and the staff is excellent! It is always our first choice when looking to go to the city for a few days. I would recommend using 46th Street to unload luggage. It is not the bellhop side, but it normally has much less traffic. Highly recommend!

title: My 1st choice hotel
text: Hotel Edison is conveniently and centrally located to just about everything NY.  Walking distance to just about EVERY theatre, even Lincoln Central, Central Park, The Metropolitan Museum, and other places if you are an adventurer.  Rooms are spacious, comfortable, and clean.  Staff and personnel are helpful and accommodating.

title: Great Location - Poor customer service with room reservations
text: We did not receive the two room suite we had reserved. They gave us a different room without mentioning the change. Once we saw our room, we called the front desk and was told our reserved room was not available due to maintenance. Maybe say that up front?? We were also told we had been given a room with a microwave and fridge in place of our reserved room which was supposed to have three beds and two bathrooms. As if that’s a good alternative! When I insisted on another option, they found two adjoining rooms without a connecting door on a lower floor. So we did get two bathrooms and three beds but we were in separate rooms. They also offered no added discount for the inconvenience.

title: False advertisement and rude housekeeping.
text: We reserved connecting rooms with 1 king and 2 queens. Once in the rooms, we discovered it was 1 king and 2 fulls which is not big enough for our 4 kids to share. We called and they gave us a hard time about a rollaway bed and told us we had queen beds. We measured the beds and they are in fact full size. We called back and told them we measured and then they admitted they knew they gave us two full sizes instead of queens and they have no way to advertise the difference in the rooms. They sent housekeeping up to decide if they could place a rollaway bed/cot in a room. Housekeeping was very rude and told us it would be a long wait to get the bed. Will not stay here again

title: Short family trip
text: Edison is in a great location, just off times square by broadway, art deco feel, very clean, good grab & go breakfast or sit down breakfast for a small fee, small bathroom and wardrobe but was manageable, friendly staff and good security, self check in and check out by reception desk, held suitcase for a €1, would recomend this hotel and i would stay again in the future x

title: Best Hotel in Times Square
text: I just can’t say enough great things about this hotel. We traveled with a family of six and had the family room. It was big and comphy even with 6 of us in there. The bathroom was spacious and the shower was great! We had TVs in both rooms and we could even see Times Square from our room. The beds were very comfortable and the hotel was very clean. The cleaning staff were all very friendly and so were the rest of the staff we encountered. Maria was the kindest person when we checked in. She gave us some suggestions locally and we really enjoyed talking to her upon our arrival. She made the check in experience even better. The breakfast choices were excellent and we tried all of the places. Loved them all. I will definitely stay here again and highly recommend it to other travelers. Great place for families or couples.

title: Best Time Square place to stay to be close to the action but not so much that you can’t sleep!
text:
This hotel was very welcoming, accommodating, helpful, comfortable, clean, and super accessible to Time Square! Great security too! We all felt safe here and had to show our key each time we arrived, the elevators are only accessible to hotel guests. 
We were in walking distance to so many great places including Rockefeller Center/Plaza. Close to subway stations, Broadway, and lots of great restaurants! This location was perfect for our family! The GM, Scott Geres, was very helpful in making our stay comfortable and we had great views with a corner room!! Snacks and waters were provided upon our arrival and they have restaurants and a night club lounge in  the hotel. 
The concierge, Rolando Pagan, went above and beyond in helping us navigate our way by bus and subway to the hotel by talking me through each route and emailing us a goggle map link that included  instructions and step by step directions on how to get to the hotel from LaGuardia airport. He saved us over $200 each way  in transportation fees!!! 
They also have access to so many tours and things to do around NYC. 
We will 1,000% stay here again! The people were fantastic! The hotel was clean and the mattresses were comfortable! We truly cannot say enough. Great things about Hotel Edison! Highly highly highly recommended!

title: Enjoyed the Edison
text: Overall enjoyable stay at the Edison Hotel. Would very much consider staying there again. Very convenient to all the shows in Times Square district. Also felt very safe staying there. Their security measures seemed very adequate.

title: The best value is the location.
text: Great location. Hotel is safe, but very average in many ways. The rooms need a real deep cleaning, especially the carpets and the baseboards. They charge a "resort" fee and I never saw the benefit of it.

title: Back for our 10th stay at our favourite NYC hotel
text: The hotel suite was perfect for our big birthday trip. The cookies, snacks and champagne were an unexpected suprise in our room.  The included breakfast options were great. Had cocktails at Rum Room after Billy Joel at MSG. We will be back soon

title: Fantastic Hotel
text: A fantastic hotel in a perfect location for our brilliant few days in New York City! We wouldn’t hesitate in recommending the hotel. All the staff were extremely helpful and accommodating. The Grab and Go free breakfast was a big plus with a good choice to choose from !

title: Great Place!
text: I have stayed here many times and i am always impressed with the service and quality of the Edison Hôtel! Security was impressive and i felt comfortable and  and safe. Room was clean and well prepared .

title: So convenient !
text: Ideal location, easy check in and out. If you are here to truly enjoy the city, ease of transport and want a comfortable and convenient room to relax/sleep in this is it! I expected a much smaller room given the location but it was the perfect size!

title: Everything about this property was very professional, and the staff was very patient,
text: It's not always easy Ri deal with so many people in the same place at the same time, but I never noticed any of your staff being frustrated, they stayed professional. This shows how the leadership leads

title: Quick trip - great location!
text: Great location for theater district! Very busy - lots going on. Staff very friendly and accommodating! Allowed late checkout which is helpful. Grab and go breakfast a plus and very good! Would stay there again!

title: Good hotel
text:
The reception staff are not very friendly and did not meet our room requests for a quiet room away from the elevators given. We had an early 19hour flight the next day. They were busy but no excuse for the way that felt. Not at all welcolming. 
The rooms are not sound proofed.

title: Best Security Ever
text: I had an amazing experience at the Hotel Edison. The housekeeping was very kind and helpful, providing bottled water each day. The hotel is centrally located. We basically walked out of the hotel onto Times Square. Most of all, the security was exceptional. I left a very sentimental and valuable necklace in the hotel room and the security team consisting of Jonathan, Danny, JB, Alex, Jahaida, and Jay were fantastic at answering the phone, locating the lost item within an hour, and helping to arrange shipment to get the necklace back to me. For this reason, I would highly recommend staying at the Hotel Edison.

title: 60th Birthday Celebration
text: Location was superb! Steps away from Times Square. Our Suite with Terrace King bed was phenomenal! It was everything! Services were awesome. I recommend it highly. Will be back some day soon. With all our Love from Hawai’i.. Thank you very much for a grand 60th birthday!

title: Located close to Times Square and within the heart of the Theatre District.
text: Hotels are expensive, and compared to other big cities, it was reasonable. We stayed 5 nights, and only took the subway to and from Katz's Deli. Otherwise, we walked to the five musicals we saw during our stay. Room was not large, but adequate. The bed was comfortable. Terrible view out the window, but we've been to NYC several times.  The location was superior for those visiting for theatre and wanting to be close to Times Square.

title: Free breakfast surprise!
text: Convenient location.Room was kind of small.I wish I picked a better room.Service at the restaurants were very nice and attentive,can’t not say the same from the front desk staff.If you’re looking for a good location to visit different NY attractions,Edison Hotel would be a good choice.

title: Great stay
text: It was a great stay except my watch was misplaced and I didn’t get much support to find it. I put it on charging and it wasn’t there when I got back. The room and staff were friendly. Location was great

title: Great hotel, staff always goes above and beyond
text: Wouldn’t stay anywhere else if I’m coming to the city the staff is always so friendly and the rooms are reasonably priced while also being clean. The restaurant that’s attached to the hotel is also fantastic

title: great hotel
text: I had the best stay I've ever had In New York, was made very welcome at check in, was not expecting an upgrade which was a surprise. I had a king signature room was had plenty of room, bathroom small nice shower. Bed very comfortable. can't wait to stay there  again I will be booking again.

title: Great Location and Value
text: If you like to be in the middle of Times Square, this property fits the bill!  Great location. Easy access to theaters and restaurants.  Perfect for a theater weekend!  Especially, this past weekend, the weather was inclement, so leisurely walking was out of the question.

title: recent stay
text: hotel shabby but good staff , the hotel air con caused issues sleeping, the room facilities were not provided correctly .. the location is brilliant and the price of the hotel allows for the issues we had

title: Fantastic location for seeing Broadway shows!
text:
Perfectly located for exploring the city and attending multiple Broadway shows, Hotel Edison exceeded our expectations. We had read some reviews that made us nervous, but the hotel turned out to be lovely. Check-in and check-out were both quick thanks to the self-serve kiosks that kept us from having to wait in line at the desk. 

Room keys had to be displayed before being allowed into the elevator bank (there was ALWAYS a guard on duty) and had to be swiped IN the elevator before a floor number could be pressed. This made us feel very safe and secure. Despite the amount of guests staying at the hotel, the elevators were fast and we never had to wait more than 30 seconds for an elevator to arrive. 

We had a Signature 2 Queen Beds room on the 18th floor that met our needs. Yes, the bathroom is small but - it's New York. I was just happy it was clean and modern. Take note that there's not a fan in the bathroom so whomever you're rooming with will hear/smell all your business, and vice versa. Also, the water pressure in the shower isn't great. I had to shower twice as long as usual because it took forever to wash the conditioner out of my hair. 

Our biggest issue with the room was the HVAC. The heat was on and set to 74 when we arrived, even though it was a warm day in NYC (62 degrees). We immediately turned off the heat and turned on the AC to cool down the room, but the AC would only run once and then shut off - never cooling down the room to the temperature we selected. This made for uncomfortable sleeping on most nights (we stayed 4 nights), since the bedding was so heavy/warm. 

Our room had no view at all - the windows faced another section of the hotel - but given how close we were to Times Square, it helped minimize the noise. Since we were really only in the room in the evening/ overnight, we didn't mind not having a view of the city. 

The grab-and-go breakfast was decent although definitely on the cheap side. You get to select a piece of fruit OR a croissant, a breakfast sandwich OR a yogurt parfait, and then a beverage (juice, coffee, water). Also, note that if you check in at the self-service kiosk you will need to stop at the concierge to pick up your breakfast vouchers; the kiosk doesn't provide them.

We will definitely stay at the Hotel Edison again if we plan another Broadway-focused trip to NYC. This was a perfect location for catching multiple shows!

title: Love the Edison
text: Great location, helpful knowledgeable staff, I love the Classic Hotel vibe of the decor!  I stayed in a suite on 18th floor which gave me multiple views of the city. Room was incredibly roomy for a NYC "Old School"Hotel. Both restaurants on site have amazing food as well as attentive staff. I have yet to have an issue staying at the Edison, and I have stayed there a dozen times now. Has been a favorite hotel since my college days. Keep up the great service, I look forward to my NYC trips partially because I enjoy this hotel so much.

title: Excellent hotel nearby Times square
text: Bra hotell med ett fantastiskt läge nära Times square centrum (70 m) väldigt bra grab and go frukost som var gratis - valde dock de flesta dagar att äta för 6.50 på Bond 45 vilket var väldigt prisvärt. Hotellet var mycket rent och incheckningen smidig förutom att man ändå var tvungen att stå i kö för att få sina frukostbiljetter. Hotellrummet var stort och rymligt och det luktade gott på rummet motför nästan alla andra hotell jag bott på i USA så det var trevligt. Alla musikaler låg precis invid hotellet samt madame Tussauds. Otroligt smidigt att bara enkelt promenera dit man ville.

title: Disappointing
text: Poor HVAC system. Had to wait over 5 minutes for warm shower and longer for hot. Waste of water. Electrical system inconsistent. Simply not as good as usual. Price difference from nearby places not huge. Will look for something a little more modern next time. But can’t beat looking cation!

title: Yaevick for win!
text: Yaevick was amazing! She answered all our questions, was professional, and kind. We are grateful to her! The hotel was clean, comfortable, and the breakfast was delicious! We appreciate the Juan and lending us an umbrella also! The location was unbelievable!

title: Good
text:
Sanities are very little and not comfortable. Nothing for childrens, not even breakfast…
The noise of outside and reparation are very noisy and loud. Beds are ok. It misses some desk to put put our luggage on. But people were Nice!

title: Great location, spacious rooms, but needs work.
text: We booked a terrace suite which was great. The hotel is located in the heart of Times Square which is convenient and the price was reasonable for what you’re getting. However, we booked a terrace suite and were unable to use it the entire week due to weather and construction. They gave us a partial refund, but it was still disappointing. They also stored the housekeeping cart right outside our door. It took up a lot of space and it was also a pain to have to squeeze past it every time we went back to our room. Overall it’s a great hotel and very nice, but there were a few small details that could have made our stay much better.

title: Happy with stay
text: Fantastic location. Very helpful staff, we arrived on our first visit to New York from Ireland and checked in to a small 3rd story room with no view, we asked to change to a higher floor and we were put on the 8th floor with a bigger room, no hassle at all. On the last day we needed some assistance and we met Hanniel at the front desk. He was extremely friendly and helpful and looked after us very well. All staff including, door men, cleaners and servers at the grab and go breakfast were all very nice. Bed was really comfortable too. Perfect for couples or just adults.

title: Excellent stay at NYC
text: I highly recommend this hotel, it has a perfect location, it's really comfortable at a good price. Grab and go breakfast was really good! The staff was really nice, they helped us to storage our lugagge since we had a late returning flight.

title: turn & burn NYC
text: Hotel edison Is a beautiful hotel. It's in a perfect location, Times Square. Everything that we wanted to do was right there. The room was recently remodeled, It was beautiful, The bed was comfy, The staff was amazing, It was perfect for our trip.  I recommend more people stay there. You won't be disappointed and we even had them park our car for the 24 hours that we were in the city. It was perfect!!!

title: Reseña hotel de edison
text:
Excelente el hotel y las instalaciones
Muy buena atención 
Muy buena la ubicación ya que está a metros de times square 
Me gustaría destacar la amabilidad de los empleados Yarvick,Cristian y Leudin
Me ayudaron mucho en mis días en la ciudad
Gracias !!!

title: Extrêmement bien placé !
text:
Très bon hôtel ! 
Tout d'abord, l'hôtel est situé en plein Times Square, ce qui est vraiment génial ! De plus, les chambres sont spacieuses, les lits très confortables et le personnel est sympa. Également, des bouteilles d'eau gratuites nous sont données tous les jours. 
Les femmes de ménage sont également très agréables. 
Le hall est spacieux et classe. 

Toutefois, attention, nous avions réservé une chambre triple avec trois petits -déjeuners. Or, dans cette situation l'hôtel ne prend en compte que deux petits déjeuners... Pensez donc bien à vérifier que vous avez trois et non pas deux petits-déjeuners. 
De plus, en cas de petits-déjeuners inclus, trois types de déjeuners sont proposés : 
- Le petit-déjeuner au restaurant de l'hôtel, pour lequel il est demandé un supplément de $6,50 par personne seulement pour s'asseoir alors même que les petits-déjeuners ont déjà été payés !! 
- Le petit déjeuner gratuit à Bond 45. Honnêtement, c'est le premier que nous avons testé et c'est médiocre !!! On vous propose seulement un jus d'orange ou une boisson chaude, avec, au choix, un fruit ou un croissant + un yaourt ou un burger à l'omelette. 
- Le petit-déjeuner gratuit chez Carve : FONCEZ !!!! Il donne vue sur la rue avec une super ambiance, le personnel est super sympa et ils font des petits-déjeuners de qualité, très bons et qui calent bien pour la journée !!

title: Very Good Stay
text:
Second time staying at The Edison and wow what a different experience I had this time round. I was extremely sceptical about staying here again due to a poor experience the first time round but i’m happy I bit the bullet and gave the hotel a second chance. 

Firstly, and the main reason for staying here is location. You cannot beat being in the heart of Times Square in just a few steps. As I was visiting with my partner who has not been to NY before, I wanted somewhere in the thick of it and The Edison is the perfect location. Close to all main attractions / subway etc. 

Our room this time was MUCH better. We were on the 14th floor. Nice tidy room, comfortable bed, bathroom was a little on the small side but shower was great. No waiting for lifts either. Our room was serviced each day and bottled water replenished which was greatly appreciated. 

Service throughout the duration of our stay was 10/10. We were checked in by Marco who was very friendly and informative. Door staff / security / concierge were all friendly and professional. I like that there is 24 hour security and you have to show your room key to access the lifts. 

We enjoyed the grab and go breakfast each morning also. 

I know this place is getting mixed reviews at the moment but our experience was great and we would 100% recommend and return. Thank you to all for a pleasant stay.

title: Great Stay
text: Had a great stay at the Edison, staff was incredibly friendly and room was stunning. Restaurant attached to the hotel is decorated stunningly for christmas, we loved sitting in the downstairs section. Would definitely stay again at the edison!

title: Clean, friendly and affordable!
text: My family of four had a comfortable stay at the Hotel Edison. The welcome package made the kids feel very special. The staff was friendly, the hotel rooms were clean, and there was a nice free breakfast each morning. Our only complaint was the noise from the street, but this is the cost of being so close to Time Square and the theater district.

title: Perfect!
text: It is always a pleasure to stay at  Hotel Edison. Our room is always perfectly clean and comfortable.  The hotel always has a great atmosphere and the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel is perfectly situated in Times Square and is central to all attractions!

title: Rude staff , Rearly hot water , Wifi failed ,
text: To hard to explain in 200 characters so much went wrong. Front desk staff Melissa and Zenny are probably the rudest people I ever dealt with. Rarely hot water the engineer advised to run water for 15 Mins before use to heat up , what a dreadful waste and harm to the environment sometimes took cold/ medium warm showers. Safe jammed twice we done without., WiFi failed , AC so loud couldn't leave on while in the room. I could go on

title: Tired and dated
text: Expected the included breakfast to be better than Grab and Go. Poor air con meant the room was too hot so couldn’t sleep well. No tea and coffee making facilities in the room. Tiny bathroom and poor storage.

title: Great hotel!
text: This hotel is very well situated. Only a few steps from Times Square, it is near many restaurants and from Broadway theaters. Rooms are very clean and spacious enough to accomodate travelers with luggage. There is parking a few steps away ($, very safe, no in-out ). Free grab and go breakfast included.

title: THEY NEVER RETURNED THE $100 DOLLARS!!!!
text:
On check in we was made aware that there would be a tax charge of $321 dollars to cover the length of stay which whilst it came as a surprise we paid the full amount. 
We were specifically told that from the $321 dollars we would be returned $100 dollars which would be processed after checkout. 
Well … it’s been over 3 weeks and I have not received the $100 dollars. 
I’ve emailed the hotel twice with no reply. 
This is a scam do not stay here!  
I fully expect my money returned in full otherwise I will be taking it to the next stage!

title: NY visit with the kids
text: First time visiting NY with the kids.  Location is great.  Did the quick check-in using the QR code we received.  A message should be added in an email or on the screen while the room keys are being printed to explain how to get the breakfast tickets.  The lady at the counter was very helpful the next morning to help us get it sorted.  The AC is loud, this can bother some people.  Also, we hear the hallway noise and ice machine a lot!  I am not sure what the hotel can do about it, but I suspect it has to do with the seal around the door.  We could see the hallway light all around the door.  That is not usually the case.  The washroom is dated, but clean and functional. We would have appreciated a flat sheet in the bed as not everyone wants to sleep with the comforter all night long.

title: Underwhelming
text:
To be honest I'm unsure how I feel about this hotel   although it was in a great location I feel lots of things let it down . 

Rooms - were very basic and small 
I double bed for me and my daughter to share 
There was no fridge in the room or any tea / coffee making facilities 
However 2 small bottles of water were provided daily .
The bed wasn't the most comfortable 
And the room was so hot 
But you couldn't open the windows. 
The lighting was a strange set up 
Numerous lamps dotted around 
But no main light. 
Upon checkin I was told a security deposit was needed 
And also upon checkout we would be charged around 140 in additional taxes which I wasn't made aware of 
And unsure why this ' resort ' tax I added . 
It wasn't a resort 
It was just a basic hotel .
We were given some vouchers to use at the restaurant next door 
For a discounted breakfast of 6.99 .
Even at 6.99 the breakfast was not worth it .
I tried one morning to use the voucher just for a coffee 
And was told I was unable to do that 
And would have to go to a different restaurant to get the ' grab and go ' 
Breakfast. 
Which i feel is crazy just to be able to get a drink .
I had noticed tea / coffee facilities were offered to airline staff who were staying there 
But for guests there was no such facilities .
The hallways were very tired and run down 
Alot of stains on the carpets and doors 
Some staff were friendly and helpful but some not so 
I just found this hotel under whelming 
No amenities offered 
WiFi was OK but they had free WiFi or 5g WiFi 
Which I could never log into .
I was never told about these taxes or deposits either which is down to my booking agent However I still feel its absolutely crazy 
Not really sure if I would stay here again

title: Hanniel excellent
text: Hotel Edison is a very clean hotel. They offer free breakfast at three different locations which is great. Everyone in the hotel is friendly, especially Hanniel who did our check in. He answered all the questions we had and more. Arriving in NY and having him do our check in was a great beginning to our trip.

title: Excellent location and value for money
text:
The hotel was clean, in a great location, the staff were friendly and helpful. No tea or coffee making amenities but not a deal breaker!
There was a $100 per night deposit to pay when we arrived which we were not aware of, aswell as local and state taxes which is common.

title: Fantastic stay
text: I work in the Broadway Theaters. Great place to stay when you are doing late nights before we open. Staff is always great. I've been staying here for over 20 years. Rooms are updated. Plenty of elevators. Right in the middle of times square. Great place to stay.

title: VERY GRATEFUL TO EDISON HOTEL!
text: As a disabled guest at Edison Hotel, I had a terrific experience.  Upon arriving I was immediately told at registration that a disability guest room had opened up due to a cancellation, which they gave me and which was most accommodating.  The entire staff of The Edison Hotel provided me with great service for my 4-day stay.  I have only had great experiences at this most reliable hotel.

title: Location, location...BUT!
text:
No doubt about it this hotel is slap bang in the middle of all things NYC, most things are a short walk away, as is the subway if you wish to travel further afield.

However, one of the first things I rate a hotel upon is the welcome, words from the check in staff, like "How are you today"? "How was your journey"? They are rapport builders and make you feel like you are a valued guest. Sadly this aspect was lacking and it went downhill from there, "Name"!?...was all we got.

We were told nothing at all about the hotel, when I queried where the lifts were the lady behind the desk, behind a mask and perspex screen merely pointed.

My wife had upgraded our room prior to arrival and when we got to the one allocated. it was most definitely not the King Suite as advertised. Back to check in we went, same lady took the phone out of my wife's hand with the reservation thereon and said she needed to speak to the manager.

Five minutes later we were provided with keys to another room but told to immediately bring the other keys back the minute we had moved in. However, the next room whilst bigger, was still not what had been booked. 

Finally after demanding to see the manager we were taken to the room we should have been allocated in the first place. In all, it added around 45 minutes to our check in process and the blame was apparently an error.

I will say that the descriptions that appear on the website are not quite what you may get, so check!

Other misc comments

The hallways do look a little tired but the room was OK, it had double blinds as it was very close to the neon lights of Times Square.

Bottled water got delivered daily and there was a water boiler in our room, plus fridge.

WiFi worked really well on our phones, but could not get it to work on the laptop.

Shower and wet area, clean and presentable.

Bed was comfy.

Didn't eat in the hotel so cannot comment.

Lifts are plentiful and never waited for more than 30 seconds for one.

Want to store your bags on check out? That's $1 per bag, I cannot ever remember being charged for this service at any hotel.

My feeling, this hotel has a very high turnover of visitors because of its location, you're a number and not a guest.

title: ALWAYS a stellar experience!
text: I was in NYC this past weekend with two daughters for shopping and the theatre.  Walking into the lobby is like coming home!  Our family won’t stay anywhere but Hotel Edison!  Employees are first rate, especially Melody and Anthony, who provided service with a smile!  The room was immaculate and the beds and pillows are so comfortable.  Breakfast coupons ($6.50 for a complete breakfast, including coffee!) were included with our stay as part of a promotional package and it did not disappoint.  We had two eggs, potatoes, toast and coffee.  Gluten free toast is available, too.  Hotel Edison just keeps getting better and better!

title: Convenient Location, Comfortable Rooms, and Old World Charm for a relatively reasonable price!
text: Easy walking distance to theaters and restaurants as well as the subway. The rooms are small, but clean and comfortable, and the beautiful art deco touches everywhere transport you to New York in a gilded time. The friendly and helpful staff, plus an excellent restaurant and bar on site, and breakfast included make this a convenient choice. I'm sure you can find cheaper rates elsewhere, but The Edison feels like you are staying somewhere "fancy" for a price that is not ridiculous.

title: Hotel Edison Honest Thoughts
text: The location of this hotel in proximity to Broadway theatres was great. The staff was quite friendly, and the rooms are good at blocking street noise for the most part. Additionally, I was impressed with the security (need to show room key to access elevators). However, I am not sure that I would stay here again. There was a lack of light in the room (two lamps and a dim hallway light in the main room were it) and there was dust on the wallpaper and the back of the bathroom door. The walls are quite thin and doors easily slam, so it was hard to get a restful night's sleep. Upon arrival, there were a few things lacking in my room that were listed as amenities on the website (robes, coffee machine, etc). There was also a letter addressed to another guest in the room, and the TV was addressed to yet another guest, giving me some concerns about privacy of guests. I have some dietary restrictions so I called prior to booking to ensure they would be able to accommodate these for the grab and go breakfast, and I was told they would be able to. However, the only part of the breakfast I could eat was the fruit. For these reasons, I 'm not sure that I would stay here in the future but if staff were receptive to feedback and improvements were made, I would consider staying here again. At present, I just don't feel that it is worth it for the price.

title: Una experiencia perfecta y un servicio singular
text: Me encanto la experiencia en el hotel. Descanse muy bien. Aunque esta pequeña la habitación, tenia todo lo que necesitaba y estaba en la mejor ubicación. En el restaurante me atendió Kisha y la verdad que aunque estaba super cansada ella me atendió como una estrella. Marisela Polanco en el check out tuvo una actitud increíble y me hizo sentir muy a gusto y bien recibida en el espacio.

title: Highly recommend
text: Could not beat our stay! The price, location, and staff were amazing! Great place to stay with kids right by time square. Close to great restaurants and theatres. If you are lucky enough to have Fehat Begolli help you with your stay, then hang on to every word. He was great with food and activity recommendations! The entire staff was ready to help! We will be back!

title: Fantastic
text:
We recently stayed at the Edison and were overwhelmed at how wonderful everything was.  Customer service was top-notch, the location was perfect, and the rooms were comfy. 

They had a great wine service with a lovely lounge singer and staying there felt like an event.  Highly recommend staying there.

title: Prime location for a great Times Square experience
text: From the terrace views of Times Square to friendly staff, location,have to say great place to stay. Our tenth anniversary was one to remember thanks to the Hotel Edison and staff for giving us memories that will last a lifetime. If you want to be right in the heart of the madness, this is the place for you.

title: Family Holiday
text: Brilliant hotel, quite literally located in the heart of NYC, Times Square is right on the door step. Everything about the hotel was perfect, rooms spacious and clean- cleaned daily! we had a really enjoyable stay! 10/10, would definitely stay again when in New York

title: Please avoid this hotel
text:
Our room was a massive disappointment:

-outdated which is acceptable but it also looked really tired 
-stains on the walls 
-ripped-up wallpapers
-The carpet looked like it was 30 years old (slippers necessary) 
-The AC unit was very loud and dusty
-The bathroom was fairly clean but the bath itself looked horrible and the ventilation was nonexistent

title: Bien situé mais que de "mais" ...
text:
Bien situé mais ...
Ultra bruyant, en connaissance de cause mais aucune insonorisation intérieure ni extérieure.
A l'arrivée, le personnel de réception fait acte de présence, sans plus.
En partant, après une semaine sur place, nous vérifions que rien n'a été oublié sous les lits et nous découvrons de la nourriture et une bouteille ne nous appartenant pas donc je suppose du client précédent ?!
En effet, l'hôtel profite d'une situation centrale et permet de rayonner facilement à pied vers les différents quartiers périphériques mais la prochaines fois, nous irons plutôt vers DownTown voire Brooklyn ...
Sans parler du restaurant au rez qui propose une carte abordable mais le concept est que les serveurs offrent un "spectacle" entre 18 et 21h00 ... en gros, ils hurlent par dépit de ne pas avoir été repris dans une comédie sur Brodway et empêchent toute conversation mais soit ... expérience à tenter ! ;-)
New York est néanmoins magique et nous revenons enchantés !
Bon séjour à tous !

title: A Great Place to Stay!
text: Hotel Edison is our "go to" hotel in NYC. It has a great location, close to restaurants and theatres.  It is clean and the rooms are lovely, but best of all, the staff is both capable and friendly and goes out of their way to make your stay comfortable. This hotel is a gem.

title: Additional Charges & Mediocrity
text: Titles says it all, go here if you want to pay a surprise 45 dollar fee for a musty small room. The sprinklers in the room were disgusting and the shower water came out brown. Had to have a cot brought in and it was a fire hazard because the photo of the room was inaccurate and much smaller than anticipated.

title: Fantastic location, fantastic price and amazing staff! You can’t go wrong here.
text: Went for the museums and plays. Amazing location. Close to everything and the price was great. Friendly and helpful staff. Above and beyond. My husband was impressed with the price for the location and the staff. The kids loved the style.

title: Not worth the charges
text: The best part of the hotel is it’s location, easy to get about on foot or subway from here. We arrived after a 10 hour train journey to find ourselves in the most awful room at this hotel. The only view was of a massive air conditioning vent and other apartments. The room was small dark and the Noise was something else. I would have got more sleep on the runway at JFK. We went to ask for a new room straightaway but was told the hotel was full. We went back first thing in the morning after 0 sleep to again request a change of room. I was in tears this time. This receptionist was way more helpful and put us down for a new room after 3pm. When we went to the next room it was SO much better!! Like a different hotel up on the 16 th floor. View from the rooms 3 windows straight down to the Hudson River from the bed. Much bigger room. I bet if we had been American we wouldn’t have been in the 1 st nightmare of a room as they wouldn’t put up with it. The hotel gave vouchers for breakfast either on site or a lovely cafe at the end of the same street, so that was a great plus point. We didn’t find the staff here very friendly or accommodating at all. The cleaner on the 16 th floor however was lovely! Rooms were very clean! No heating in the bathrooms so they are a bit chilly but Air Con was much quieter in the room . Beware of the hidden tourist tax at $45 dollars a night as they tax the tax!! Overall we were very pleased with our new room but got off to a terrible start which left a bad impression. Wouldn’t revisit.

title: Edison Hotel, New York. A little gem, a minutes walk from Times Square and Broadway.
text: We stayed at the Edison Hotel, New York as part of our Viva Holiday trip. A wonderful hotel, it was amazing. The location was a minutes walk from Times Square and Broadway and in the heart of theatre land. I could happily spent three weeks there instead of three nights. The room was adequate and the bed was very comfortable. The room and bathroom were very clean and all the staff were very friendly. I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to New York, it is certainly a gem.

title: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly...but we will be back.
text: We had a lovely time in New York and there were only a few but disappointing things at the hotel.  1.) no dresser to put our things away.  This was the first time I ever experienced that.  Is this a NYC thing?  2.) blow dryer was a fire hazard and only worked if you wiggled the cord.  When I tried to tell the lady at the checkout after standing in line 10 minutes, she cut me off while explaining, told me to take it back to my room (we were heading out) and seemed annoyed.  3.) toilet didn't flush properly, we actually had to get toilet paper and manually push our waste down the toilet.  We weren't there long enough to have to wait for someone to fix it and we already experienced a bit of rudeness with the lady at the counter so we just dealt with it...grossly.  Also...the soundproofing kept my husband awake all night..I'm not sure what it would be like without soundproofing as it was very loud.  Especially with the construction outside our window at the Barrymore.  Yikes!  Aside from that, beautiful hotel, great location and staff (for the most part), had a wonderful time in NYC.  So we took the good with the bad and will definitely be back...but will be more bold next time.  ;)  Thank you!

title: Absolutely disgusting!!
text:
There is no doubt that this hotel is close to Times Square and other amenities but the cleanliness leaves a lot to be Desired. 

The rooms are basic and the air conditioning unit is so loud in the middle of the night as well as the street noise in the early hours of the morning keeps you awake. 

Then to be told when you have returned from staying at this hotel you have contracted scabies from most probably the beds that you have slept in is disgusting. 

I would pay that little bit more to stay at a cleaner hotel in the same location.

title: Perfect hotel location, really comfy beds and friendly staff service
text:
I could not believe how close this hotel was to the main square on Times square, under 1 min walk away! I thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. I wasn't sure what to expect as I know its an old hotel, so assumed it would be dated and although it is in places, this only adds to the character. It's got a lot of history and being modernized would probably ruin the ambiance of the hotel. We has a Signature King Terrace room and this was perfect! We had a large bedroom with king bed, the most comfiest bed I have ever stayed in and a living room, each room with a large TV on the wall. 
The hotel is close to hells kitchen area, which I would recommend for some great bars and restaurants, it is directly next to the theatre which has sweeney Todd showing.

I am someone who is used to staying in 5 star hotels normally but I was really happy with this hotel because the location couldn't be any better.

I would get up early and walk to things nearby, to central park, Plaza hotel, 5th Avenue, Grand central station, Rockafella centre, New York Library, all walking distance. We walked to Chelsea market, chelsea from the hotel and to washington Square, Little Italy, china Town, Friends apartment, Carrie Bradshaws apartment from sex in the city, Flat Iron building, empire state building and macys then back to then hotel along 5th Avenue.  This we did all in a day and saw so much just by walking.

title: Won’t stay again
text: First impressions as we checked in were how abrupt the receptionist was that handled us. Telling me that we had to pay for breakfast weather we ate it or not, then tax and a deposit on top, I was not told about this initially, I was furious and I didn’t account for it so I was short on cash for the holiday, it took me a while to shake it off. Even when we checked out, we said ‘thank you for having us’ no response!

title: Make the Edison your NYC home base - clean and great location
text: This was not our first time at the Edison. We enjoy NYC and go fairly often and we were just there for 2 nights for theatre etc. Of all the hotels we have stayed, the Edison is the best! It is a city hotel that feels like a small hotel. We see the same familiar faces and from the doormen, Bobby, Gio and Franklin, we are welcomed with a smile.  If Scott Geres is there, as this last time, he recognized us and greeted us with a handshake and smile and ushered us to checkin. We were on a familiar floor and our room assistant, Mersa, was also warm and welcoming. And after getting our bags into our room and out again, we saw Dan O’Brien, security who even remembered us.  How many hotels or commercial places do you go that makes you feel like family??  With little turnover, The Edison is unique and I believe it starts at the top. No to overlook the obvious, the hotel rooms are also clean, and a great location near Times Square. Frankly, when a hotel experience like this makes it easy, driving hours for a “get-away” isn’t like needing to plan a trip. It becomes more like a visit. We know where to go. Oh, and now we decided to return in April for another show. Many thanks to all at the Edison! We highly recommend this hotel!!

title: Excellent location and value for theater district
text: This older hotel has been refurbished and provides comfortable, clean accomodations. Rum House lounge on the property offers excellent cocktails and jazz. Breakfast is served at the other 2 restaurants on site.

title: A fuir ils vous volent
text:
C’est purement est simplement du vol. Les taxes de séjour nous revenaient à 229 dollars par chambre.
A l’arrivée vous êtes dirigée vers une bonne afin d’effectuer le Check in. Ce qu’ils ne vous disent pas c’est que des taxes seront prélevées par jour sur votre carte bleue à votre méconnaissance. 48 heures après notre retour 311 euros ont été prélevé sur le compte en banque. C’est tout simplement inadmissible. Le personnel à l’accueiil vous indique simplement que la borne « ne fonctionne pas ». Une catastrophe a fuir. Il n’y pas de transparence et ils volent votre argent

title: Convenient, Comfortable, Lots of Amenities in the Hotel
text: A friend recommended this hotel. I was pleasantly surprised that I could get a small suite for a reasonable price. The restaurants were excellent. We took advantage of the free grab and go or $6.50 sit down breakfast every day. We enjoyed being close to everything so all we had to do was walk or take a short subway ride to our destinations.

title: Holiday.
text: Perfect hotel location perfect. Cleanliness on form daily towels and cleaning of the room.  The location was excellent and would highly recommend. I stayed with my family and even with early checkout they stored our luggage for 1 dollar!

title: Excellent Edison!
text:
First of all….. Ignore the poor reviews clearly these people don’t like NYC and thought, “let’s blame the hotel!” 
This holiday is Value for money 110%. JFK to Times Square 1hr 20mins only due to poor traffic during rush hour. 
In to Hotel Edison checked in on the self service system, took 2 mins. 
Then up to our room. (300, THIS IS SPARTA!) Excellent bed king size with the most amazing mattress, safe in room (free simple add a memorable code job done) 
Excellent shower and facilities.
A tad bit noisy but come on ITS TIMES SQUARE!
Restaurant was excellent value for money. Breakfast vouchers from reception gives you a cheap deal on breaky ($6.50) but to be fair we used them and added other bits from the main menu options to set us up for the day. Still worked out cheaper than most external places. 
Bar was fab with great options on food and drink. 
The decor throughout the Edison and the onsite facilities is that of Art Decor and meant to be that era (it wasn’t dated it was on purpose) 
30bucks to get to the Staten Island Ferry then 15 back to 5th Ave then walk back to the Edison.
 It really is in an excellent location with 24/7 bars and food close by. 
The only extra we paid for was the NYC tax which was expected.
The only thing that we would’ve liked was tea/coffee facility in the room but you know what Dunkin’ and Starbucks on every corner so totally forgivable. 😉
Already booking for Christmas 2024 at the Edison. Well done!

title: WOW!!! Great experience!!
text: my wife and I decided to have her Birthday in NYC. I chose the Edison hotel in time square for its convenience to everything we planned for that B day weekend.  WOW!! what an awesome place to stay. We entered the hotel and the GM greeted us as if we had known each other for years. Scott Geres is his name. What a great guy. Warm , friendly, nice and professional.  His staff redponded in kind.  The Hotel was great. The restaurants were fantastic. I recommend the salmon bowel and Wings. The room was perfect. Slept like a king.  The proximity to broadway is unparalleled. We will definitely be staying there again!!!

title: Fantastic stay at Hotel Edison
text:
I changed our booking to Hotel Edison after worrying about the bad reviews our original hotel was getting. So glad I did as the Edison was amazing! The art deco  in the hotel is fabulous, the staff helpful and friendly and the room great. The comfiest bed ever! And a super ‘wet room’ style shower - cleaned daily to a high standard. We also received vouchers to enable us to have a subsidised cost breakfast in ‘Friedmans’ restaurant within the hotel. Amazing food which we paid a bit extra to have the delicious fluffy pancakes!
I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Edison and totally recommend it. We are already looking to book again later this year

title: Avoid
text:
Tex”- manager at hotel- needs to be avoided and reprimanded; if anyone reads this who cares and has influence at Hotel Edison.
Avoid at all costs. Very rude management and poorly run establishment. Booked a stay and called the hotels front desk days earlier specifically to request an early check in. After giving my name and confirmation #, I was told we could be there for 8am check in. As we had a 2.5 hour ride in, this was great. We left the car at valet and went to desk. I was rudely told that my room will not be ready until 4pm. The manager - Tex- refused to be amicable and would not accept that we had made the call earlier in the week. He was accusing me of fabricating the entire story. While I do understand hotels have afternoon check ins, the fact that I called and confirmed an early check-in lulled me to a false sense of security. We had a family get together planned for noon, and when I asked would I be compensated for the hotel’s error, I was told I’d have to come back tomorrow and find the manager. “Tex” did not know who, where or when the manager would be available. When I asked where the manager was right then, he said he didn’t know, probably “upstairs somewhere”. Not sure what answer that is. As I look around the hotel lobby, I notice every single staff person staring at me. Made us feel like complete pariahs.
Now mind you this is a busy Saturday. As I told “Tex” that this was unacceptable, he said there was no way the room would or could be ready, never specified a time to return; just made me guess when until we landed on 4pm, and when I asked him to take down my phone number to call us when it would be ready he wouldn’t even look at me. He said, “whoever told you that information was wrong, I have no record of that phone call, and I don’t know who would say that, but they misspoke, and it was not correct information”. He looked at me as if I was conning him or making things up. As I stood there @830 AM, from out of town, with no hotel reservation for 8 hours, he looked down at his computer ignoring me completely, and rolled his eyes when I asked him to call me when room was available. The phone call never occurred. Due to not being ready for the family get together, we decided to cancel the room reservation and find another hotel that suited our needs (which we were able to do at the Hampton Inn Times Square, highly
recommended).
It was in the 20’s with wind this last weekend, so we were forced to haul our bags outside and walk .8 miles to the hotel which did accommodate us. “Tex” never offered to call a cab or anything as he watched us walk outside. My car was already shuttled off to valet garage and would be 40 minutes before they could retrieve it. It was absolutely freezing and we were wearing casual driving clothes, not winter gear. Should have ordered Uber but we were flustered. The “kind hearted” souls at Edison would not refund the fee; so I was charged, in full, for their incompetence. Even made me pay for bag check while we assessed the situation!
My main goal was to enjoy our weekend so money wasn’t my first priority, but this was a disgusting display of selfishness and cost me hundreds extra. Not a single apology once. Not even a free breakfast voucher
Very predatory tactics for a tourist service business. I was never offered a discount, apology or even a place to sit while we waited. My wife and I decided to sit in the common lounge next to the bathrooms and search for other hotel rooms. We were able to find many. So I was lied to and suffered seemingly fraudulent charges due to their utter incompetence. Had I known the room would not be available I would not have booked it! We didn’t know booking here could have ultimately cost us an entire weekend; and I’d love to help someone else which is why I decided to write this dissertation on my experience.
To anyone that made it this far, we were very happy with our trip to New York City. Just make sure to do your due diligence when booking a hotel.
Avoid Hotel Edison and “Tex”

title: Best time ever
text:
Staff and service were excellent, Room was great always cleaned, bars and restaurant were nice, hotel central to Times Square.
Fehat Begolli was of great help, we asked so many questions and he was able to help with no hesitations.
Will definitely be back 
Thank you Hotel Edison

title: Fair
text: I suggest you take down from the booking.com app/website that breakfast is included. It’s not included . It’s $6.50 + tips and taxes !! The grab and go breakfast isn’t the first cousin of a breakfast . It wouldn’t feed a mouse and it’s just sitting there for ages in a heated environment squashed to a pancake . Very disappointing attempt to be fair . You should make it more clear when selling a room with breakfast included. A tea and coffee facility in the room is a must in this day of age . It’s available in 2 star hotels. One single USB port in the room which I was lucky to find on an old radio . The man with a jackhammer outside my bedroom window early in the morning added injury to insult . A 2.5 star hotel at best. Super location is what it has going for it .. Been an experienced traveller I rate the place 5 out of 10 .

title: Overall a great hotel , nothing negative to say.
text: Great hotel a few steps from Times Square.Room was so comfortable wish we could bring the bed and pillows home!  Breakfast in Friedmans they give you a voucher for grab and go in The Rum house but we like to sit down for breakfast so paid the extra $6.40 to sit down and eat .really lovely.nice room plenty clean towels and a coffee machine.every day they supplied bottles of water too.overall a great stay this is our 2nd time here.

title: NYC Visit Feb 2024
text:
The good: 

Perfect location - Right next to Times Square

Comfy bed & pillows

Fresh towels daily

Very helpful & friendly Bellman named Fehat Begolli whom we met on our last day

Thank you Fehat, it was our pleasure to meet you 🤩

The bad:

So noisy from the outside traffic - the constant hooting of cars and sirens, we found it hard getting used to. 

Having to pay an extra $13 for the two of us just for seating in Friedmans restaurant to eat a pre paid breakfast - we didn’t like.

Overall we enjoyed our stay with your hotel - the good outweighed the bad.

title: The Best Hotel in Time Square!
text: Phenomenal experience! The room was amazing! My bed was so comfortable, great bedding and pillows.   The staff was super nice and there anytime I needed help.  Rommel the Concierge was so friendly and made me feel at home. They have a little happy hour with wine and live music at 5 pm on Wednesdays and  Fridays. If you need anything don’t hesitate to ask the staff. A grab and go breakfast is included too or you can get a sit down breakfast for a small cost of 6.50. Oh and you’re right by Time Square and all the best Broadway shows too!

title: Excellent place to stay!
text: We were in town for a play, the Hotel Edison was a short walk to the theater! Everything was incredible! The hotel staff was friendly, the rooms were beautiful! Will definitely stay again! Highly recommend!

title: THEY HAVE NOT RETURNED MY DEPOSIT
text:
Hi. Has anyone else had issues with Hotel Edison not releasing their deposit?
My girlfriend and I stayed there at the end of January and were told to pay $300 when we got there as a security deposit and were assured we would be getting our refund within a week of checking out. It has been over a month and we have still not received our money despite numerous emails sent. So unprofessional and disappointing. Please get in touch with me. Thank you

title: Recepción muy poco amable , hotel ruidoso por dentro y por fuera ,engaño con tasas y con cambio de habitación asignada
text:
De primeras nos cobran 300 dólares aprox por los servicios del hotel , (servicios como el wifi que no va , dos botellas de agua y champú en lugar de gel por que se les acabó el gel .)tasa  que se han inventado ya que teníamos todo pagado desde la
Agencia .
En segundo lugar , nos dan una habitación que no se parece en nada a la que ya teníamos asignada por agencia ( muy inferior ) .
Después de hablar con el de la recepción que dice que no habla español ( otra mentira más que comprobamos a los pocos días al verle hablar con otros clientes )
Nos dan una habitación más grande , ruidosa por el ruido de la calle del pasillo y con el aire acondicionado sonando a cacharro ruidoso y viejo y sacando más aire frío que el de la calle . 
Vamos nos sentimos engañados , muy engañados y no recomiendo este hotel a nadie .
Principalmente por el pésimo trato a las personas además de todo lo expuesto anteriormente .
Informaré a conocidos míos que realizan guías para New York sobre este hotel y más experiencias pésimas de esta gran ciudad .

title: Another great stay!
text: This was my second time staying at Hotel Edison. Both of my stays have been fantastic. My husband and I stayed here originally due to its great location. It is directly in the heart of the theater district. We literally walked only a few streets to Time Square (and our theater). The hotel staff is very friendly and accommodating. I will continue to stay here in the future.

title: Terrible
text:
The worst room I’ve ever stayed at - dark (no ceiling lights), just 1 bedside lamp between two double beds. Tired and old decor, small room size, tiny basic bathroom with mold, cracked door and many areas in the room that needed to be looked at. 2 bottles of water and 1 x small bottle of shower gel for 4 people for the whole stay.
No tea/coffee/kettle or fridge in the room.
There’s a safe but it’s payable, have to swipe your credit card to activate it. 
Security by the lift would ask to see your room key every time you use the lift. 
I found the lady at the breakfast restaurant rude.
No smoking family outdoors nearby the hotel.  
Woke up at 04:00 the first morning from a loud banding noise from the huge flag that was positioned outside the window. I wish I could upload a video on here. How are these rooms offered? 
I wish the management can spend a night in one of them, room number 409.

Had to turn on the loud heater to the max level to create a noise to mask banging sound of the flag and its wires. Room felt like a sauna. Could still not sleep. The same for night two. I’m glad I didn’t have to stay longer. 

2 stars go to the location.

title: Tired, tatty and poor service
text:
Grand entrance, then it goes downhill from there. Check in was OK albeit an unfriendly first impression. 
Room for 4 people should have had 2 x queen beds, they were double beds…
2 bottles of water in room for 4 people, this never changed in a 5 day stay
No tea/coffee making facility, I enquired at reception for this, this was then brought to the room, well almost thrown at us, although no cups. We asked the housekeeping again 2 days later and she provided what we needed (happily) 
The carpet is tatty and torn, several filthy areas in the room including a previous residents sock! Bathroom vents covered in dust and debris. Little bit grim to be honest.

Felt like vermin rather than a customer. Speak to the reception at your peril!

An average offering and would not recommend for a family break.

title: Fabulous birthday trip!
text: This hotel is in the perfect location for theater going.  Staff was so friendly and helpful.  I went for my 60th birthday and found a bottle of wine, Schmackery cookies, and chocolate in my room.  The Rum House happy hour was great and the grab and go breakfast or $5.00 vouchers for either of the two restaurants were a great bonus.  I would highly recommend!

title: Heat hotel and location was so good
text: This is a great hotel I will definitely be back nothing was too much trouble the gentleman at the front was there to help make sure that everything was as it should be helping customers to be at the right place they needed to be

title: meh
text: no wifi,sonidos molestos en la noche,personal poco empatico, aire acondicionado expulsaba frío durante la noche sin ningún motivo y además sonaba como si tuviera un montón de ratas dentro,no entiendo por qué ,pero bueno 4/10

title: Great Hotel
text: This place never disappoints.  Rooms are always clean, and the staff is exceptional and attentive. The location is perfect, in the heart of everything you need.  Close to subway, close to Broadway, everything.  There is always someone available 24 hours to address your needs.

title: Perfect location for seeing NYC
text: Took my high school senior on an 18th birthday trip. The Edison was a great spot for launching exploration. We walked up to Central Park and to the Museum of Natural History one day. Then we walked down to Greenwich Village the next. On our last night we went to dinner and a show. The hotel is clean, very well staffed, and safe.

title: Excellent location and clean hotel
text: Excellent location in theatre district and Times Square.  Good service and clean room.  Lot of history in this hotel.  Only bummer was that the 46th street access was blocked; thought likely for security.  Everything of interest was within walking distance.

title: Wonderful location for Broadway shows.
text: The Hotel Edison is a wonderful place to stay in New York City to take in Broadway shows.  It is s short distance from the discount ticket booth on Times Square and sits squarely in the heart of the theater district and on subway lines that connect to LaGuardia.  The staff is friendly and helpful (like Melissa at the front desk) and the rooms comfortable and well appointed.  The grab and go breakfast saves time and gets one started promptly.  I really like the art deco look and all the paintings in the lobby.  The 6 elevators are fast and efficient.  I was pleased to learn of the history of the hotel from General Manager Luidin De Los Santos who introduced me to the hotel's owner who was visiting.  I return to the Hotel Edison every year because it makes my stay so enjoyable.  The Edison earns my five star rating!

title: Hanniel saved our trip!
text: After booking through a third party, we arrived for our stay with the wrong name on our reservation. Hanniel went above and beyond to help us fix it and upgraded our room at no cost. This employee took a super stressful time and flipped it to a positive! Thanks Hanniel!

title: Worst experience
text: I had a terrible experience. The room was dirty and even after asking for soap four times, no one brought it. Additionally, no one answered the phone when I called for assistance. The receptionist was impolite and not helpful at all. Moreover, there was no internet connection and the air conditioning system made an annoying sound that kept me up the entire night.

title: NEW YORK HOTEL EDISON TIME SQUARE
