text: Poorly maintained room, dirty fixtures and noisy plumbing all night resulted in a poor overal experience. Watch out for the restaurant as they will try to charge you for additional items and tips . Sadly we have stated here numerous times before however at this price point there a numerous ‘branded’ locations that we can choose in the future

title: rating not good
text: rating was not good as we had dirty sheets  no allocation to a terrance which was “normal” and locked drawers like we were five year olds. the outside was locked too because it was “policy” however i paid for it ?…

title: Book here
text: This hotel I would recommend to anyone! The location is amazing, you are so close to everything. The staff were very friendly and helpful, opening doors for you, polite and help with anything need be. The hotel itself, yes there is construction going on outside which wasn’t an issue for me, but it was very clean, tidy and modern. The breakfast vouchers provided were amazing value and the breakfast itself was delicious. We attended both the restaurant and rum bar, both of which were amazing and the staff great. The bedroom was huge and very clean. Bathroom very clean also. This hotel had no issues for me what so ever. I would recommend anyone at all if staying in New York and want somewhere accessible, clean and worth the price to book here!

title: Top Notch
text: I chose Hotel Edison based on location to the Broadway theaters, next door and across the street. This hotel is near all the action in Times Square and walking distance to a lot of landmarks. Standard rooms, while small, were great for getting ready to be out all day and close enough to stop back in to get ready for dinner and shows at night. The bed was so comfortable and I slept very well. Hotel lobby is currently being renovated but still spacious, enough seating while waiting. The staff were very kind and courteous. There are plenty of restaurant options, we dined in for breakfast and also got the grab n go breakfast option at Bond 45 and the food was delicious. We had a late flight upon checkout day and appreciated that we could check bags for them to hold so we could venture out more without lugging them around. Overall, great experience and I would definitely stay here again!

title: Great hotel, but…
text: Staff will flip your Do Not Disturb card to Make Up The Room while you’re sleeping. We witnessed it. Great service staff and location. Comfortable bedding and mattresses. But we won’t be back due to cleaning staff.

title: Christmas week 2023
text: We spent 6 nights at the Edison & found it to be a lovely experience, the room was spacious & clean, we didn't have a view but that was ok because we were out enjoying the sights all day, the grab & go breakfast was great & the staff were all very pleasant, we have already recommended this hotel for a great place to stay.

title: Hotel for Price/Value
text: There was no city view, there is a very dirty window in the rooms which face to a wall. You cannot open the window and the AC is very loud. Rooms are not properly cleaned, and unfortunately the bathrooms are incredibly small. The toilet is almost like the ones in sailing boats. Unfortunately, if you want something special, this hotel does not offer that. But if you are trying to just stay in a hotel near Times Square, this can be an option regarding the price.

title: Absolutely perfect stay
text:
I have just returned here following a four night bar at and cannot fault it in anyway. It really was fantastic. I was a bit concerned before I came with some of the reviews but it really was fantastic. Some reviews of noise worried me as I am a light sleeper but I don’t think I was disturbed once during the night. We were in the tenth floor and faced away from the street. 

I had been in contact with the hotel (Kezia) with a few questions as it was my first visit to NYC and she was great in coming back to me. 

Upon arrival she also knocked at the room with a couple of bars of chocolate and a Hotel Edison teddy for my daughter which she loved. Didn’t expect this at all and was very appreciative. 

My daughter had the do not disturb sign up on the door so after a couple of days one of the security came and knocked and said it was just to check everything is OK as we have it down as do not disturb for a few days. The guy was great and friendly and had a laugh for a few minutes. 

Had a slight issue with payment checking out but again Kezia was quick to respond (it wasn’t actually the hotels fault I had just red it wrong) but the quick reply was great. 

Considering it’s the middle of Times Square too I expected a load of noise. Couldn’t be more wrong. Perfect place. The people on the front desk that check your cards before you get in the lift are always friendly. 

Again thanks to Kezia just for a small gesture but that very above my expectations. Great service. I will recommend the vote to anyone who asks.

title: Ruim!
text:
Unica vantagem é a localização, de resto nada vale a pena! Atendimento péssimo, café da manhã deplorável (grab and go) e sem sequer um local descente pra sentar e comer, quartos apertados e banheiros com instalações bem ruins. 
Nao voltaria a ficar nele de jeito nenhum.

title: Anthony villa
text: Everything  was great all the way from service to the rooms. Restaurant food was great security was awsome. The only thing me and the wife didn't like was instead of sending are bags to the room they held are bags and then we had to pay for them.

title: Gem of hotel
text: Location perfect for a show and dinner. Courteous staff. Friendly. Clean. Good food. Spacious room for two. Charming. Grab and go breakfast was good and plenty of food. Book through hotel for perks. Michael Jackson show was amazing. Are at Tony’s. Family style and delicious! Crave was for breakfast and late night pizza. Perfect trip. Will be back to Edison.

title: Disappointing
text:
Too many issues with rooms, internet etc. Poorly furnished, they are removing shower doors according to front desk if yours is missing but will supply extra towels if the floor becomes too wet?????
Expected better

title: Fantastic
text: I recommend Hotel Edison! I am a repeat guest and will return. The entire staff is accommodating from checking in, to helping us with transportation, and dinner reservations. Rashawn was wearing his reindeer antlers and really spread the holiday cheer to all the guests! Thank you for such a memorable trip with my elderly mom and daughter. Already have The Edison on my calendar for December 2024. The location is perfect, walking distance to Hamilton, Lion King, and Times Square! Heck, I could just live there forever!

title: Central location
text: Great stay. Pity about the noise and poor windows . Extremely cold air coming in and was told to turn heating up and then they stuck a bit of foam into the gap but still no improvement! Second attempt to fix it, unscrewed and screwed back but again no improvement!

title: Great location
text: We stay at the Hotel Edison because it's a fantastic location.  Close to the theaters and easy walking distance to all we want to see/do.  My husband loves the rum bar, the drinks and the vibe.  There were some hiccups but would still recommend.

title: Short stay
text: This is the second time I have stayed here and found the staff very pleasant and accommodating.The location is great for access to times square.I found the room to be fine for what I required and I will definitely be staying here again.

title: Never would I recommend.
text: This hotel was dated and nothing like the pictures online.  Very misleading.  Carpets taped down, broken plug sockets.  Bathroom very very small and stained and dated. The staff apart from the house keepers were very rude.  Not helpful at all.

title: Excelente estadía en el centro de todo.
text: Lo mejor es que por $1 velan tu equipaje antes del check in a lo que miras a Nueva York o luego de tu check out si tu viaje es nocturno. El equipo es muy amable y los cuartos muy limpios. El desayuno To Go es excelente.

title: A NYC Christmas
text: Christmas in the Big Apple at the Hotel Edison. Amazing location, so close to Broadway, Times Square & more. Amazing staff, so polite & helpful. Comfy bed & pillows. Overall, an amazing experience. Highly recommend. We had the corner family connecting suite with 3 bigs & 2 bathrooms; so worth it if you’re traveling with 4 or more people.

title: Christmas in NYC
text: Perfect hotel in the heart of Times Square.  Historical art deco design.  The restaurant was good, but not as good as the old Cafe Edison.  Front desk staff needs to give more info and be less hurried. Been staying here for 30 years.

title: Great Stay near Broadway Shows
text:
A+++
Fantastic location in the middle of Broadway theater district.  Great food at Bond.  Parking Valet went off without a hitch.  Checkin was uber easy as was checkout.  Rooms were clean and made up daily.

title: Fantastic Hotel
text: Stayed for 4 nights in December and can’t fault this place. The rooms are spacious and beds comfy. All the staff we encountered were extremely friendly and helpful. The location is fantastic just seconds walk from Times Square. There is a free takeaway breakfast or breakfast available to sit down in Friedmans restaurant for $5. Both were really good. I really look forward to staying here again when we return to New York.

title: December visit
text: The staff was excellent. It was convenient having the restaurants and bar on location. Even though the bathroom was a bit small, my daughter and I were very comfortable staying at the Edison. The hotel is  located near several theaters, including the Richard Rodgers, and we were easily able to walk to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and MoMA. We would definitely stay at the Edison again.

title: Great stay
text: We enjoyed our location in the theater district.  It was close to the shows, tine square, and tons of venues that we visited. Great place to stay and enjoy all that New York City has to offer our family on vacation!

title: Not As Expected
text: The pictures of the room make it look more comfortable and inviting than they actually are.  They are small.  Perhaps this is normal for NYC, but it was my first time actually staying in a hotel in the city.  Not sure I'd stay again.

title: Would not stay a second time
text: Small bathrooms, rooms have minimal furniture, looks like the room wasn't finished being remodeled. Heard rats in the ac/heating system. Front desk said they would send Security up (why Security? 🤷‍♂️) -- they never came.

title: Birthday weekend
text: Excellent staff and friendly.  Rooms were clean, felt safe and they made my granddaughter feel special for her 5th birthday.  They put a teddy bear in her room along with a card and goodies. Would defiantly stay there again

title: Great place to stay
text: So close to Times Square, in the theatre district.   Great restaurants in the hotel.  Staff was very friendly.   It's easy to walk wherever you want to go.   It's in a great location.   It's my 5th time to stay there and would definitely stay there again.

title: Great hotel in a good location
text: Apart from terrible wifi, all was very good. Location was amazing, round the corner from Times Sq. yet quiet. Good family room (2 rooms, 3 beds). We would definitely return. Perfect location for for exploring much of Manhattan

title: Nice stay
text: Beds are good rooms are a little small but that is to be expected.Great location close to everything. It would be nice to have a small table and chairs in the room. The breakfast we had included was very good at Carve sandwiches just down the street.

title: Love this Gem!
text: I've stayed at Hotel Edison several times over the past 20+ years.  It's a lovely hotel with a great location, but the rooms were in dire need of an update.  Thankfully, most of the rooms have been remodeled.  We just completed a 5-night stay and was extremely happy with our room and the service we received.  We ate at both restaurants, Friedman's and Bond 45 several times (we received $5 breakfast vouchers for our entire stay).  Bond 45, in particular, was exceptional - great food and a great atmosphere (downstairs).  We will definitely stay at Hotel Edison again.

title: Absolutely Amazing
text: What an amazing trip from start to finish! As soon as we checked in we got such a warm welcome from the lady on the desk who gave us a complimentary upgrade we were stunned ! The grab and go breakfast is above and beyond what we expected and couldn’t ask for anything better. The Croissants and the Bacon Egg bap were just delicious. Let me tell you the beds in this hotel is amazing some mornings we struggled to get up they were that comfortable and let’s be honest this is exactly  what you need after all the exploring! To top it off your a stone throw away from Times Square and so central to everything else… Honestly I can’t fault it and I genuinely cant recommend it enough! When I am back in New York I will defiantly be staying again and telling friends and family to do the same

title: Great location, cost, service and VIBE.
text:
I began this as a business trip and added an extra night for my husband and myself. I work in the city but recently our organization's "preferred" hotel prices skyrocketed, so my agent found a new place. 

I love Hotel Edison for its retro vibe, clean and comfortable accommodations, friendly and helpful staff, security elevator access, and on-site food/drink options. The Rum House is really cool -- but get there early or else you won't find a seat -- and the bartender there is on point! 

Best of all, Hotel Edison is in an awesome location -- just steps away from Times Square, and a block or two from Rockefeller Center, Penn Station, Bryant Park. So much to do and see, with the convenience of collapsing, exhausted, in your quiet hotel room at night!

title: Loving Hotel Edison
text:
I have been a loyal customer for 38 years and can’t wait to return in 2024!!! This year we had a group of 20 and everyone loved it. 

The hotel is the very best of New York. It has the absolute best location. Only 1/2 block from the red bleachers in Times Square, yet quiet enough to really rest after a busy day. The rooms are so comfortable and the staff is simply amazing!! 

I highly recommend this place. It gives you the best feeling and charm of old New York with all the comforts and amenities of modern New York. It is simply great.

title: Fehat Begolli guest service
text: Fehat begolli was so helpful with our bags and service. He went above and beyond to make our stay pleasant and enjoyable. He was friendly, kind, helpful attentive    We absolutely loved him. I will return to this hotel specifically because of Fehat.

title: Girls Trip
text:
Great location, Friendly staff!! Beds were comfortable, but no fridge, otherwise we had a blast!
Everything was in walking distance. Restaurants at Hotel was very good, and the Bartender at Bond 45 was hilarious. Highly recommend seeing the Rocketts, loved the Christmas show.  Will definitely stay there again.

title: Honest Review of Hotel Eddison
text:
We recently stayed at Hotel Eddison with high expectations, but unfortunately, our experience was far from satisfactory. The most significant issue was the constant noise in the bathroom that persisted throughout the night. Despite our efforts to shut the door, the noise was disruptive, leading to several sleepless nights for some of us.

Additionally, the room's air conditioning was unreliable, only functioning intermittently. This contributed to an overall feeling of discomfort and grogginess, further impacting our stay.

It's important to acknowledge that the hotel staff were quite friendly and welcoming. Their demeanor was a positive aspect of our stay. However, the quality of the room and the issues we encountered were major drawbacks.

Considering the substantial amount we paid for our stay, we expected a much more comfortable and restful experience. Unfortunately, due to these issues, we were unable to fully enjoy our trip, missing out on planned visits to significant places like the 911 Museum and Central Park.

In conclusion, while the staff were  commendable for their hospitality, the room's condition and the noise issue significantly marred our stay. We hope this feedback helps in improving the experience for future guests.

title: No.  Just no.
text: In a city of a zillion hotels, this is not one to waste your money on.  Greeted by a rude front desk person, nickled and dimed for everything from checking in 30 minutes early to bag storage to wait out the 30 minutes.  The room is tiny and run down with low budget linens and a bathroom that feels like you’re in a tiny public restroom.  The only pluses I can think of are the queen bed was firm and the hotel is centrally located.  There are so many better places to stay.  I would NOT recommend this place AT ALL.

title: This hotel is terrible.  One of the worst
text: If you are looking for an overpriced dive hotel with unprofessional staff….. this is it.  The rooms are worn, old, small and in need of repair.  Ac/heat did not work . The room was too hot to sleep.   Overall a very bad choice.

title: Comfortable and Convenient
text: Hotel Edison was in an incredibly convenient location! The price was astonishing given where we were located, the size of the room, and the complimentary breakfast options. My only complaints were that the room was very dry (not sure anything can be done to fix this) and the wifi cut in and out. I travelled with my 5 month old son and they provided a crib for the room and plenty of coffee! We needed a fridge in the room and they delivered us one no problem! The staff was super attentive and friendly. I’d highly recommend!

title: Great location but loud
text: Great location, easy to get everywhere we wanted to. The rooms allowed a lot of noise transfer, so sleep was hard. There were extension cords running across the floor, but I suppose that is to be expected for an older building with poor outlet placement.

title: Canise is the Best!!
text: I recently stayed at the Hotel Edison from 11/30/23-12/3/23 and experienced one the most enjoyable stays in all my 20 years of staying at the Edison. The staff from the doormen, security, housekeeping staff, and especially the front desk treated me like royalty! One person I would like to recognize is Canise. She is a phenomenal person who truly cares about her guests. She treats everyone like family, and assures all your needs are taken care of. It is her mission to greet all the guests of Hotel Edison, and treats all like family! There was never a time when I encountered Canise, when she didn’t greet me by name. I look forward to coming back just to see Canise. She is an asset to the organization, and should be recognized as a outstanding employee. I look forward to coming back to the Edison next year just to see her. Kudos to Canise!

title: Don’t go unless you want to be unhappy
text: Brown water coming out sink no shower door rooms tiny loud to much construction. Had to switch rooms three times due to room flaws and still ended up with a room I was unhappy with staff were great. Breakfast was okay

title: Wouldn’t come back
text: Came for work, wouldn’t come back. Staff was friendly but actually sleeping/staying in the room wasn’t great. Heater in room broken and pipe making noise in the wall all night long. Was not overly enjoyable.

title: Good hotel but lacked customer service and was expensive in comparison
text: Great hotel situated in the centre of time square. Busy and not the cheapest. Staff failed to respond to pre stay communications but overall enjoyed our stay. Having visited once I actually wouldn’t stay there again but that is not a reflection of the hotel more so the prices around time square generally are so much more expensive than similar hotels in Manhattan. . Ie nearest shop to hotel Edison charged $9 dollars per can of lager. Chemist/grocery stores near empire state and financial district were $4. Just an example but you get the picture.

title: Great location
text: The overall rating is 4 stars because of the quality of customer service I received from the front desk throughout our stay. Without them the trip would have not been as enjoyable. The location is prime.

title: Nice location! Nice hotel!
text: I read reviews of the hotel being outdated but we did not see that. We had a room on the 22nd floor and it was very nice. Fast elevators. Breakfast was provided and was nice. Overall really great stay especially for the price and location!

title: Holiday
text: Not a good stay waste of money and would not recommend it. Felt like a losing battle as they were too busy to assist my with our needs, which were normal requirements for friends on holiday, deco building was characterful but needs a good renovation

title: Needs updating
text:
Location is amazing as is customer service. But the rooms are not good - the lighting is really bad - and there are  not many plug holes so charging phones etc is difficult. We ended up using the bathroom
To charge phones and iPads

title: One of the bucket list!
text:
Easy check in given room 402 which is a bit on the small side but we were eager to explore so headed out, once back in the room and trying to get settled the noise outside was horrendous building work next door which went on 24/7
Our room was so cold the window was broken so the noise and cold came in, complained to reception the next day and receptionist said she would get someone to have a look at heating and window, and gave us half of resort fee back as a good will gesture which was fine and all was fixed, can honestly say brilliant front of house, BUT very outdated old rooms that need a good refurb heating that just makes a noise all night would definitely not recommend this hotel pay a little bit more for a better one

title: Christmas in NYC
text: Perfect location for our Christmas trip to New York City. Close to everything.  Friendly staff, nice restaurants and bars within hotel.  Our only issue was shower water temperature.  Would stay here again.

title: Great location, very nice hotel
text: Great location, very nice hotel, staff in the hotel always seem busy and not always the friendliest. Rooms are great size and clean. I would recommend this hotel for anybody wanting to be right in the middle of everything!

title: Excellent
text: The hotel is in a perfect location for tourists, Times Square, close enough to a lot of things and perfect for walking out and seeing everything. The staff are helpful and the hotel is clean and tidy.

title: Convenient and comfortable.
text: Good location, excellent restaurant options in hotel. Easy checkin. We like a full service hotel that is more boutique than chain and this was just right. Room was easy to reach without long hallways and it was comfortable.

title: Good hotel
text: Was a good hotel, just not a great nights sleep. We were prepared for this though as some of the reviews said we’d hear noises from the street which was obviously guaranteed, we didn’t mind the street noise but we were woken up every night to a banging noise coming from inside the walls in our room, it was scary to be honest. Anywho, the hotel was nice, clean and the staff were friendly and welcoming.

title: LOVED Our Stay at Hotel Edison
text: We stayed here 4 nights during our dream Christmas in NYC trip and were NOT disappointed. Absolutely PERFECT location, clean and large (by NYC standards) rooms, friendly and helpful staff (shout out to Christian at the front desk), and awesome pizza and breakfast packages. The hotel had a fun vibe, was super festive, and made the perfect landing point for our magical vacation. Would absolutely stay here again.

title: my stay
text: good overall ; the location is very good , The room was small ( for the same price ( 560 USD / night) rooms are bette in Europe) but we didn't hear any noise when sleeping. Cleanliness and serive were excellent

title: The Staff made this hotel!
text: I cannot say enough good things about the front desk staff, especially Hanniel.  We would have had an awful stay at the Edison if it wasn't for him.  It was my daughter's first time to New York and all she wanted was a room with a view.  Unfortunately the first room we got had a concrete structure right outside the window blocking any view we might have had.  Hanniel went above & beyond searching for another similar sized/price room with a view on a very busy holiday weekend.  We are so grateful for kind people like him!!!

title: Great value for your money
text:
This hotel is in the perfect location,  just steps away from Time Square... you can easily walk to many locations from Rockefeller Centre to Madison Square Gardens...and everything in between!
Rooms are small,  but that is to be expected in NY... 
Clean, decently priced... overall great value

title: A Great Place to Stay
text:
Great location! Very comfortable place to stay. Bed and pillows are excellent. Convenient and inexpensive breakfast.
Times Square half a block away, theaters close by.
Staff is attentive, courteous, respectful.
Second stay there. Would definitely stay a third time.

title: Mi experiencia
text:
Buenos días, 
La estancia estuvo bien , pero al realizar el chek-in, nos hicieron pagara una fianza que iba a ser devuelta al terminar nuestro alojamiento, y que en 10 días nos lo devolvería el banco. Cosa que no ha ocurrido, pasado dos mes, intento matenerme en contacto con ellos pero no contestan. Espero que al menos tengais la amabilidad de responderme en esta reseña. 
Si me podrías contatar en este correo os lo agradecería: lauralopezmartin14@gmail.com
Un saludo.

title: Good Hotel But Some Caveats
text:
Nice hotel, clean, and not too far from everything happening at Rockefeller Center for the holiday season, but we did have some issues that we were upset about. The website list that you can get a rollaway bed, but we were declined, even though we were in a king suite, because we were told it was not a room that had the right configuration and not large enough, which did not make any sense. We also just wanted a quick cup of coffee before we came down for breakfast and I was a little disturbed that we had to pay for it. if I knew that I would’ve went down to the corner to the local Starbucks and got some thing a little better for the price! Had to “fight“ twice with the front desk and need to speak with a manager about different issues. All in all it is a very nice hotel  That was very clean and we did love the restaurant for dinner with the singing servers, which was one of the main reasons we actually stayed at the hotel. 
.

title: Perfect experience in a wonderfully comfortable environment.
text: Excellent customer service from beginning to end. All the amenities needed. Perfect location 1 block off Times Square and an easy stroll to Rockefeller Center to see the Christmas Tree! An amazing experience in the heart of the city.  Can’t wait to stay there again.

title: All round an amazing experience
text: The hotel was exemplary in every way, the rooms were always clean and tidy, the bar and restaurant were always busy but service was not slow.  The door team and baggage team were great, very helpful and always had good interactions, always funny and good to speak to. Overall an amazing experience, would highly recommend the hotel.

title: Great location but that's it...
text:
When I search for a place to stay, I look at the ratings, location and that breakfast is included in the price. Hotel Edison is in the perfect location being half a block from Times Square. The ratings were ok. Not stupendous but ok. And breakfast was included. Well, breakfast was not really included. We received a voucher for either grab and go or $5 meal at Bond 45. My sister and I wanted a good hot meal before hitting the streets on Sunday morning so we went to Bond 45. The voucher is very misleading. We assumed we'd give them the voucher, eat and head out. Nope. When the waiter said we had to pay $10.89 for the plate of fruit and bowl of oatmeal my sister and I shared, I literally laughed out loud. Seriously?!??! You said breakfast was included. Why did we have to pay??? You should update the voucher to read the grab and go is included but to sit down is not. We were very disappointed. The street vendors had much better food. As for cleanliness, all I have to say is eww, gross. When I found hair in the bathroom that did not belong to my sister and I (we both have red hair... it was brown), I thought I was going to vomit. My sister called to request that we be moved to a new room but we could not. The front desk said they would send the cleaning staff to wipe down the bathroom again. Instead, the housekeeping manager arrived, inspected the bathroom, picked up the hairs and flushed them in the toilet. No wipe down. No cleaning. So gross.  

Thankfully, the rest of NYC met our expectations and we had a magnificent time.

title: Great hotel experience
text: The beds were very comfortable. All the staff we interacted with were very courteous and helpful. We had breakfast in the restaurant and it was delicious. The hotel is in a great location, just steps away from Times Square. We were traveling with 11 family members. We highly recommend Hotel Edison!

title: A wonderful hotel
text: Excellent location - steps from Times Square and Broadway theaters. Our single room with two queens wasn't ready on check in, so they gave us two adjacent rooms (one with a king, one with a queen) at no extra cost!

title: I have been to better hotels, I won't be back come back
text:
Check in was a nightmare.  Having to wait in line twice with the second line incredibly long.. 
 See review written inside.  Room was clean but noisy at night.  I thought I over paid for the room.  The location was good.

title: Nice place to stay
text: Well organized, clean. Enjoyed our stay. Friendly staff. WiFi was a little shotty.  Breakfast was good. Elevators took some time to get up & down, but there were a lot of people there… I would recommend staying here.

title: Check in
text:
The check in process was a breeze, particularly due to the friendly, smiling assistance of Aminata.  She listened to our needs and was genuinely interested in creating a positive Edison experience for us. 
 She was a delight to work with.

title: Great location
text: Great location and staff were very friendly and helpful.  Breakfast at the hotel and Carve were excellent.  Wifi was not the best as signal was poor for iPhone and television services.  Everything was in walking distance and the subway was not hard to use being a first time user of the subway.  Going around December was magical.

title: Lovely Staff and Excellent location!
text: What a great stay in a storied hotel with interesting history, the first hotel with electricity in NYC.  You notice the little things, the woodwork, the doorknobs in the room, the key holes....it's not a modern room but if you want a room that is clean, comfortable with nods to its history and super friendly, helpful staff this place is a winner.  We loved our stay!  The location was perfect.  The hotel has 2 restaurants and a bar.  A concierge, a doorman, porters, the full experience.  And everyone seemed in a good mood, smiling, asking about your day.  We stayed in a Classic room with two queens.  Plenty of room for luggage and to move around the room.  Would definitely stay here again!

title: Very nice and clean hotel
text: The hotel is in a great location, right next to Times Square. They have two restaurants downstairs and a Starbucks at the corner. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. My room was small, but it had all that I needed. If you need more space, I'd go with a different hotel such as Hilton Garden. Thanks!

title: Bad experience
text: Most hotels dont charge extra for the 3rd and 4th guest in same room, well this one does. I thought the extra money would be justified, it was not. Tiny room for 4 adults, no furniture, poor lighting, loud clanky noise on the heating pipe... Very unpleasant.

title: Excellent place to stay!
text: Excellent location very near Times Square, Broadway theaters, and Subway stops . Wonderfully attentive staff that go above and beyond! Great on-site restaurants that allow for grab-and-go or sit-down breakfast, lunch, and dinner. When I visit NYC this is the only place I stay.

title: Great location, uncomfortable room
text: Just steps from Times Square.  The room was very clean but small.  Our room was very hot on arrival.  Maintainance arrived promptly and got the room AC to work, but the room would never cool down.  And this is on a december day.  Room was very overpriced for what you get.

title: Nice place but unorganized and lots of issues
text: They charged me twice. They couldn’t validate my parking with the card on file because I didn’t have it with me, and when they tried to validate it with another card, it wouldn’t go through because it was marked as fraud because they had previously tried to charge that card when they double charged me and then it wouldn’t go through. I also called prior to booking to make sure there was a microwave and refrigerator in the suite because I have an infant and I needed to be able to store milk and have a way to heat it up. I was told that they would be both in the suite. Upon arrival, neither were in the suite. I had to call the front desk, and they found items that they could bring to the suite but it took several hours. I Purchased the festive retreat package and was given two vouchers for hot chocolate at Friedmans restaurant as part of the package. We tried to redeem them twice and were told that they didn’t have time to redeem the voucher because they were too busy. Only about 3/4 of the tables were sat, because the other reservations obviously hadn’t shown up yet. It was very upsetting.

title: Great experience!
text: we enjoyed our stay very much. The location is in a great spot. We were able to walk everywhere. This staff was very helpful and friendly. The rooms were clean and we were able to get Service daily when requested. Overall, our experience was great for the amount of money we paid. I would recommend this day to anyone wanting to be in the middle of all the action and easily accessible to all of the location people like to visit.

title: Excellent Positions with something to improve
text: The hotel has an outstanding position in the center of NYC close to the main attractions reachable in few minutes by walking. Room (suite with 1 bed king and sofà for 4 people small and without an adeguate guardrobe). Bathroom and cleaning of the room very good. Heater system noisy and not well working.

title: Great location. Poor comfort.
text:
Great location.
The roms are small. Not even alitle desk in some rooms.
The bathrom is dated and the shower is a trikle.
The restaurants are OK for food but verz noizy at peak time.
Elevator ride can take some time especially at peak hours. Allow a good 5min ...

title: Room not as advertised
text: The room we received was nothing like advertised on Expedia.  We stayed only one night and moved to another hotel.  Hotel management didn't refund us for the next night.  The hotel was also very noisy and our heater didn't work.  It is an old hotel in serious need of some renovation.

title: Not the old Edison
text: No more overworked, surly front desk employees. There’s even kiosks for self check in! All the staff was friendly and professional. Our fully renovated suite was 5 star quality. The location has always been top notch so the upgrades and refreshed management has really made this a great place to stay.

title: FANTASTIC HOTEL @ TIMES SQ: HOTEL EDISON
text: Amazing experience at the Hotel Edison!!  Highly recommend this hotel; have stayed here many many times over the years and always HIGH QUALITY stay, fantastic restaurants, clean environment, safe surroundings, and a staff that TRULY CARES about the guests!

title: Helpful customer service
text:
Switched rooms part way through our trip and I left my iPad in the first room. I didn’t notice until a few days later…

Danny and Shania to the rescue!  When I informed them that I left my iPad behind, they immediately were able to locate it and get it back to me! 

Thanks so much Danny and Shania for your help and hospitality!

title: Best place to be!
text: We just came back from staying at hotel Edison and we had such an incredible experience !! When we arrived, there was live music, all the staff were friendly, helpful, and welcoming! They graciously and generously changed our accommodation to fit our family and to make our stay more comfortable. Humberto helped us navigate the busy streets of NYC as we are first time visitors.   Canise was SO lovely and kind! She always had a beautiful smile on and all the guests loved her. We met her on our first night and saw her around chatting with the guests and making them truly feel at home. She gave our little one the sweetest souvenir from Hotel Edison and it’s a trip we will never forget ❤️🗽🎄

title: Not worth the price
text: For what you pay not worth the location. Location is ideal to a lot of attractions and places in walking distance, but the hotel itself other than the lobby really not the nice the rooms are old and outdated.

title: Best experience I have had in the "City".
text:
My wife and I had a great experience. If you have good feet and legs,it is a great location for exploring the Theater District,Shopping District.Price is great as well.The hotel has age ,but they have kept up with everything that I could see.The staff is the Best I have come across.The doorman Geo was very helpful when I first arrived and I had misplaced my cell phone.He called over to the valet parking and to help locate it,great job.The Bellman crew Kevin and partner were very friendly and on the ball.When we checked our bags before we left ,I did not have a bag to put my big heavy coat in,Kevin(Happy Retirement) helped with accomadating my coat.The Bellman that his name slips my mind was very informative of the area and with very good directions for getting around,he also gave me easy great diections fo me to get out to NJT without a hitch,for that I thank you.I did not get the womens names that checked us in and out ,but they did a great job.The lobby security was on the ball,no one slipped by without showing door key.The room service was quick,friendly,polite when responding
to my needs of accommadating me with additional bed linens.The room,bathroom were very clean and neat.The hallways were clean.The lobby was clean even with the massive crowds that were coming and going.The lobby restrooms were clean and fresh smelling.The only negative thing I have is to reserve a Taxi if you need one,but that is not on Hotel Edison.We did not get a chance to check out the Edison Ballroom or the Rum House,however we did have the opportunity to enjoy a quick dinner at Friedmans with the Rose group for entertainment.We also had an opportunity to get a late night bite at the Carve on the corner for a slice and a danish,good and fresh.We had breakfast at Friedmans which was spot on.Later we had lunch at the Carve,I had 2 slices which are the best I have ever had in the CITY.I hope to be able to get a chance to experience the "Rum House" and "Edison Ballroom",my next visit in the spring of 2024.Hats off to the entire STAFF at the"Hotel Edison",thanks for the great experience.

title: Great Hotel
text: Lovely clean great housekeeping and facilities although quite expensive compared to the last time I was in NY the tourist tax per room per night bit excessive if you are on a long stay,if I was to nit pick the water pressure in the shower & sink could be upgraded as it was weak & would recommend great location just off Time square

title: We Love The Hotel Edison!
text: Hotel Edison is first class all the way. The staff are amazing, the location is ideal and the hotel itself is beautiful! There is nowhere else we would stay in the Times Square area. My family and I love The Hotel Edison!

title: Great location, good service.
text: We stayed for a night. They helped to keep our baggage before and after staying for a very small price. Great location. A little more kindness from their staff it will give a good improvement to the location. Will come back if an opportunity opens.

title: Motherimothet
text: My daughter and I just returned from this beautiful hotel. Excellent location. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room we had was a bit small. Bit we used it for a base....we opted for the gab n go breakfast which we found it to be enough. I would recommend this hotel...

title: PA ladies in NYC-Hotel Edison/Fehat Begolli
text: Being new to NYC, we needed help and advice.  Fehat Begolli stepped up when asked any question.  Beyond storing our bags, when we arrived early for our room,  he advised on a local breakfast location and then every day after became our go to person for advice.  He even assisted in our last transaction of gaining a cab for the airport.  I appreciated his knowledge, kindness and helpfulness.  My girlfriends did as well.

title: This hotel is Gorgeous!
text: This Hotel is gorgeously and located in the heart of all the fun in Times Square.  We were there for a friends birthday and had a blast! Thank you for making the trip to the city special.  The room was spacious and clean and the staff were friendly and helpful.

title: Great Location, Clean, Friendly Staff
text: We took a family weekend trip, got a family suite, very clean and quiet. Housekeeping was great, but because of the busy time of year was difficult to get room service or anyone on the phone at concierge or front desk. Restaurants were excellent and the free breakfast vouchers for Bond45 were great. Everyone we interacted with were friendly and professional. Great location for all excursions.

title: Good location but dated!
text:
Hotel is in a great location but the rooms are very dated! The hotel is going through refurbishment around the lobby and outside but hopefully they’ll extend that to the bedrooms. 

There was no bin in the bathroom which was a bit of a pain for lady’s monthly! I did request but didn’t get one at all so had to use the only bin in the main living area of room. 

Staff were friendly and helpful.

title: Una estafa con el desayuno
text: El hotel está extraordinariamente bien situado. Aunque pone 4*, realmente es un 3*. Pero casi no paramos, para dormir. De sobra. Está alfo viejo, eso sí. El problema es que si reservas una habitación para tres o más personas, hay un problema y es que solo Dan desayuno para dos. Es decir, cobran por robos pero sólo dan tikets de desayuno para dos. Según me dijeron ennrecepxion: normas de la empresa. Es un desayuno para coger y llevar (está btte bien) pero si quieres tomarlo en el restaurante tienes que pagar 5 dolares más por persona

title: Great base to explore Times Square!
text: Tiny room (queen bed only), but in a great location within easy walking distance from Times Square, Broadway shows, Radio City Music Hall and even south Central Park. Our room was tucked away near the elevators but so very quiet, we slept well after very busy days exploring NYC!

title: Go to Times Square !!!
text:
Idéalement placé sur Times Square, l'hôtel est vraiment bien situé.
Les chambres sont grandes et confortables , la literie était de grande qualité.
Seul hic , la climatisation ne fonctionnait pas , il faisait vraiment très froid dans la chambre.

title: J&ST
text: Great service and location for visiting Manhatten.  Friedman's Cafe was great for breakfast.  Maid service provided daily, which I loved.  Hotel centrally located so walking was easy for sightseeing Manhatten.

title: Good location, crowded and noisy at night
text: Very good location but too much crowded and rooms very noisy during the night. Nice staff. Breakfast included is poor and big line in the different places to choose. For my opinion is too much expensive

title: Traveled with children and it was still great!
text:
Hotel Edison is a wonderful place to stay if you want easy access to Broadway and/or Times Square.  It is so close to so much.  The staff is very professional and super accommodating.  The room was large for the area as well.  It’s obviously near areas that are busy 24/7 so there’s going to be ambient noise.  If that’s going to bother you, you need to stay in a different part of the city.  We had no trouble sleeping and, in fact, woke up when we got home because the sounds were missing.  
The included breakfast is a great with plenty of options for everyone.  We will definitely stay here again.

title: Broadway Hotel.
text:
Se Paga por la ubicación. Ésta Sí es 5 Estrellas. La Habitación y el Desayuno son de una Posada de 0 Estrella, de País Subdesarrollado. Habitación donde no entran 4 maletas y Por desayuno: Un Croissant y un Yogourt griego. Para destacar: El Servicio de los Botones (Ya Mayores) Y el de Melody, Una Recepcionista que de ser Necesario, hace las veces de Secretaria Personal del Pasajero. Siempre Bién dispuesta a diferencia de los Varones Hispanoparlantes que la acompañan, que se creen los dueños del Hotel. Verdaderamente rayan con la malaeducación y la desidia laboral. 
Si buscás un lugar céntrico es tu lugar. Si buscás comodidad, mejor ir a otro.

title: A bit disappointed
text: Stayed here before and was very happy and took my family back but disappointed in the room looking into another room, gas station like bathroom and lack of mini fridge and coffee maker. Staff was wonderful though

title: Perfect location for all ages
text:
Can’t be beat. Perfect location and great value, especially with the grab & go breakfast each morning. We chose Carve down on the corner - great guys and lots of options to choose from for breakfast.

We travelled with 8 people so had 2 rooms with 4 in each. Rooms are average size for NYC and suited our needs, just would’ve liked more cupboard space or drawers given we were there for a week - but not a showstopper.

No mini fridge - you can ask for one for medication which my mum did. We just used ice bucket for drinks in our room. 

Rooms are warm, clean and well stocked and beds were comfy.

Will definitely stay again and highly recommend based on staff, location and price!

title: Good
text: Nice location next at Broadway with good personal attending. The room was good with a good shower too. The breakfast to go is enough to satisfy me. I hope come back to New York and stay at this hotel again.

title: Best value hotel in NYC -- and much better than we expected!
text: Excellent location mid-town at a great price! Stayed here in 1997 because it was a great value, and it doesn't disappoint... Added perks were free neighborhood walking tours daily (from here or from partner properties), wine hour twice a week (and other nights at partner hotels) and free grab-and-go breakfast each morning. The room was larger than expected in NYC, and the room we got (front-facing, across from elevator on the 15th floor) was very quiet (who knew...?) We also loved the live music nightly at the Rum House off the lobby. Both restaurants were very good, also.

title: The Edison is The Best
text:
This was our first time at The Edison.  My son and I have gone to NYC for 22 years, always staying at the same hotel, which was not available this year.  We were crushed.  Our tradition was broken.  But since we’d eaten at The Edison on previous trips, and were taken by the ambiance of the lobby, we thought, ‘let’s give it a try’.
Wow.  Are we glad we did.
Of course, its location was perfect as we travel to see shows.  But on top of that, the staff, our room, the restaurant (Friedmans) and The Rum House made our visit so very comfortable, fun and complete.
I think we’ve found our NYC home :). We are already planning for fall of 2024.

title: Great location, helpful staff!
text: Have stayed at Hotel Edison several times due to great location. Staff has been so helpful and responsive and everyone seemed extra friendly and welcoming on the most recent stay.  Love the Grab & Go breakfast option! Will definitely stay there again!

title: Historic property with art deco charm
text: This was our 4th stay at Edison and the second time we experienced problems with the room safe.  Don't know what that's all about but it's a nuisance.  Bathrooms are tiny but we made it work even with 3 ladies sharing.

title: Not ready
text: The check in counter does not accommodate wheelchair guests,  the ratesk charged were no the rates given at time of reservation.  Restaurant said they were not associated with hotel.  Noisy elevators which made noise all night

title: No Sleep - Obnoxious HVAC Units
text: Good luck getting sleep! The HVAC unit turns on every 15min even when it’s shut off. Metal on metal clanking every time it turns on. Location of hotel is easy access to Times Square, subway, shopping and restaurants.

title: Edison Hotel
text:
Hotel was fine, clean, central location. We were in old part of Hotel @ heating system was v noisy at night!
 Rooms are a good size but bathroom was tiny.
V comfortable beds which were a bonus after a hard day's shopping!
Shining light of our experience was Michelle who cleaned our room. A truly beautiful soul @ a huge asset to the hotel. I would return just to see her smile..

title: Péssima escolha. Caro e decepcionante.
text:
Excetuando o porteiro, que foi muito prestativo e nos orientou sobre quanto pagar do hotel ao aeroporto de táxi, e as camareiras, todas, o restante dos funcionários - recepção, concierge, seguranças e time do café da manhã - são extremamente antipáticos e impacientes (e o problema não foi a língua - minha mulher foi professora de inglês por mais de 20 anos e é fluente no inglês). 
Exemplos:
1) O valor que o concierge nos ofereceu  em um traslado de van, com mais 13 pessoas, para o aeroporto sairia mais caro (U$ 45,00 x 2) do que o valor do taxi (U$ 85,00), chamado pelo porteiro do hotel.
2) Fizeram uma caução em meu cartão de crédito daqueles valores extras que são cobrados diariamente (perto US$ 400,00), no check-out a recepcionista disse que ainda faltava pagar um valor. Minha esposa apresentou seu cartão de débito (Wise) e a recepcionista debitou todo o valor nele, informando que seria estornado o que havia sido caucionado no meu cartão. Ora, porque ela não manteve a cobrança em meu cartão de crédito?
3) Para deixarmos as malas guardadas até o horário do check-in foi cobrado US$ 1,00 por volume. Não é pelo valor, mas o hotel não é barato e achamos esta cobrança extremamente desnecessária.
NÃO VOLTAREMOS E NÃO RECOMENDAMOS.

title: Stay for a Special Birthday
text: Location and concierge services great. A special mention goes to Rolando Pagan on the concierge desk for his efforts in helping us resolve an issue. Reception staff unhelpful, room pokey and dark, Wi-fi constantly cuts out. Mentioning my wife's big birthday to the tour operator and nothing from the hotel.

title: Best Stay in NYC
text: What a value this hotel is.  The location can't be beat, and the staff was just wonderful, very friendly, gracious, and helpful.  That was the difference.  I would stay here again, and already planning on making reservations now for next year.  I felt so welcomed, and the room was clean, the bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was wonderful. I met my old college friends for a mini-re-union of 49 year.  Next year will be the big party in Florida.  Thank you again for a great experience.

title: Excellent accommodation and location
text:
Excellent accommodation and very well situated, within a very short distance to Times Square.
Staff very pleasant and helpful, from the doormen through to the maids. 
I would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Good
text: Clean comfortable beds small bathroom carve best breakfast housekeeping was great front desk not so friendly free water and breakfast made up for anything bad location was amazing would definitely go back

title: Good location; poor hospitality
text: The Bond 45 grab and go breakfast people were extremely rude. I could not believe that we are paying for our stay. We felt like squatters. Such a shame. I would advise management to train the staff and ask them to say words like "thank you" and "please" and have some patience.

title: Uncaring and Rude
text:
Immediately complained about the heat in the room. Temp was 81 although it was set for 70. Called front desk many times no answer. Finally went down to talk to clerk. When I returned after dinner the heating unit would randomly start making noise so loudly that it sounded like a wrench banging the pipes. This occurred every 30 minutes or so and would wake me up every time. It is obvious that management must be aware of this problem but doesn’t care. I’ve stayed in Triumph Hotels for years but this one had a different vibe. From the rude security guard to the 
apathetic front desk. Stay out of Room 531. Better yet find another hotel.

title: Bien situado
text:
Muy buena situación..
cama y almohadas muy buenas.
Cuarto de baño minimalista apenas cabe uno
Limpieza impecable todo.
Desayuno una pieza de fruta o un croissant y vaso grande yogur con gramola y frambuesas y miel o mini bocata caliente y vaso grande rico de café  o infusión ... en bolsa para tomar de pie o en habitación o pagar suplemento por sentarse 5-10 dólares por persona. 

Habitación 523 no recomendable da a un patio interior con ruido de motores 24 h

title: Old and dated
text: No mini fridge. I take medication that needs refrigeration. The room decor is tired, dark and dingy.  Old and dated rooms need fresh paint. Positive is comfy beds, room was cleaned and beds made daily.

title: The Best Vacations
text: Excelente localizacion! El personal muy amable. La limpieza de la habitación excelente! Lo unico a mejorar sería tener mas variedad para el desayuno. Solo eso. Muy agradecido porque pude cumplirle el sueño a mi familia de visitar NY y estar en la Parada de Macy's.

title: Do not stay here
text: The HVAC is this hotel is so broken that it is literally impossible to sleep. There is banging in the walls and ceiling day and night. There were other, less significant, issues as well - from a delayed check in to incorrect information on hotel benefits (restaurant discounts, etc.). Overall, the hotel staff seemed extremely disorganized. All would have been able to overlook had we been able to sleep through the night.

title: Good Hotel, Great Location and Staff
text:
This is my second time at the Hotel Edison.  

The Good:  the location is fantastic.  Right next to Times Square, and a plethora of great restaurants, theaters and sights. The staff is always very friendly, professional and helpful.  During this visit Hanniel stood out as someone we really appreciated (will explain below).  The doorman was very professional.  He came to us one time in the lobby to see if we needed anything, and later quickly flagged down two taxis for our group.

The Just Ok or Bad:  the hotel is a bit worn out as it is very old.  The hall carpet is really old.  The rooms have just the basics.  The bedding and beds were fine, and the TV was nice.  We went over Thanksgiving so we expected it to be expensive and it was.  When prompted I checked in via my mobile.  This is an expedited way to get your keys via a kiosk in the lobby.  When we got to the kiosk, the price was $613, vice the reservation price of $413 for one room.  So we cancelled the check-in at the kiosk and went to the front desk for help.  Hanniel was very helpful in explaining that $100 was for tax and fees, and the other $100 for a security deposit we would get back.  Again, not explained at the kiosk.  Also at first the records showed only one room and we had reserved two rooms (8 of us in our group).  Hanniel was able the find the other room with our reservation numbers, and although only one room was ready, he prepared both sets of room keys for us and instructed us to come right to him to get them once the second room was ready (therefore avoiding standing in line).  Great customer service by Hanniel.  Also terrific interpersonal skills.  Thank you.

title: Excelente ubicación!
text: Súper limpio, muy buena ubicación. El servicio de desayuno es muy rápido y la comida está bien. Lo que mas me gustó fue la ubicación del hotel, está a 1 minuto caminando de times square, súper céntrico.

title: Amazing location and great rooms..
text: Stayed here while attending a Broadway show with the kids... perfect location.. room worked really well for all of us. Good on-site restaurants.  Parking was the only confusing part but they did have it.  We all enjoyed it.

title: Disappointing -  we won’t be back
text: Staff seemed unhappy and disinterested, very very loud rooms, uncomfortable beds, basic rooms with plastic cups. 2 x kids and 2 x adults - we were very underwhelmed and tired when we left from 5 nights of terrible sleep.

title: The EDISON was our best stay in NYC to date!
text: I've been to the city dozens and dozens of times over the years. This time - however was the best. The location of the EDISON is soooo good. It's in the center of everything and thanks to the location - we were able to score last minute standing room tix to HAMILTON for $40/ea because the box office is directly across the street! We celebrated my daughters birthday dinner at BOND 45 downstairs and had some amazing authentic Italian fare. The line for FRIEDMANS for Sunday brunch was out the door so it MUST BE AMAZING (next time!) The staff went above and beyond to make sure all our needs were met. The room was clean and spacious. We had a two room suite with a terrace and an AMAZING view of the city! Even our housekeeper introduced herself by name and was with us the full 6 days calling ahead to check she could bring us anything! We felt like family! I also appreciated the level of security at the hotel - in order to access the elevators you must present a key. Kept me sleeping soundly at night with my daughter. Even the water filling stations and ice machines on each floor was a nice amenity I appreciated after trodding around the city all day. The showers had lots of water pressure and hot water and the view from our bed in the hotel provided robes and slippers each morning was the best way to enjoy my coffee! Cannot wait to return!!!

title: Family suites are great for families
text: Great location, had a lot of fun. We are a family of five. The family suite had 2 rooms 1 king in first room and 2 queens in 2nd room with microwave and small fridge that was excellent for the kids. Access to time square and other places was excellent.

title: Needs updates - overpriced
text: Hotel is in a great location, the only positive. It is old, run down.  Rooms are very small, no view.  Heater was noisy, hot water was minimal. A ton of “extra fees” on top of super high prices.  We were so disappointed- Do not recommend.

title: Disappointing!!
text:
Very unwelcoming hotel.  Had saved up for this trip for over a year and as soon as we arrived we were hit with an invoice for $321 for a six night stay.  I booked through love holidays and thought I had paid for my holiday in full but was told if I don’t pay what they called a faculty charge I would not be getting to check in.  Staff at reception were rude and did not care if I stayed or not.  The invoice was paid and  we checked in after some debate.  Room was basic but had two clean beds and clean towels.   No view at all….in-fact, we looked out onto a wooden platform above the hotel Edison sign. 

Grab and go breakfast we were told  when we arrivedwhich was very basic and if you wanted to actually sit down and have some breakfast it would cost you $5 each plus tax for a limited menu.  Was also not aware of this when I booked my stay.  Restaurant staff very pleasant and efficient.  But again I had to pay out more money. For the privilege to sit down and eat my breakfast.  They also charged  an additional £800 to have a room with two beds because I wanted a twin room not a double as I was staying with a friend.   No option for two friends to have even a single bed each.  We were expected to sleep together or basically pay for an additional bed costing me £800.  Rooms are tired and carpets old and tatty as well as bed frames and furniture.  Coffee machine in room had mould in it and took staff two days to replace this.  Very limited tea/coffee facilities, no milk and  very little tea so no room refreshments that were palatable except bottle of water each day .  

Normally I would not ask for my room to be serviced every day but purely because I was expected to pay this facility fee I did.  Found staff to be thorough, leaving selection of clean towels daily. 

Overall this is a large hotel who have a high turnover.   They will get paid no matter what cause they know once we arrive we have limited options.  Reception staff are insincere and and rude and my initial interaction ruined my stay.  A good  hotel should make every guest feel like they are welcome and that their stay and experience is important to them.  Not the case here at all.  Despite central and good location would never stay again.

title: Great Hotel...Great Staff!! Made us Canadians feel very welcome during our 5-day NYC family vacation!!
text:
We came to NYC to celebrate my husband's 67th birthday!! It was his first time in the city. What a great trip we had! 
Loved the location of Hotel Edison... Very easy to walk everywhere we needed to for all the touristy stuff and shows we saw.
We had a King suite. It was nice having the separate bedroom apart from our teenage girls. The only complaint was that we had to trip over all their stuff to get to the bathroom which was off the sofa-bed living space where they slept. 
The hotel staff were wonderful and even tried to get our room upgraded because it was Darwin's birthday. But there weren't any available.
I want to give a shout out to a couple of the bellmen who took really good care of us. Kevin and Tommy were very helpful and entertaining. Darwin really enjoyed talking with them! We'll be back!! Thanks for the memories!

title: Tiny room and rude front desk
text: We just checked in for four nights (11-24-23).  I've never seen a hotel room this small.  With a really small bed for two people.  And yes, I checked at the front about a larger room.  The lady at the desk was totally rude, actually kind of nasty, about the idea of changing our room.  The hotel location is great for theater-going.   But I'll never stay here again.

title: Location!
text: My son and I enjoyed our stay at The Edison Hotel. It was great that we could just walk 50 steps and be on the Times Square! Our room was on the third floor, facing into the yard: no lights, no noise. The room was clean. It looked as if carpet was replaced not too long ago. The bathroom was of a truly New York size - super tiny - but very tastefully remodeled. I'd consider staying again shall we repeat out mother & son short get-away.

title: Nice stay at New York
text: We appreciated the large and comfortable bed and the attention of staff. The view was very nice in the 20th floor. The room was clean, spacious and had many equipments. The Grab & Go Breakfast was pretty good and the process was practical.

title: Expensive for what you get
text: For a pretty expensive hotel, the rooms feel old (even the “signature” room we had. Front desk staff seemed bothered to have to deal with customers. Grab and go breakfast is convenient, but if you’d rather sit down, the “free” option is measly and they charge you $5 for it. Seems petty. Security is tight; there won’t be non-guests in the guest room area. Location is convenient to Times Square. Valet parking was $85 with no in and out, so plan ahead if bringing a car.

title: Excellent hotel and centrally located
text: We LOVE Hotel Edison.  We travel to NYC several times a year and always stay there.  It is conveniently located for theater, Bryant Park, Central Park, Hell's Kitchen, Times Square, and near all subways to get to other parts of the city.  The staff are all very friendly.  Rooms are spacious and recently renovated.  We stayed for 15 nights and had a small refrigerator delivered to the room. Elevators are quick, rarely having to wait longer than 1 minute.  Also Friedman's and Rum House are located there in the hotel.  The lobby has beautiful art deco murals.

title: There’s Aloha in Times Square!
text: My family and I arrived here at the Edison Hotel 2 nights before Thanksgiving. That means just before the Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade. Times Square was packed. Marcos checked us in & was a total blessing! Great value, spacious rooms, & close to everything. We’ll be back!

title: Awesome
text: The trip and rook  was very great staff awesome area wonderful I would definitely recommend family and friends here for a stay due to the price and location to be directly in the middle of times Square

title: Honeymoon Visit
text:
My wife and I stayed at this hotel during our honeymoon in New York. As we'd prioritised location over other factors this was a perfect hotel for a first visit to NYC. The hotel has Times Square on the doorstep and many major attractions are within walking distance.

I was disappointed to discover the hotel is one of the increasing number who adds a "facility fee" on arrival. We were charged around 45 dollars a night for this which listed "Wi-Fi" among the benefits. I could never give a 5 star review to any hotel who perpetuates this blatant cash-grab on top of what is already a significant cost for accommodation. The Wi-Fi in our room on the 17th floor was also so poor that I had better service from the free WiFi of a neighbouring hotel.

I was a little disappointed that there was no acknowledgement that our stay was part of our honeymoon. The hotel were aware of this beforehand. A personal touch goes a long way, even if it's just a little note left in the room. My limited interaction with hotel staff felt cold and dispassionate, which is common with hotels of this size.

That said our room was clean and comfortable and we slept as well as anyone possibly can with the incessant honking of car horns and sirens outside.

When I next visit New York I won't stay near Times Square. After you've taken a few pics you quickly realise it's not a pleasant place. But if you're visiting for the first time and your priority is seeing the major tourist attractions then this hotel is an ideal choice.

title: Thoughtful stay
text: We had a great stay at the Hotel Edison. Everyone was friendly and helpful. When we checked in the wonderful folks there recognized it was our sons' birthday and sent some treats to our room. Thoughtful!

title: Great location! Nice but expensive
text:
The location to Time Square is great but you are going to pay for it. The picture I had with my reservation was not even close to what we actually got. The rooms were clean but very small. The bathroom is tiny! For the price I expected a fridge and microwave but there wasn’t one. 
The staff is very friendly and helpful. Overall I would stay again if it was just me and my husband but not if we went back with the family. Although they did guarantee connecting rooms and we did have that.

title: Nice place to stay
text: The hotel is very convenient to Times Square and theatres, rooms were clean and comfortable.  $5 breakfast at Bond 45 was very good.  I wished the window shades were thicker as some of the Times Square lights were still visible which could be hard for those that need their rooms really dark to sleep.

title: Walkable location, good experience
text: We followed the advice of previous guests and booked renovated rooms. The rooms were small, but comfortable, beds were comfortable, overall rooms were in good shape, safes in room + bathrobes + toiletries, guest key card required to enter elevator area, sufficient elevators, and elevators are pretty fast, ice machines available, small gift shop in lobby. Friendly housekeeping staff. Location is fantastic! I have to avoid gluten for medical reasons, so really appreciated having Friedmans restaurant in the lobby of the hotel. If you book direct, ask at the front desk for breakfast vouchers (discounted price).

title: Wonderful Art Deco hotel
text: I absolutely love the Hotel Edison - it has been renovated and I just love the vibe! It is located close to Times Square, the subway, the Rockefeller center, Radio City music hall.  I can’t wait to go back!

title: Satisfied
text: Clean rooms but not so spacious . Good housekeeping staff very helpful.your hotel lobby was messyReception not helpful and not very friendly. Breakfast was not good at all as they serve the same thing every day . Should offer more breakfast items or change it daily . I had to eat the same thing for 6 days

title: Great stay!
text: Was an excellent place to stay, so close to Times Square we could walk where ever we needed to go, staff was helpful and service was great.  We had nice breakfast and was able to store our luggage when needed

title: Comfortable, convenient, wonderful experience!
text: This hotel is in a great location if you are planning to see Broadway shows or go to Rockefeller Center. It is a busy hotel, but well organized and the staff is friendly & patient. The wine hour in the lobby and the restaurants on site added to our great experience. I would definitely stay here again!

title: A Great Stay at The Edison Hotel, New York City, NY
text: I was very impressed with my stay at The Edison Hotel.  The location, in the heart of the theatre district and an easy walk to both Broadway & Times Square, is fantastic.  The room was spotlessly clean & the staff at The Edison were exceptional, friendly, efficient & helpful.  The Edison reminded us of a time when excellent service was the norm rather than the exception.  I am pleased to highly recommend The Edison Hotel.

title: Delightful
text: I love to stay at the Hotel Edison. It’s a great location if you’re visiting for Broadway shows, you can walk to almost every theater in a short walk. Their restaurants are delightful! I feel safe and comfortable there. I recommend this hotel for any guests.

title: The Edison Hotel Experience
text: The Edison Hotel far exceeded our expectations. The staff were attentive and friendly. The rooms were well maintained and amenities were fantastic. This historic building oozes charm and character and is one of the many Broadway experiences that can’t be missed.

title: Concerteza ficaria nele novamente
text:
Hotel maravilhoso
Localização perfeita.
Quarto espaçoso, limpo. Banheiro reformado, moderno, limpo
Não tinha café da manhã, mas a localização dele supre todas as necessidades.
Tem um Starbucks bem na frente, é do lado da Times Square, cheio de cafeterias e locais pra comer.

title: Moms 85th Birthday
text: Moments in Manhattan celebrating moms 85th Birthday ! Beautiful Noise Broadway SHOW  Is A MUST ‼️Also The Beds at Edison are So Relaxing ‼️ You Will Definitely Enjoy Your Stay and The location is Close To Every Thing You Will Need ‼️

title: Pretty good overall
text: Friendly staff, nice rooms, breakfast included!  Close to everything in Times Square!!!  Rum house was very quaint old New York style😊. Bathrooms small but rooms were clean.  Will charge for early check-in but that’s the area.  Very busy!

title: Nice central location for a good price
text:
We spent a week in this hotel for the second time.
The location is quiet good close to Time Square.
The price is very doable for Manhattan and the rooms are clean.
Not so big and a bit warm, but there is airconditioning.
Staff very friendly and we liked the take-away breakfast.

title: Not enjoyable
text:
Would not stay here again! Arrived at hotel very nice downstairs, staff friendly had to pay resort fees knew about that but we didnt know we had to pay a 60 dollar deposit aswell! Got to the room was not impressed! Walk in and whack the heat hits you like your walking into a suana, tried to open a window to find they were screwed shut and we only had the heat/air vent. Turned the cool air on and it was not a quiet thing. Room cooled down turned it off to find after a while it got too warm again ended up having it on all night. Couldnt sleep it was that stuffy and couldnt breathe either.  Bathroom was just as bad it was like a suana aswell and it was no bigger than a cloakroom, with the room itsself no bigger than my room at home.  The wall next to the window was roasting aswell not sure why but think that was the root of the problem. View from window was crap all we saw was other rooms and nothing else!   channel E on the tv wasnt working either it was breaking up and showing ni signal while trying to watch the hunger games i complained the next day about both the tv and the heat in the room and was told they would send someone up.  I think they did but couldnt find the fault on the tv as we had the same prob the next night aswell and the heat prob was def not looked at. Complained again and again someone was sent up but the fault was still there gave up after that ans watched friends instead. 

 We had breakfast included in our trip and got 10 vouchers for the 5 days. There were 3 places to choose from bond 45, freidmans in the hotel nd Carve deli outside on the corner of the block. The 2 inside the hotel were looking 5 dollars per person to sit in and a mandetory tip aswell we looked at the menu and wearnt impressed, went to carve and we got a choice of pancakes, waffles and french toast with strawberries and blueberries with maple syrup and was delicious and no 5 dollars to pay or mandetory tip! There pizzas etc were lovely to highly reccommend it.

title: Art Deco Hotel in busy area
text: Beautiful old building, well maintained.  But internet proved inaccessible and the noise level from outside was very high well into the night.  I’d recommend the hotel overall, but for a 1 night business trip, it wasn’t ideal.  Note also the so-called “Facilities fee” that inflates the price by $45.

title: Hotel Edison - great experience
text: Great location for walking so many places and getting to the different subway stations, great staff, rooms was fine, would stay here again but make sure to ask for a room away from the street. Especially if there is construction going on. Bathroom was a bit small for more than 2 people.

title: After many stays at the Eison, the value I find to be very good
text: In the heart of theaters, restaurants, and Times Square.  Not the cheapest and not the newest, but a very helpful staff, great on-premise food and beverage, and clean, safe, and affordable.  This trip was four nights and I met people from 5 countries, took 2 Ubers and 4 cabs, and there was no part of the trip that was made harder by where I stayed.  Consistent, good value, everything I need to do business and sleep and eat well.

title: Hotel Edison
text: Great location in the Theatre District. Hotel has been renovated in the art deco decor. Fantastic indoor dining. Hotel staff is knowledgeable and very accommodating. Good security in the building. Plenty of elevators.

title: A great value!
text: A nice hotel, in the heart of Broadway at a great price.  Can't beat that.  A short walk to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, all the Broadway shows and great restaurants.   Very nice staff, clean cozy rooms.

title: Lovely Art Deco Style Hotel
text: Overall a good experience. Beautiful Art Deco Lobby, nice room, tasty food in adjacent restaurants. Great location in Theatre District. Complimentary wine hour on Tuesday evening. Helpful doormen. Good options for breakfast.

title: Good but can improve
text: The location of the hotel is very good. I liked that it includes breakfast. The rooms are suitable for a visit where you only return to sleep. There is construction on one side, so noise at night it is unbearable. The staff is friendly.

title: Lots of history in this hotel!!
text:
Lovely hotel!  Very comfortable bed. Perfect location for visiting New York!   The hotel is an older building, built in the 1930's so the rooms are smaller than the newer hotels these days, but the character of the hotel certainly makes up for it.
Located very close to the bright lights of Time Square.  We would definitely stay there again!

title: Nice hotel, very central
text:
Best thing about this hotel is it’s location. Just off Times Square!Room was small but clean. Staff where helpful and friendly.  Noise isn’t an issue. We didn’t eat here so cannot comment on the food. I would stay here again.
The location is everything in NY

title: Family stay
text:
Overall a good stay. There was initial stress with checking in around booking numbers that was eventually cleared up by an absolutely lovely receptionist. 
Also, the price displayed in Euro was less than the price actually charged to my card, making it difficult to budget in a city and country that (like the rest of the world) is seeing high inflation. Tipping culture further adds to the issue, through no fault of the employees. Employers need to pay their staff a fair wage and not pass the responsibility to the public.

title: Average
text:
This hotel had very mixed reviews when we booked so we were unsure on what to expect. We had originally booked one room through travel company and then added a second room booked directly through the hotel itself. 

The good points 
*When checking in staff were able to give us rooms on the same floor
*Beds were very comfy and rooms were clean 
* Bottled water provided in rooms and more added each day perfect to take with you out and about 
*Carve (one of the grab and go breakfast) is the best place for breakfast so much choices compared to the other two restaurants offers. 

The cons 
* The hotel and rooms were unbelievably hot, unable to open any windows and no fresh air which often meant we woke in the night very hot 
* No kettle in room
* Rooms are in need of a freshen up 
* Very noisy at night but we had no issues sleeping due to being so tried and having brought ear plugs with us
* The baths are very slippery 

You are literally a two minute walk from time square so it is the perfect location if you want to be in and around all the action. 

I would say this hotel is simply average it's not a terrible hotel at all but it's also not a hotel I would rave about either.

title: Great location. Times Square, Theatres and subway
text: Our room was comfortable and clean.  However, the room only had see through blinds - no curtains.  The room itself was painted dark and needed more lighting.  The lights from the theatre blinked all night long into the room.  FREE breakfast was your typical fare, breakfast sandwich, yogurt, pastry, beverage.  $5 breakfast gave you a few fresh choices - from eggs, potatoes, toast to yogurt with granola.  I would stay again.  In the theatre district and time square.  Easy walk to subway.

title: Holiday
text:
Tres grand hotel avec du personnel poli mais pas de reel service
Tres honereux
Probleme de climatisation tres tres bruyante
Eau de salle de bain de couleur jaune 
Taxe de séjour ahurissante 2 personnes 7 jours 320 $

title: Outdated
text: If you want a very basic hotel this is ok. Don’t stay on the lower floors it’s noisy. Not from people, or the area, but from an extraction pipe that runs up the wall . You can’t sleep. We stayed on floor 4 and had to be moved to 11. Third room lucky which was quieter but very outdated

title: A less that acceptable experience.
text:
The lowest score available from Trip Advisor is not low enough.
