The 1930's art deco is there - and it has not been radically brought up to date.

Four Stars according to Giata is probably by self-certification. The term "misrepresentation" comes to mind. The pictures on TA show a completely different aspect to what was provided.

This must be the only 4* hotel without a consierge, bellhop, catering and room service and where they charge cash to leave luggage. 

Also, they must have experience of unwanted/registered individuals accessing the guest rooms as to access a bedroom guests must pass a security desk to check room keys and the elevators can only be enabled by use of the room pass key.

The room and common area decor provided is so tired it is almost dead, paintwork is chipped and cracked (a haven for micro organisms) and the wallpaper is peeling at the seams.

There are screws and holes in the walls where items and pictures have been removed, the carpets are not just threadbare but actually ripped causing a safety hazard and the bathroom has several rusty components along with unboxed piping which is probably lagged with blue asbestos. All in all, compliance with recommended safety and hygeine requirements is well below reasonable expectation. 

The lighting is considerably less than adequate (one ceiling light in the entry area but nothing in the main bedroom, a single bedside table with clock and light and a small light on the desk (hardly suitable to light the room with a double bed!). The windows are sealed and the air-con ineffective because the thermostat control showed the need for battery replacement.

The electric wiring is superficial and encased in bursting conduit trunking. Hardly appealing or safe!

The warm musty smell in the common areas and room suggested airing had not been done for years!

Reception. An extremely noisy disorganized area where the staff seem gagged as to what they can say - not quite aggressive, but borderline.

And the surcharge for facilities they don't even show you they offer - well!

Who would pay an extra $40 to have a meal at a reduced price, have items printed or use the wifi (which is actually free). Laundry facilities are common to most hotels and there is expectation to pay for them? Why pay in advance when you are not going to use the facility? Why pay for a "wine hour" on Tuesdays and Thursdays when your stay is on Monday or Wednesday?

Invoking a global surchage that offers a cost reduction on items that will knowingly cannot be used is .......  Saying it is available if you want it is an appalling business model! Be honest and include it within an all inclusive room rate.

Was pleased to vacate.
   
It is interesting that poor TA reviews cause Edison to respond with virtually the same text every time - they must be well prepared!

Would I go to Edison Hotel again?

Absolutely NO!

title: Safe in the City
text: I felt very secure and comfortable at the hotel. The room was very clean and the bed was a sleepers dream. The location of The Edison is steps to everything in the heart of the city. I was surprised at how quiet the room was being to close to all the action.

title: Best Hotel in New York City
text: I recently had the pleasure of staying at The Riverside Haven during my trip to the United States, and I must say it was an unforgettable experience from start to finish. Nestled along the picturesque banks of the river, this hotel exceeded my expectations in every aspect.

title: Great find in Times Square
text:
Hidden gem in the theater district . The hotel staff are all very helpful and welcoming. Two restaurants and cocktail lounge on site . Breakfast included ……..
Highly recommended by a friend and I would definitely return. On my next visit to NYC

title: Won't go back again.
text: We Went there for my wife's birthday, should've stayed somewhere else. Paid for the location, not the hotel and the service. It's overpriced, only because it's in New York and closer to times Square. That's the only justification for the price. Period.

title: Excellent location and service
text:
The hotel has an amazing location, excellent customer service and nice clean rooms.
We received an upgrade to our surprise and pleasure and it was nice to be able to step out on a balcony and take in the sights and sounds.  The grab and go breakfast was delicious, quick and easy.
I love this hotel,  I’ve stayed here several times and will continue to book here anytime I get the chance to return to the city.

title: Excellent Hotel Just Steps from Times Square
text: We love staying at Hotel Edison. It has become our go-to place when our group of friends meet-up from around the country. The location in Times Square can't be beat its literally steps away. We walked to dinner each night and then to the theater. The TKTS booth for same day half price Broadway tickets is right there. The Art Deco feel of the hotel is old New York Empire State style and the rooms are well appointed. We even stayed in a suite with a terrace. The restaurants are great too. Bond 45 for dinner, Freidman's for Breakfast and The Rum House for a nightcap. We will be back!

title: Great Hotel in a Great Location
text: We always choose the Edison when staying in NYC. We travel to the city 2-4 times a year to see a few shows and have a weekend getaway. The staff is always wonderful and rooms have always been clean and comfortable. The hotel is conveniently located to many theaters and dining options in the heart of Times Square. We look to forward to our next trip.

title: The Edison
text: You are not getting the service that you are paying for when you spend the night at this property. It's a very every-man-for-themselves mindset at this hotel. Do not expect to receive any kind of above and beyond hospitality experience.

title: A hotel with an old world charm with a great staff and comfortable rooms.
text: The Edison is at a perfect location! We walked to the theatre, walked to Time Square, walked to a deli where we had a great pastrami sandwich, and had the best breakfast at the Bond 45 Restaurant, which is in the hotel lobby. We would and probably will go back there in the future.

title: Many reasons to stay
text: Eight ladies stayed for the weekend in two rooms which were clean and comfortable.  The beds were very comfortable after long hours of walking NYC.  The staff is always friendly and helpful.  We had great interactions with the cleaning staff when requesting a few items as well as the front desk.  Both restaurants, Freidman's and Bond 45, are excellent and add both convenience and good food & drink while staying here.  The location to Broadway, Rockefeller Plaza  and many Manhattan attractions is the best.

title: Great Location, Poor Service
text: Amazing location for tourists , but the hotel rooms are old. Ours was missing a shower door which caused the bathroom to flood when used. If ordering packages, they charge per package. So for amazon type orders that come in bits, they will charge $8 per box/ item. The front desk staff are not friendly. They do give a personalised chocolate bar which is a nice welcome touch.

title: Excellent location, nice crew
text: The hotel has an excellent location, the staff and the housekeeping make you feel comfortable. The restaurant is also nice and the food a little bit pricey but good. Excellent location, near everything

title: Good
text: it was great, the only thing I would complain about is the bathtub in the bathroom (it needs a new one), the rooms were always nicely cleaned. I rate the stay very well, price/quality/location. the hotel is located right in the center of Manhattan, which is TOP☺️

title: PERFECT
text: I had not stayed at Hotel Edison in years.  Our Room, Signature Two Queen Beds, was large, bathroom a little small but durable.  The Grab & Go Breakfast & Tuesday Happy Hour was a plus.  The location was perfect.  We will definitely be returning.

title: NYC adventure
text: The hotel location was amazing. The only issue I had was with the early check in fee. This was never mentioned when requested when I called earlier in the week. Hotel is located  in the Heart of the city. The hvac unit also leaked onto the carpet.

title: Perfect for Broadway shows; clean and comfortable, helpful staff
text: Times Square location is fantastic if you want to see a lot of theatre, or take the subway virtually anywhere in the city. Our rooms were very clean and comfortable, recently renovated, larger than I would have expected in Manhattan. The car horns and beeping trucks are a bit disruptive overnight if you're not accustomed to city noise, but we heard NO other guests (hotel was full), and if noise is an issue, request an inner room over the courtyard, not on the street. Hotel and restaurant staff very welcoming, helped us with directions and also resolving a minor thing that got overlooked at check-in. Pretty good price value for all that. Will gladly return again.

title: Paper thin walls and ridiculous “complimentary breakfast”
text: Great staff, but overall marginal experience. If you’re looking for affordable and central location then that’s great. If you’re thinking about relaxing, great dining or eating experience, then avoid.

title: Great stay close to Broadway
text: Although this is an older hotel it is a great place to see Broadway plays and next to times Square. There are restaurants in the hotel. I got an upgrade which got me a refrigerator and robe. The room was small but the location you can not beat.

title: Birthday celebration
text:
Great hotel—staff are welcoming and helpful. Room was comfortable and clean. Security to access the elevators is a big plus.
Excellent location for walking to theaters, restaurants, and other touristy spots.

title: Best hotel for a theatre goer
text: My friend and I stayed in an updated ‘Signature’ room. Roomy, very clean, lovely bathroom. Walking distance to TKTS and most theatres. Excellent restaurants. Very safe. Fair price. Use 46th St exit for access to taxis.

title: Good location, weak amenities
text: This hotel needs a face lift. I came to run the New York marathon and love hanging out in hotel lobby the day before (when trying to be off feet) this lobby was old, cold and unfriendly. Wifi terrible

title: Bad experience
text: While I thought this would be a great stay; it in fact was not. There was this banging noise throughout the day and night coming from walls, there was this vibrating sound that randomly happened; seemed very sketchy. Also the room reeked of dead rat smell. Overall very bad experience.

title: Terrible
text: There was a flag by my window. Its makes too much noise all night long. I suggest to change my room but the manager did not care for my needs. The breakfast sirvice is completely nonsense, the employees give to guests one fruit and one roll as it was a favor for us, not a service that we pay for

title: Classic
text: Very clean, professional, and cool.  Just north of tacky times square, it is a go-to for me when in town.  The Ballroom is great for boxing as well (been there for Broadway Boxing).  Friedmans is great breakfast spot and the live music at rum's is awesome.

title: Dark room
text: Very very dark room without adequate lighting, uncomfortable bed, bath without window and extraction. Wi-fi instable. Paper toilet not replaced after second day. At the acceptance desk girls are very good, but the only guy was unkind

title: Good beds, bad attitude.
text: The hotel in general seems tired and uninviting. The receptionists gave no or little effort in trying to locate my reservation as I belonged to a marathon group. One of the receptionists finally, without enthusiasm, found my key card in the prepared box right behind him, were all the marathon group key cards were kept. The management shoule take a trip to Norway, check in at an average hotel and learn from their customer service, attitude, standard and atmosphere. At half the price.

title: A good place to stay
text: The location is perfect and the room was spacious and very clean.  Plenty of lifts and wide corridors.  The concierge was most helpful with booking trips and our return shuttle to JFK.  Bag storage comes in at a princely $1 a bag! The only slight drawbacks were that the lighting in the room was rather dim and there were very few drawers for clothes.  Tip - take your 'Grab and Go' voucher to Carve along the street and there is a better choice available with the option to eat it there if you wish.

title: My NYC Stay
text: The Edison Hotel is the perfect place to stay in NYC.  The rooms are clean and comfortable. The $% breakfast at Freedman's was very good, and you must go to the Rum Room and met Tyler and have him serve you a Hot Butter Rum.  Perfect cocktail after a chilly day of touring NYC.

title: Elogiar o atendimento da Jahaida e critica ao sr HANNIEL.
text: A Sra Jahaida foi muito atenciosa – diferente do Sr Haniel que se apresentou irritado em ter que repetir as informações já que eu não tinha entendido em inglês – e esclareceu as dúvidas que existiam no momento que cheguei ao hotel.

title: TRY IT YOU WILL LOVE IT!
text: Went last year and going again this year.  THEY ARE AMAZING AND ACCOMADITING...KIND..KIND..KIND..Alketa at the Transportation desk IS INDREDIBLE, KIND AND CARING AND CAN ARRAGE ANYTHING YOU WANT INCLUDING TRANSORTATION FROM THE AIRPORT.  She always has a "song  in her voice and heart"  if going to NY...this is the place to stay....restaurant..coffee across the street and walk out onto Time Square in minutes!

title: Marathon
text: Hotel has a character but is a bit tired and some rooms need a refurb. Street noise is very loud at night . Convenient to all places though. Staff in general helpful. Breakfast vouchers are not great choices!

title: Ticked all the boxes
text: Yes it's a tad expensive but you're right ON Times Square.   If u want a great location in a historic NY hotel with family rooms then this is the place.  We are family of 4 with 2 teenagers and the signature family room was perfect for us.  The breakfast was yummy however it did cost us 38 USD a day plus tip for 4 when u avail of the $5 per person sit in breakfast after u add 2 x cappuccino and tax....so keep that in mind.  Its hard to accept that extra cost when in Europe hotel's with breakfast included really means exactly that.  That being said, breakfast was fab, in Friedmans and staff were great.   Didnt deal with concierge but the guys sorting the luggage were lovely and gave us some great tips.   Housekeeping ladies were so helpful and accommodating too. We used the self serve check in which was great when the lobby was full.  Overall really happy we chose this hotel and would definitely stay here again.   Oh and the bar is fab!   Moody and cool for a couple of drinks when the kids are chilling in the room ;-)

title: Très bonne expérience
text: Séjour agréable, chambre spacieuse, propre et silencieuse. Le personnel est très poli, gentil et donne volontiers les renseignements demandés. On se sent parfaitement en sécurité. Restaurant à l’intérieur de l’hôtel appréciable pour le petit déjeuner.

title: Fabulous birthday trip!
text: The location of the hotel was perfect.  Close to theaters and all of the amazing restaurants within steps.  Hotel staff was friendly and helpful.  Rooms were very nice and comparable in size to other NYC hotel rooms.  They have 3 restaurants/bar on site and offer free grab and go or $5 breakfast.  It was my birthday and there was a bottle of wine, cookies, and chocolate along with a note in my room at check-in.  It's the extra things that make this place so great.

title: Best Location Ever
text: Last month I stayed at this hotel. Wonderful experience. Staff was always friendly & welcoming. Plenty of restaurants, bars & entertainment on the property. Even more importantly, best location. New York is expensive. More people than space. This Historic Hotel happens to be right on Times Square. Nice & secured. Over all it is worth it.

title: Hôtel Edison Times Square (bien placé)
text:
Wonderful experience with my family at the hotel. Justina take care of us and we wanted to thank her for her hospitality and help. 
The room were clean and comfortable, even if the windows were not very well isolated against the noise and the temperatures

title: Bel édifice mais le niveau des chambres et du petit déjeuner à fuir
text:
très beau bâtiment avec une belle ambiance dans les parties communes mais la chambre est d'un autre temps
Déjeuner de qualité mais sans choix
Tout est payant même pour mettre un sac à dos en consigne
Dommage car belle localisation

title: Great location. Hotel a bit tired.....
text:
Excellent location.....right off Times square. Rooms are VERY noisy though! Bring earplugs. Hotel is very tired.....could do with being refurbished but it's only a base so don't be put off. That staff are lovely and so helpful. 
Breakfast is grab and go...we brought ours back to the room as there is nowhere to eat it! 
Quite big rooms for a NY hotel.

title: top quality services
text: I have stayed at Hotel Edison several times and always return with joy to this pearl of New York art deco architecture. The rooms are pleasant, clean and comfortable, and the location is exceptional. Hotel employees are friendly and very competent. I would especially like to single out Mr. Fehat Begolli from the bell service. He is a very hard-working and capable person full of respect for hotel guests, their needs, wishes and demands. He carried out his work with great skill and understanding. Whenever I stayed at Hotel Edison, Mr. Begolli was always there for me and other guests, smiling, cordial and ready to help.

title: Comfortable and spacious interconnecting family rooms
text:
Comfortable and spacious family rooms - one king size room and connecting room with two queen size beds - each with bathroom - perfect for our family stay in New York
Beds were super comfy - big flat screen tv - and plenty of space in the rooms for all our stuff 
Staff were friendly and helpful
Grab n go breakfast works really well with simple options 
Plenty of elevators so never had to wait long
Very close to Times Square which was very cool although a bit noisy sometimes 
We enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend to others

title: Great location
text:
The room was clean with a comfortable bed. Air con available which we needed as you cannot open windows when so high up. Great location, right next to Times Square.
Very professional and friendly people. Food at breakfast was fresh and tasty.

title: Good and Bad
text: Reception rude. Booked 4 for 4 nights B&B only gave 2 breakfast with a surcharge $5 per person to eat in the hotel felt like a scam. A small breakfast menu offered food was good though. Free take away breakfast offered from around the corner. Room spotless but noisy. Security & doorman very friendly & helpful

title: Our home in New York!
text: We love the Edison. We go every year for my daughter’s birthday and the staff and accommodations are first-rate. The breakfast is amazing and the staff at Friedman’s is unmatched! Our room is always clean and comfortable.

title: First family trip to NYC
text: The hotel is perfectly located to everything, the hotel itself got cool art deco vibe all over the building. The room is perfectly sized for family of four staying in signature twin queen beds. Grab to go breakfast is very good and enough for us to set for the day venture out.

title: MUY RECOMENDABLE ESTE HOTEL
text:
Muy buen hotel, del tipo multitudinario. La habitación doble era inmensa, muy cómoda, muy amplias las camas, no así el baño que era pequeño, pero equipado completamente para las tres personas que éramos. Tienen cafeteras en el cuarto.
Si te agrada estar en Times Square, es ideal porque está en calle 47 a media cuadra de Broadway 
El desayuno incluido era básico (café o té, con dos tostadas o una croissant) con unos tickets + 5 dólares + propina
Los restaurants del hotel cerraban muy temprano. No pudimos cenar nunca 
en ellos. Pero en la cuadra encontramos un restaurant con excelente comida italiana y precios normales, por ser Manhattan, TRATTORIA TRECOLORI

title: Distinctly average
text: We stayed for one night in one of the smallest rooms I can remember. The decor is tired and dated and this hotel has certainly seen better days. No tea or coffee making facilities, and plug sockets only suitable for American tourists

title: Great weekend
text:
Great location, great hotel clean and safe. Reception staff offhand could use a visit to charm school.
Bond 45 staff all great.
2 vouchers for breakfast per day for a family of 5 ridiculous so breakfast not actually included so be aware of that when booking. Having said that I would recommend the hotel.

title: Typical NYC Experience
text: This was our third stay, I always check other hotels, but for reasonable value (mid range) and location (just off Times Square, but quiet) I always gravitate back there.  Everybody is friendly.  Breakfast is easy and good value.  Friday nights is aperitives in the lobby with live music, very civilized.  Rooms are typically rather small, but comfy.  Elevators regular, security good.  Will store luggage on last day after checkout.  Love the Art Deco decor.  What's not to love!  We'll be back again, next year.

title: Carpenter with hammer keeps whole hotel awake.
text: There are lots of great points about the Edison; location, bar, restaurant! But there's a building site across the street with a nightworks permit that means you won't get a wink of sleep. We wouldn't have stayed if we knew this. The Edison is far from soundproof and the building noise coming from across the street was of one or two workmen hammering away on shuttering. There is no way you'll sleep through it. The guy might as well be there beside you in the room.

title: Good for family of five
text: Good location just literally off  Times Square . We booked a signature suite for family of five including three teenagers and found it very comfortable. Housekeeping did a great job keeping our living space nice and clean . It can be a little noisy at night but given location that’s hardly surprising. We were so tired after a days walking that we really didn’t notice the hustle outside after a while . I would definitely recommend the hotel and would stay there again .

title: Good location, could do with upgrade
text: The location was great for travellers, but came with the noise. Even on the 22nd floor, there was no moments of quiet. Walls were very thin and could hear neighbouring rooms going about their business, heard from fellow hotel goers they could hear noise through their vents. Hate the check in/out service kiosk, reception should be welcoming with a person. Also didn't get a check in notification until 5pm, when check in is listed at 3pm. Part payment was needed up front, and further at check out. This was confusing as it becomes 2 payments rather than a single transaction from the hotel.

title: Love this hotel
text: Although initially disappointed to learn our reserved room was not available, the Hotel Edison staff, John in particular, jumped in to make things right.  We ended up with the room of our dreams, my daughter had the best 24th birthday!  This hotel was close to everything we wanted to do and we appreciated the historical aspect.  The grab and go breakfasts were great.  We ate at Bond 45 which was delicious, and Friedman's had the best matzah ball soup ever!

title: Excellent location
text: An excellent location for those who want to stay next to Times Square, Broadway and other tourist attractions in Midtown, it is a hotel with a lot of people, Grab and Go breakfast is ok, good rooms, carpet, bathtub, plastic curtains, charges a resort fee, charges a delivery fee, charges luggage deposit, for my first time in NY I found it a good place to stay

title: Old, outdated, bad customer service.
text: This hotel thinks it is ok to sell you a shoebox of a room. Literally tiny. And dank. Old carpet, leaks, not even a night stand and outlet on one side of the bed. GROSS. They did change our rooms but it was a hassle and we had to repack and check our luggage for the day.

title: Worth it
text: Great location just off Times Square . staff were friendly and helpful and the room was clean and comfortable the grab and go breakfast in the bond restaurant was a great addition .  what more could you ask for

title: Illinois ladies do NYC!
text:
The staff was very friendly, accommodating and helpful. The hotel, beautifully situated 1/2 black from Times Square, while old has been artfully modernized. My room recently renovated was spacious and modern.
The restaurant, Friedmans, with singing wait staff was delicious and very efficient.
I highly recommend this hotel!!

title: Hotel Edison - Great hotel, great staff and a great location!
text: Hotel Edison was amazing!  Rommel Gopez and the staff at Hotel Edison were super helpful and very knowledgeable of the area.  The location of the hotel is incredible and the hotel has a really NYC feel to it.   My son and I went to New York City for some business meetings and were really lucky to get in the Hotel Edison.  It is right in Times Square among the action, and really close to the 1 train (Now that I know what that is and how easy it is to use to get throughout the city).  Do yourself a favor and check out this place.  My entire family is headed up to New York next and we will definitely stay here.

title: You will definitely want the room upgrade!
text:
We've just returned from a short stay at the Edison, and it's a bit of a mixed review. We booked this hotel because online, the hotel looked very 'old school New York' - and in a lot of ways, it is. The art deco interior is attractive, and there are plenty of friendly, attentive staff around. 

Check in was smooth, though we had requested a high floor and were allocated room 451 on the 4th floor. That's where the problems started. 

Upon entering the corridor, there was a strong smell of 'funny smoke' - the corridor looked decidely beaten up and really did need some attention. It got worse and worse the further along we went - until arriving at our room, where the paint was peeling off the door and at the very end of a particularly nasty corridor. The 'Queen' room was like a prison cell, nothing at all like we'd seen online. There was no 'marble bath', the bed was tiny, only one lamp worked, the horriblr wooden furniture was properly beaten up and chipped in about a million places. I've never done this before, but I didn't even take my coat off - went straight downstairs to request a new room.

The check in assistant told me that all of the 'Queen' rooms are similar(!) but I could upgrade for $50 per night plus taxes to a 'King' room, which have been fully refurbished. This was the best decision of the trip - we were allocated room 1722 on the 17th floor and it was much nicer - though to be fair, we had expected a room of this standard in the first place and to have to pay to upgrade was a real kick in the teeth.

The major gripe about this room was the air con unit, which seemingly has no way of being switched off at all - even when showing as 'off' on the wall - and was VERY loud. It blared all day and all night, every minute we were in the room. But, it's the price you pay I guess. 

We only had the grab and go breakfast once from Bond 45 but were impressed with the selection and service, perfect if you just need a bite to eat before heading out to explore. 

Location wise, well if you want to be close to Times Square, you really can't be much closer. It's about 20 seconds walk from the red TKTS booth on W47th St, you are very much in the heart of the action! 

Overall, would stay again but won't be in a rush to rebook - and if we do, we will be sure to upgrade to the King room.

title: Best Hotel !!!
text:
Myself and my family have stayed here 3 times in the past few years and absolutely love it!!!! 
We were met by the Amazing Bobby at the door who looked after us over the next few days re questions, information, recommendations etc. 
we needed to change room to accommodate our needs and We experienced first class treatment from Jean Calvin ( front desk/ Accommodation Manager ) He went above and beyond to facilitate us in every way!! The Edison are lucky  to have such Amazing , Professional people on their Team!! 
And by the way……you will have the Best Sleep ever!!!! Beds are so comfortable. 
We can’t wait for our next trip to New York  and have already made our next booking at The Edison! 
Thankyou for a Great stay 
Jean,( Fitzsimons)  Se , Thomas and Ava ( from Ireland

title: Okay place, constant noise
text: We were here for a quick getaway trip to see a Broadway show.  The location was excellent but the rooms were very noisy and we had construction literally right outside our window staring every morning at 6 am.

title: A hotel with a touch of kindness.
text:
If you are looking for exceptional service with warmth and professionalism then you need to stay at Hotel Edison located right next to Times Square. This is my second visit and the experience was so great that I can’t think of a better place to stay when next I visit New York City.
We had a challenge with the first room that we were allocated and Conise, the Hotel manager, personally addressed the challenge and got our room changed. Conise was warm and very attentive to our needs. We want to say a big thank you for her leadership.
The trip was to celebrate my son’s 14th birthday and both Marisela and Christina at the reception desk, checked us in and made sure that there were birthday treats waiting in the room. My son was touched by this kindness. Every staff member that we encountered made us feel special and welcomed.

The room was airy with great lighting. The beds were comfortable too with ample amount of pillows. Daily, the housekeeping team left our room impeccable and provided fresh supplies of toiletries, bottled water and coffee. 

There is a complimentary walking tour on Tuesday and Friday at the hotel with a wine hour on Tuesday and Friday. The room came with a “grab and go” breakfast which was handy for setting out for the day’s activities.

We enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The location being right next to Times Square makes staying here a big bonus. 

Thank you to the hotel Edison management and team for making our experience unforgettable.

title: Bad Hotel
text:
The receptionist when I made the check in was VERY rude. 
The breakfast are no good in downstairs, and you have to take to go, bad idea. 
The rooms and bathroom are old.
The wifi doesn’t works.
The location is really good. 

La recepcionista cuando realicé el check in fue muy grosera y mal educada.
Los desayunos no son buenos, son para llevar para no pagar extra y hay que bajar unas escaleras al subterranero.
Las piezas y los baños son muy antiguos.
El wifi no funciona. 
La ubicación es muy buena.

title: October 23
text:
Stayed with my Family for 3 nights, travled from Dublin and had pleasant check in experience, room was lovely and spotless, wifi very good, grab and go breakfast a great bonus and very tasty. 

The location of this hotel is secound to none if you are first timers or with family, it is practically on time square.

Would definitely book agin.

title: Nice and close to the mayhem
text: Nice location for discovering New York. Staff made us feel welcome. Our room was made up each day with fresh towels etc. both restaurants are very nice with a varied selection of food. Cam get noisy of a night but that’s the location nothing to do with the hotel.

title: Best 4 night stay!
text:
Just back from a 4 night stay at Hotel Edison for my husband’s 40th birthday. It was perfect from start to finish. Hotel staff were so friendly and welcoming. Rooms were clean and bed very comfy. I emailed in advance to let them know the reason for our stay and asked if they could offer something for the room on arrival. I expected to be sent a list of items I could purchase but they took care of it. That was such a lovely touch and I was so grateful.  Even when checking in they wished my husband a happy birthday :) 
Absolutely loved our stay and will most definitely be recommending to friends for visits to New York. Hopefully we will return soon too!

title: The hotel is clean but loud.
text:
The hotel is ideally situated to Times Square making it accessible to both up and downtown Manhattan.

The room we stayed in had signs of wear and tear and needed some maintenance. The a/c unit was very loud and the toilet in our room leaked slowly. The room was otherwise clean and served it’s purpose.

The lobby area is chaotic and loud so be prepared. Also note if using self check in make sure to get your breakfast vouchers as this contributes towards a significant saving.

Also note the additional nightly charge that covers for ancillary services. Make sure to get use of these as we only learnt about the charge at check out. Again one to note if you use self check in

title: 10/10 location but rude staff and disappointing breakfast
text:
Fanatic location, right next to Times Square so easy access to everything including subway stations. Not too noisy though! 
Rooms were small, especially the bathrooms, but it didn’t matter as we didn’t spend much time in them anyway. 
Air conditioning unit was powerful but too noisy to use overnight.

Some lovely staff and super helpful, however quite a few others were rude and standoffish. If you don’t like dealing with customers perhaps a hotel reception job isn’t for you! We found this a lot in NY, perhaps being rude is a New Yorker thing?

Breakfast included was rather shoddy, the free breakfast was takeaway in a brown paper bag that you couldn’t eat anywhere. Alternatively you could pay $5 ($6.40 with tax) for a very small preselected menu in the restaurant connected.

We booked through Loveholidays who didn’t mention that we had to pay extra fees on arrival. $300 was demanded when checking in, although $165 was the total amount taken due to some being a refundable deposit. Would’ve been nice to have a heads up! (No fault of the hotel)

Overall a good hotel, if you don’t take people being rude personally!

title: Two days in NY
text:
You can’t beat the location! Walking distance to our theatre show and close to wonderful bars, shops and restaurants. The restaurant/bar in the hotel “Bond45” was terrific. Great vibe, great drinks and wonderful staff.
Breakfast was fantastic even the grab and go breakfast sandwich. 
We will definitely stay here again when we return to NY

title: Great location
text: Hotel Edison is in a fantastic location, we could even see Time Square from our balcony! However it is remarkably quiet and we all slept very well . Be warned though that breakfast is only offered to 2 people per room. We had no idea of this and were a little disappointed as we had a family room for 4 . Very strange indeed…

title: Our New York home excels again!
text: We have been coming to the Edison Hotel for over twenty years, and we love the place!  Unsurpassed location, great rooms, and staff who have been there since we started and who consistently deliver.  We will be back at least three times next year, and as long as we are visiting New York.

title: The best staff
text: When I arrived to the hotel I realized I had left my phone and my coat in the taxi. I was probably 8 minutes later after arriving. Immediately, when telling the hotel staff, specifically Juan C and Victor C., they took matters into their own hands, they located the taxi, convinced the taxi driver to come back and return my valuable items. They were so kind to me as I was clearly overwhelmed. They helped me check in while we waited and called me when the taxi was downstairs. I can't thank them enough for their generosity and professionalism. Honestly I have never seen such quick service and if you are staying here please make sure to talk to them if you need anything. They are absolutely the best, seriously. Thank you Juan C. and Victor C.!

title: deluso
text: peggiorato rispetto all'ultima volta. Camera pessima e doppio addebito sulla carta...assurdo...se non avessi avuto un'altra carta sarei stato in difficoltà. lo sblocco dell'importo in più sarebbe avvenuto 8 giorni dopo.

title: Location is the best.
text:
Location: 
The location of Hotel Edison is very central and very close to Times Square.
Room:
Our room was very small, as was the bathroom. There was no room on both sides of the bed, because of the AC on the wall. 
For us, this was not a real problem, because we didn't spend much time in the room. 
Sleeping comfort:
The airco unit inside was very loud, you can't sleep with it turned on. But even the noise coming from the AC units outside was very loudly inside! That was a bit disappointing.
Impression:
At the reception, it can be very busy and the waiting area is not very convenient. 
It is on old building, which has it's charme, but also has it's "problems".
There is a securtiy check before you can use the elevators, very good. 
Breakfast:
The hotel provides breakfast vouchers, to be used at three locations. That is a huge pro! We had breakfast at Carve, just at the corner from the hotel. There was lots of things to choice from and gave us good energy to explore the city. 

Overall:
we have had a good time here. Will we be back? Maybe we will choose another hotel next time.

title: Great experience and great price for a 1 bedroom suite .
text: Great location ,and  friendly staff especially on the 22nd floor . Street noise was pretty good considering we were in Times Square . I bedroom suite was a great size and the bathroom was up to date .

title: Give the Edison Hotel a go!
text:
Latoya, the front desk person was as intuitive as she was this beautiful. She saw that we were doing terribly. We came in around 12;30am in the morning because we had problems with our apartment in New York City and we needed to stay overnight, so that we can get our bearing straight Latoya could see we were tired and deflated. First she gave us a room,  it turned out may be a little noisy because it is New York City and we went back to her and with a smile she said let me see if I can do something even better, so instead of giving us one bed, she gave us two beds, she upgraded us, so we could just relax and a nice big suite. she was so nice she turn to her boss who is the big boss unfortunately, I did not get his name. But he okayed it and said sure, and we were able to put our things down and get some rest through our trials and tribulations. 

I also have to say the security is fabulous.

We went first into a one bedroom and by mistake I left one of my bags there and I realize later on and went to ask for them to help me go there to get it and there was  amazingly wonderful woman, part of security and she was a doll. She said whatever you need I’m here for you and she meant it. I found my bag  and gave her a hug.

All I can say is if you want to stay someplace we are gonna be treated beautifully just go to the Edison hotel, they will do you right I would say I would give them who work at night into the morning a 10 out of a 10 for Layota and the staff

Here is more information. If you’re looking for a nice clean room with a nice well made bed/ beds, this is the hotel for you. If you want people who are going to be nice and kind this is also the place for you.  In the closet there is an iron/ ironing board and umbrella In the closet In the room you get a table to work with your computer you get a safe you also get a closet you have a mirror where you can see yourself before you leave. There is really good hot water enough space to put your stuff down on the sink, they give you a nice blow dryer and the shades keep all the light out so if you want to sleep late, it’s not so annoying getting the sun in your eyes. Check out the Edison in New York  Latoya, just want to say you’re the best and thank you!

title: Great location
text: The location is the best, there are plenty of dining options, the bed is super comfortable and the hotel is very clean and safe. The bellstaff, the first people you see are very helpful and check in goes fast. I would stay here again.

title: Birthday trip for my wife.
text: We went for my wife’s birthday. We chose Hotel Edison because my wife stayed there as a kid and it was across the street from Hamilton. The staff took care of every need we had and more. They were all very friendly and made sure our trip was special.

title: A good choice all round
text: Great security. Very clean and a great location. Rooms are dated but are continually being renovated we understand. Our bathroom was renovated. Restaurant in the hotel and breakfast program were a welcome plus. Economical choice for NYC.

title: We always come back to the Edison
text: The Edison is our go-to for convenience and room size. The staff is very friendly at the Edison. Our room was showing some wear, and our bathroom sink would not drain. Beds are very comfortable. We have been staying at the Edison for the past 12 years.

title: Basic
text: Didn’t even stay one night as rooms appalling and noisy . Over priced . Manager unhelpful and rude .Was told we could move to another room the next day but would be the same and would have to pay for an upgrade . Decided to stay somewhere else , so could get some sleep after a long day travelling . Manager  wouldn’t refund nights money and said he had no obligation for the other four nights . We would have to take it up with Expedia . Would have refunded it , with good customer service unlike him !

title: Highly recommended for a comfortable family stay in the heart of the theatre district.
text: We recently stayed at the Hotel Edison for a family vacation in NYC. We found the hotel perfectly met our needs, our family room was spacious enough for all 5 of us to stay comfortably for four nights. The decor suits the era of the hotel (it’s not shiny and new but we enjoyed the vibe). Best feature was the location, perfect for walking to Broadway shows each night, and considering how close it is to Times Square it was pretty quiet. The complimentary happy hour with excellent live entertainment was also a highlight. Special mention to Hanniel for welcoming us so warmly on arrival and making our stay extra enjoyable.

title: Stop on New England fall trip
text: Perfect location for our stay as walking great distances not doable. Easy walk to multiple choices for food, shows, rental cars, and the Today show. Great staff from doorman to waiters. Great food at the restaurants and a very roomy king suite.

title: So Glad We Chose Hotel Edison
text: Loved our stay at Hotel Edison. The room was surprisingly quiet given it's proximity to Times Square. The grab n' go breakfast was super convenient for getting an early start on the day. Online check-in and check-out was quick. And it was so pleasant to still have a hotel that offers daily housekeeping!

title: Great location
text: I selected Hotel Edison because it was the closest to Broadway and our main reason for going to New York was to see Josh Groban in Sweeney Todd. Great location, great service, and within walking distance from a lot of things to do.

title: Great stay
text: Great place for to stay for the theater. Everything. is within walking distance. Would stay again. Great to valet the car. Not have to drive in New York. Great food and plenty. Went shopping Over all my trip was fun.

title: Great location!
text: In the heart of Manhatten. Great location and nice room and great breakfast 45 café/restaurant. Nice hotel and facilities. Good service all around and very clean. Will come again even that I Think the overall Price is to High. Even with the prime time location.

title: Ask for Fehat Begolli!
text: First visit to NYC and we were so lucky to met Fehat Begolli!  We had an early flight and arrived before check-in; the hotel will hold your bags for a small $ so you can go explore. Fehat provided amazing service, great recommendations and tips for our first visit.  It was great seeing a friendly face in the hotel every morning.  The hotel location was great, super close to Times Square and a few theaters.  Will definitely back again to see Fehat at The Edison.

title: Nice hotel
text: Nice hotel, location is excellent, friendly staff, quick service in restaurants. Rooms need updating, beds were comfortable and good to sleep. We had nice holiday in New York. It was easy to walk everywhere from the Hotel.

title: PRIMEIRA IMPRESSÃO
text:
Durante minha estadia em Nova York, escolhi o Hotel Edson como meu lar temporário e fiquei impressionado com a experiência encantadora que tive. Desde o momento em que entrei, fui recebido calorosamente por uma equipe excepcionalmente cordial e atenciosa. Os funcionários do hotel Edson não apenas demonstraram profissionalismo, mas também uma genuína hospitalidade que tornou minha estadia verdadeiramente memorável.

Os quartos eram impecáveis e confortáveis, proporcionando-me o descanso tão necessário após explorar a vibrante cidade. Além disso, as instalações do hotel eram modernas e bem cuidadas, refletindo o compromisso da equipe com o conforto dos hóspedes.

Cada interação com a equipe foi marcada por sorrisos calorosos e prontidão para ajudar, criando uma atmosfera acolhedora que me fez sentir em casa longe de casa. A localização central do hotel facilitou minha exploração dos pontos turísticos icônicos de Nova York.

Em resumo, minha estadia no Hotel Edson foi uma experiência excepcional, graças à equipe notável que se esforçou para tornar minha visita inesquecível. Recomendo este hotel a qualquer viajante que valorize não apenas o luxo, mas também o toque humano que faz toda a diferença em uma estadia memorável.

.
Gostaria de expressar minha profunda gratidão e reconhecimento ao funcionário Marcos do Hotel Edson em Nova York. Sua dedicação e profissionalismo excepcionais tornaram minha estadia verdadeiramente especial. FEHAT Begolli não apenas demonstrou um conhecimento profundo do hotel e de seus arredores, mas também exibiu uma atitude acolhedora e prestativa que me fez sentir incrivelmente bem-vindo.

title: Girls getaway
text: My sisters and I spent 3 days at the hotel and had a wonderful time. We would definitely come back.  Everyone was very helpful, professional and friendly.  The location was wonderful for seeing shows and site seeing.

title: So expensive for nothing
text:
First of all I had a reservation I could cancel for free and because of a departure problem went 1 night instead of 2. Had to insist through Booking.com to pay only one night as they refused to change.
Then line 1hour to get a 900€ room like animals after a 10 hours trip. 
Then the window on blacony was sealed waited 30mn to have it open. Then breakfast suppléments cosy me 80 dollars. Then in the morning loud cleaning women kept me from sleeping. Never again, bad hotel.

title: Very comfortable, well located, and easy.
text: This is a very nice hotel with a very great location.  Our travel was with 3 adults and 2 young teenagers. My priority was proximity to plays and Times Square, a good breakfast location, safety of course, and not too overwhelming. We really enjoyed breakfast using our vouchers each morning. We also spent a little time in the Rum Bar and liked the speakeasy type of environment. But let me tell you something amazing. I left a ring and diamond earrings in our room on check out. I did not realize this until after we were home about 10 hours. That night I sent an email to Hotel Edison telling them of my left jewelry. Within about 24 hours I received confirmation they had my jewelry. I worked with Jonathan Bracero in Security, providing him with a copy of my ID and emailed him a shipping label. A couple days later, I received my jewelry in the mail. I was so thankful and impressed that my jewelry was recovered and that it came back to me. I would highly recommend Hotel Edison to anyone and will definitely stay again in the future.

title: Wonderful stay at Hotel Edison in the heart of NYC!
text:
This was a great place to stay. I found it hugely expensive (especially with Canadian dollar being low) but apparently fairly reasonable for NYC and the location. Hotels are up in price everywhere.

Location was fantastic. Literally steps from Times Square (over time it became annoying navigating the crowds to get anywhere) and only steps to many theatres and restaurants. Close to subway station. 

Staff were friendly and helpful. 

Room was small (to be expected in NYC) but comfortable and in great shape. Most importantly, the bed was very comfortable and the shower was strong. We had requested a mini-fridge (only $30 for the week) and found out when we arrived that because it was for medication, there was no charge at all (had to request the charge be reimbursed after check out but no problem whatsoever). 

Lots of elevators so no long waits. Security seemed really strong but not intrusive. Lobby was nice.

The included breakfast was fabulous. I'd read negative reviews and thought it was going to be a problem. Not at all! We only used the coupon for grab and go once, but it was terrific. Ate out once (Bryant Park). The rest of the time we did the  $5 menu in Friedman's. Remarkably fast service. Simple menu - I think I had the two eggs, hash browns, and toast every day. My friend tried most of the options and they all seemed good. 

We tried to go to the Rum House for a drink one night but there were no tables at the time. Looked quaint, comfortable, and "jazzy". Didn't try the restaurants other than Friedman's breakfast. 

There was scaffold on the front of it (as there was so many place in NYC) so that was a little annoying at times when walking through crowds and you couldn't get a good look at/photo of the hotel. 

Would definitely stay there again.

title: October 2023
text: It was a very nice stay. Stay is great. Restaurants are good with good service. There was a lot of noise from the hallways (teenage girls running up and down) they did stop after I spoke to them. The location is great and we loved the wine hour!

title: Disappointed
text:
New York stay. The room was average size, bedding had torn sheets with holes in them but were clean. However our room on the 4th floor was very tired & worn out & the bathroom was very small.  We paid for a standard double but didn't expect it to be so unwelcoming.  Our window view was the window cleaners their equipment, and an outside lift with plastic bags & very loud in the mornings.  We didn't make a complaint as we were out most of the time. 
On arrival we were told we'd have to pay a $120 facility fee this was for vouchers for breakfast (please note, you also pay $5 per breakfast too) or a grab & go breakfast which was up the street.  Free wine on Tuesdays & Fridays between 5 & 6pm in the lobby.  If your not there on those days then it's tough I guess. A % off laundry plus other offers too. This $120 fee includes a small hotel tax.  It's compulsory and hotel policy.  We were not told about it prior to arrival.  We accept there's often a city or hotel tax in various countries but this was differently worded "A facility fee" We didn't incur this whilst in Boston.  The staff are extremely busy and very nice and helpful. We wouldn't stay there again.

title: Hotel Edison
text: Our family came for a quick 4 days vacation. We booked this hotel because it had queen size beds and it’s location. The room itself felt small and no extra chair in the room. Bathroom is very small but it was clean and the beds were very comfortable which out weighs  the smallness

title: Survived the stay , will certainly not come back
text: Very old hotel in a very loud enviromment, impossible to sleep without ear plugs, additional charge breakfast that you alraedy paid for, totally overpriced, only upside is the jazz bar with life music

title: 四つ星ホテルですが…
text: 場所はタイムズスクエアから徒歩1分ほどなので、最高です。ただ、古いんですよね、ホテル自体が。壁が薄いので、隣の部屋のビデオ通話の声が余裕で聞こえてました。部屋は広いもののシャワーカーテンもなかったし…まぁ、アメリカの物価が上がってるのでしょうがないとはいえ、この値段でこの程度のホテルかぁ…これが今のニューヨークかぁ、とガッカリしました

title: Excellent hotel, perfect location
text: Excellent hotel!!  The location was perfect, right in Times Square, the room spacious and clean, and the staff was friendly.  I'd recommend this hotel and will definitely stay here again if I'm in New York.

title: Historic
text: It’s a wonderful historical hotel located right near Time Square.  There are excellent restaurants nearby and many theaters are within walking distance.  The staff was very helpful and we felt very safe.

title: AVOID THIS HOTEL AT ALL COST
text:
I truly would not recommend this hotel to anyone. 

When we first arrived the person at the front desk was absolutely rude to me from the get go (before i even spoke). That aside when we went to our room we were absolutely shocked by how dirty it was. There was blood stains on our sheets, and sink was clogged. The bathtub wasnt even cleaned. That aside, our room was absolutely freezing and when we told reception they told us that the heaters werent working, and that they would send us blankets. When they did send us blankets, the employee just walked into our room without knocking or anything while my family and i were in bed. She proceeded to say “oh I thought the room was empty”. Adding on to that, the electricity in our room went out multiple times, and safe wasnt even working.

Honestly other than the location, nothing else was good about this hotel. I truly have been to 1-star hotels that were a million times better, cleaner, and alot nicer than this so called “4-star” hotel. Truly the streets of New York was alot cleaner, and wouldve been much more comfortable than this sorry excuse of a hotel.

title: Old and dusty not classic
text: Poor quality room for a outrageous price. Small bathroom, dirty, dusty, holes in bedding and carpet. Heard everything that was going outside. Extreme cold air through the window, so you have to keeping the heating to the maximum so you are not cold.

title: Stay at the Edison!
text: This is a wonderful place to stay, right in the theater district. The staff (housekeeping, front desk, bell people, etc.) is friendly and professional. Three of us shared a two-room suite, which was perfect (and also rare in NYC). Prior to our trip, Jenny Levina helped me with reservations and planning, and her assistance was greatly appreciated. The grab and go breakfast each day was a plus. This was our third (and not last) time staying at the Edison.

title: Great place to stay in the heart of Times Square!
text: Fantastic hotel experience! Professional and friendly service from start to finish, awesome breakfast perks, easy access to all of Manhattan, clean rooms, fun aesthetic, and easy check-in and check-out. Highly recommended for both business and pleasure travelers!

title: Good value for Times Square area
text:
If you're looking to stay near times square, this location is 10/10.
It's an older hotel and it shows in some areas, but it is also charming because of that.  The rooms are satisfactory but won't blow you away.  It is Times Square, so if you need absolute peace and quiet to sleep, do not stay here.
A lot of great food options within 1 block.  Hamilton theater is literally out the back door.  Many other theaters within 5 minute walk.
If I had a reason to be in the area again, I would be a repeat guest, certainly.

title: My Experience at Hotel Edison
text: Very nice hotel. Loved the fact you had to show your key to get onto the elevator. Plus whenever you used the elevator you also needed your key. It really made me feel safe. Staff was really nice, especially the doormen out front.

title: We will not select Edison again
text: Reception staff partially very unpolite (one lady was wearing a mask and we could hardly hear her but she did not bother speaking up a bit), room on the 4th floor really loud, not enough space for clothes for 2 people

title: Very good Location
text: We were very satisfied, very good Location, Sufficient breakfast, good restaurants, very good service and friendly staff. The hotel manager solved our booking problem quickly and easily!  A good hotel, we are happy to recommend it

title: One night
text: Expensive but adequate. Valet parking was great .  Didn't go to any of the connected restaurants, but they looked ok. Karioki looked like fun. Lobby a little crowded. Bathroom slightly tight, had to close door to lift toilet lid

title: Settimana a Times square
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato per una settimana, hotel  di stile vecchio ma pulito, personale gentile pozione super strategica girate L angolo e siete a Times Square.
Colazione da asporto o a pagamento nei vari bar. Le tasse vanno pagate in hotel al check in.

title: Great first time NewYork Visit
text:
First time in NewYork . I met  Fehat the Valet at the Hotel Edison who was amazing. He helped me with my bags told me where to go and how to get there. I hope anyone visiting NY have someone as wonderful as him to help them
I asked so many questions, but he answered all of them with patience and grace.

title: The Edison is in a great location for theaters.
text: The Edison is within walking distance of several NYC theaters and restaurants. We stayed for 3 days and were surprised that our standard king room didn't have a coffee maker, refrigerator or microwave and there was a daily surcharge for an exercise room that we didn't use and a wine event that was not available during our stay.

title: A great stay at the Edison
text: Just spent 4 nights at the Edison. It's a great location for everything so central Times Square on the door step. We had a twin room with 2 queen beds it was ample, cleaned every day fresh towels and great staff. We told the hotel before we went it was a special occasion and we received wine and cookies on arrival, a lovely touch. It is busy so be patient. The staff were great and helpful never any hassle. You also get breakfast for 5 dollars per head which was unexpected. We honestly couldn't fault it, clean rooms, fast lifts, great staff, ice machines on each floor and fresh bottles of water each day, I honestly don't know how you couldn't give it 5 out of 5....we will back.

title: Thieves, don't stay here
text: I left a pair of beats in my room. I called the same day as check out to let them know. I described everything, down to the location on them in the room. On the phone they told me they found them where I said, and they will put them in the office with a sticky note. I was instructed to email the security manager for procedure purposes, which I did the same day. After DAYS of nothing, I got a response that said they couldn't find my headphones. I've been trying to reach out and noone has responded.

title: Family Trip
text: I had stayed here in 2005 on a girls trip. That was my first time in NYC. I’ve stayed at other hotels in NYC & this one is by far my favorite. This time was my family’s first trip to NYC and the location was perfect!!

title: Great choice for theater-goers, very clean, good security.
text: Very clean, very comfortable bed, perfect location for theater-goers, the $5 breakfast right in the hotel is a great feature.  Good security--need to show room key before entering elevator lobby and must also use key to select floor.  Yes, it's right at the top of Times Square so busy area, but that also means it's easy to get to midtown, MoMA, pretty much anywhere. Several subway lines within just a few blocks.  Great choice.

title: Lovely, comfortable stay in a prime location
text:
It was my first trip and my parent's first trip to New York. Hotel Edison was in an ideal location. Right off Time's Square, short walk to Port Authority Bus station and close to Subway stations so it was a very accessible spot. The hotel has a lovely grand lobby, and there are plenty of staff to greet you on arrival. Everyone was welcoming and friendly and service came with a smile. You couldn't go up in the lobby lift without presenting your key card to the staff, which made me feel secure and that the staff took safety/security seriously. Our room was a good size and clean. The cleaner came daily and kept us topped up with towels and water and our beds were made immaculately daily. The luggage hold service is $1 a bag which means on the last day after check out they can hold your luggage a little longer (no holds overnight). This gave us more time to explore the city luggage free on our last day. 

The $100 refundable deposit was returned to me super fast - the day after I checked out it was back in my Monzo account although they do say it can take 15 + business days.
We ate in the Friedmans restaurant in the hotel which was nice, good food and service- they charge you $5 per person to sit in (this is what I was told on check in) so breakfast for 3 people would come to $90, before we added gratuity which meant it cost us about $110 just for breakfast. We ate here twice but for the rest of the trip had to eat at other diners (about $48-$56 for breakfast in diners) in order to maintain our budget. The bar had live music on and there was good ambience there and a good crowd during the night. We missed the singing service in the restaurant so that would have been fun to see. I think it's on every dinner service wed - sat.

The only two faults with the room was that the windows outside were quite dirty which meant we couldn't see much of the view. There was building works going on near the hotel outside which probably contributed to it. It also meant there was extra noise at night which made our weekday nights more noisy. The beds were very comfy so to be honest despite the noise we weren't long falling asleep as we were exhausted from exploring the city every day!
The second thing was the room felt quite dark. There was 1 bedside lamp in between the queen sized beds and a small desk lamp but neither helped bring much light to the window side of the room. An extra standing lamp would help give better lighting. Overall we did enjoy our stay and would return.

title: Tout est absolument parfait!
text: Chambres très confortables,  personnel très accueillant et agréable,  grab and go parfait,  emplacement idéal. Les lits sont réservés grands et très confortables.  Nous recommandons vivement cet hôtel !!!

title: Eddison NYC
text:
Great staff and service, clean and comfortable rooms.  Helpful staff with recommendations and directions.  Ease with check in and check out.  Communication was great--text messages when room is ready, held our bags so we could explore the city until the room was ready as we arrived early
Highly recommend

title: Hotel edison points to look at
text:
Hotel is perfectly placed for a new york trip,right on Broadway close to everything.
Credit to staff,shower wasn't working and was fixed immediately,staff were mainly very friendly particularly Sebastian and Jay in friedmans bar,couple of points that could be looked at,skirting board behind headboard needed cleaning,middle sign facing onto 47th Street was absolutely filthy,for a 4 star hotel you expect much better,also our room 438 had zero views apart from fans and vents and the noise at night was horrific.

title: Price has gone up while the quality has gone down
text: I have stayed at Hotel Edison in the past, and I have been disappointed in what was once a great hotel for the money has gone down in quality and comfort.  The staff was nice and the room was very clean, but the mattress was very worn and sunk in the middle so either my husband and I would fall into a hole in the middle.  It reminded me of an old "I Love Lucy" episode!  The heating and cooling unit would make a very loud squealing sound every time it would come on and would be very loud while running.  We could hear conversations from the rooms around us and could hear every time some one got up to go to the bathroom or take a shower.  All this made it difficult to sleep.  However, the location is perfect if you are doing a lot of activities in Time Square and the $5 breakfast at Bistro 45 was a deal!

title: Great Location but needs Updating and TLC
text:
Great location but hotel is looking old. Our room had a comfortable bed but the air con didn't work, once fixed it was deafening!  The bathroom was a cupboard - no room to move at all plus the flush dripped on to the floor in the corner,  The safe is located in a cupboard half way down a very dark hallway and there is no light in the cupboard so we couldn't see how to use if - very easy to leave stuff behind too!
It took a while to get signed on to the hotel WiFi but once in it worked well.  However be warned - there was only ONE USB port in the base of the desk lamp.  All other sockets were very old and only accepted an adaptor.  
The maid service was very good - she cleaned the room every day and in that regard it was spotless.

title: Great location!! Dated rooms
text:
The location of hotel is great! The staff is friendly and inviting.  
There is no place to warm up leftovers or store leftovers. So any food from restaurants had to be trashed. Overall a decent hotel just worth the cost!

title: Was clean but not comfortable
text: Rooms were kept clean but the bathrooms are very small and the beds have very hard mattresses. Lots of building work in the area so very little sleep throughout our stay due to windows being single glazed. Hotel is in desperate need of updating

title: Dépaysement total
text:
7 nuits dans cet hotel, Merci à Hanniel pour son accueil chaleureux.
Cet hotel est très bien placé, on entend en effet les bruits de la rue (New york est la ville qui ne dort jamas), après un bonne journée de visite, on dort très bien
5 dollars + taxes +pourboires pour un petit dej assis alors qu'ils sont compris dans la reservation, c'est un peu curieux. Sinon, c'est à emporter et à prendre dans la chambre
Le jour du départ, ils vous gardent les valises en attendant l'heure du départ et c'est 1 $ la valise, mais c'est bien pratique
Prévoir également 300 $ à l'arrivée pour les taxes de sejour, je viens de rentrer en France et ce n'est toujours pas prélevé. il doivent normalement me rembourser 12 $, On verra
En conclusion, hotel très bien placé et chambres faites tous les jours, eau et glaçons à volonté à l'étage et la femme de chambre vous laisse 2 petites bouteilles d'eau chaque jour.
J'étais au 19 ème étage avec vue sur l'hudson river
J'y retournerai volontiers

title: Perfect location for Time Square
text: Excellent location, Girls trip, we felt safe and was close to everything. Clean rooms, great Restaurant and great Bar. Easy check in & out. Will hold your luggage if you arrive early. Our second time staying here. ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

title: Amazing hotel
text: We came here for a long weekend and had a great experience. The staff is so helpful and friendly and the room was sparkling clean. The location couldn't be better. This will be my hotel when we come again.

title: Cost reasonable but the service and security.. TOP NOTCH
text: I stay at a lot of NYC hotels for business, I found the Edison on Expedia and the only reason I took it was the price. Thinking it would be like the rest, well i was wrong. Treated great from the time I exited the cab until the time i got back in the cab. i especially liked the Security to get to the room, humans looking and make sure you belong. i have 3 more reservations. Highly Suggest you trying them out.

title: Girls Trip NYC
text: 4 girls with connecting rooms. Room size great. We were able to leave suitcases out and still had plenty of room. Bathroom a little small only one at a time could be in there. Good location and the free breakfast and walking tour was a plus.

title: Feels like home!
text: The best thing about the Hotel Edison is their staff.  They are warm, welcoming and always make me feel like I have come home.  The location in the heart of Times Square is not only convenient but exciting.  You get the thrill of the city with all the comforts of home!

title: Lion king
text: Quick trip from Montreal, come often to the city. For business and leisure. Very desappointed with Times Square. Shame i use to work there and it was magic, too many homeless , smell hash and always chasing for money……😡

title: Great location and comfortable clean rooms
text: We had a great time in NY and enjoyed our hotel amenities (several restaurants and a bar) as a respite from going out for breakfast or a late-night drink.  This hotel a perfect location and close to all transportation and many food options.  Would definitely recommend and would stay again.

title: Lovely stay
text: Stayed here end of August felt very safe here  you had to show your key to get to your room which I thought was really good for safety. Was on the 3rd floor at the back very quiet. Room was ok could maybe do with coffee and tea.  Very friendly staff on the doorstep for theatre and juniors which was are favourite. The hotel tax was a bit pricey but overall we enjoyed are stay at Hotel Edison will be booking again soon

title: Great place!
text: Loved it here. We love old hotels and the location was great! We did have an issue with our AC so it was so hot in our room but they finally got it fixed around 3:30 AM. The workers were super friendly- Feehat (sp?) was exceptional!

title: Great hotel, great location!
text: A very busy Times Square hotel, but the service was really great, the elevators very fast, the rooms VERY big by NYC standards, and very clean. Very quiet - could not hear the other guests or noise in the hallway. Would definitely gateau here  again

title: Biju bathroom
text:
We had a member of staff enter our room twice to check the phone but the first time he did not announce himself 
The room was clean and tidy but the bathroom was small 
The grab and go breakfast was good but the sit down menu was very limited considering that you are paying extra for it

title: Noisy and uncomfortable hotel
text:
The room was extremely noise 
Trucks operating in front of the hotel every night
Really bad insulated
We stay in the hotel heavy stroms (Ophelia) and the heating did not work 
Room was partially clean
We don't recomend this hotel

title: Ideal location
text: You cannot beat the location for convenient access to TKTS booth and all the theatres in the neighborhood. Hotel was very clean and well maintained. I appreciated the vouchers for breakfast which I used every morning of my stay.

title: Guest Review
text: The location of this hotel was perfect, close to everything we chose to do on this trip. The rooms were clean and bed was comfortable. However, the room was very small, outdated and smelled stale. The bathroom was extremely small, and occasionally we would see a gnat flying in the bathroom. We had to ask for extra towels everyday because would only receive 3 new ones each day, and we had 4 people in our room. The wi-fi was horrible. I would not stay here again and would not recommend to others.

title: if you are not there for a play, don’t go
text: The only reason why this place is even being rated, is because of the theaters and plays in the area. I absolutely would not recommend coming to this place unless you are here for the theater or place

title: Hotel Edison Oct 2023
text:
First time to New York. Wanted to stay near time square. Hotel is just off the busy time square by about 1 block. Hotel is 100 years old. Lots of history in the hotel. It is refurbished, looks pretty good. A hotel with character, not cookie cutter same as others.
King size room, back of hotel, not a great view, but quiet for sleeping!
Comfortable bed, bathroom is small but functional. Open window in bathroom, no fans. It worked fine.
Room is set up that 2 people can get ready, full size mirror in living space, desk, coffee maker, no fridge. Was out of hotel 12 hours a day so space was fine for 2 people.
Great AC, room was always cool and gave white noise for sleeping, blackout blinds. Rooms were always cleaned, great job by housekeeping staff!
The elevators were awesome. 6 in total never waited more than 1 minute for an elevator! That’s saying something due to size of this hotel.
Breakfast voucher  daily, Excellent restaurant Friedmans or grab and go at Bond 45. 
Great security, had to show room key to get to elevators. Shout out to security officer Laura. She was very personable always greeted you with a smile. She works the 3-11 shift, nice to see her after a long day with a kind word!
Overall the hotel very good, price was OK for Time Square. Close but far enough off Time square for a break from the chaos. Friendly, helpful staff. No complaints by us!

title: 4th visit and still enjoying it
text: Great location for anyone visiting NYC for the first time. Times Square is right at your feet with a 2 minute walk away. This is a great location to pick up a hop on hop off tour too. Breakfast was included when I stayed here. I opted for the grab and go option to get as much out of my few days there.

title: In the middle of everything and off the main road
text: Hotel Edison is conveniently located near Times Square and Broadway, close to theaters, restaurants, and the subway. Because it is part way down a side street, there is less noise and chaos.  The friendly staff is helpful.  The hotel is clean and comfortable.

title: Great location
text: We have stayed at Hotel Edison twice, and plan to stay there again. The location is right in the middle of the theater district and within walking distance of theaters, restaurants, basically everywhere within the Times Square area. The rooms are roomy, beds and pillows comfy… overall love staying here!

title: Convenient but souless
text: Its a very busy hotel. In the middle of Times Square its very convenient. The rooms are comfortable, the service and the security is excellent. My problem is that its very impersonal. It has to be with thousands of tourists. So no complaint about the hotel and what it provides, just its not for me

title: Great Location
text: Have been staying at Hotel Edison for over 20 years. Staff is always friendly and helpful. Could not ask for a better location right in Times Square. Will continue to stay here for the rest of my visits to New York City.

title: Hotel Edison
text: Stayed in the Signature King on the 16th floor. Room was clean and comfortable. Staff is extremely friendly and helpful. I appreciated them checking each guests room key before entering the elevators.

title: Caring Hotel
text: Excellent rooms, courteous staff and excellent location. However the elevators needs to be either added or managed properly as during morning we had to wait for almost 25 min in order to get down to lobby

title: Beautiful Hotel, great location, excellent hospitality
text: Beautiful Hotel but in addition to the cleanliness of the rooms is the excellent customer service. The staff is attentive and make every effort to make your stay enjoyable... and they do it with sincerity and a smile!

title: In heart of NYC. All facillities in one place. Rooms are clean, cozy.
text:
The hotel is inside the Time Square. Everything you wat to see in NYC is on walking distance from this hotel. 
Rooms are clean. Elevators plenty and very quick. Security is high level. 
Food options are variate. 
Vallet parking also very friendly.

title: New York - with art deco style !
text:
Fantastic, hotel in the heart of NY. The staff are just amazing, going above and beyond to make your stay comfortable. Room service with a smile. Wonderful architectural interior  character to match.

Look forward to visiting again next year !

title: Great location and there's space to put bags
text: The noise didn't bother us. Felt safe in the location and hotel as hotel security monitored ppl coming in. Beautiful art deco interior at lobby. Door Men/Bell boys were attentive and always helpful. Acknowledged guests and if they needed anything. The cleaning lady's were also attentive. They even mop the emergency staircase. Liked the Grab & Go Breakfast choose b/W pastry or fruit, Granola Yoghurt or Hot Breakfast sandwich, HOT coffee tea or juice - sufficient & great way to start the day. Bond 45 Restaurant has interesting 1930s ambience should try to eat there at least once - check out the notable ppl's names etched on the walls. Overall we felt safe in the hotel& location, lots of choices of food and good ppl especially the service staff.

title: DEFINETLY PERFECT ACCOMODATIONS & LOCALITY A MUST STAY PLACE!!!
text: Amazing top knotch accommodations, food was excellent in both restaurants,  the locality was perfect 1/2 block to center of times square,  Room was restaurants n comfy n modern DEFINETLY STAYING AGAIN IF WE GO TO NEW YORK... The people were so kind and the maid service prompt n so clean Thank you this made our trip perfect 🥰 💞

title: Great Stay!
text: This was my first time visiting NYC and loved our hotel stay! I had to go during fashion week for work - and it was so close to times square and getting around where i needed. Staff was kind, attentive and I had no complaints!

title: Edison hotel way below par/ overpriced
text:
On first views the hotel looks good being situated next to time square. You already accept that it’s going to be quite busy and a bit noisy. 
Inside the hotel was very pleasant and clean. The staff were all excellent. On arrival to the room it was a bit bland but adequate. 
Late evening we realised that the supposed double glazed windows were not fit for purpose!  Huge gaps with the window frames having had temporary repairs to try to keep them closed. You couldn’t open them however one pane of glass was loose and in danger of falling out of the frame. Not good when three floors up! They won’t mention about all the construction work going on in the next door building attached to the hotel or the huge building refurbishment going on over the road. This one’s been happening for well over a year and the noise is horrendous especially of a night as most work can only be carried out between the hours of 10pm - 6am! If you’re looking for a nice peaceful sleep forget it! Pay more for a better hotel located in a slightly quieter area. 
You also need to watch for the amount of taxes/service charges added onto your stay. There’s are currently around $40 per night.

title: Excellent location and friendly service
text: This was our first time in New York and the location was perfect.  We would stay there again.  The rooms are clean and updated.  The security was great which made us feel more comfortable and I really liked being able to check in and out at the kiosk instead of waiting in line.

title: Durschnittliches 4 Sterne Hotel
text:
Durschnittliches 4 Sterne Hotel, kein Kühlschrank, relativ kleine Zimmer. 
Inkludiertes Frühstück nur Take away oder wenn man vor Ort absitzt kostet es Zusatz.
Wir waren 2 Erwachsene und 2 Kinder, trotzdem war nur für 2 Personen das Frühstück inklusive.
Ansonsten ganz okey.

title: Had a great time!!
text: Great stay, great location, clean rooms. Had an issue with being right next to the elevator as it was quite noisy. It was resolved and we were moved to a better location no problem. Very close to Time Square and within walking distance to 5th Ave, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, Radio City Hall and so much more!  Breakfast was included which was great.

title: Dirty bathroom
text:
Initial check in clerk was wonderful, however, it went downhill from there. Our room was next to another room undergoing construction so it was unbelievably noisy. The bathroom was not properly cleaned, the tub contained hair from the prior occupants and the toilet was stained. The room was damp and musty.
