The front desk was incredibly unaccommodating. For example, we asked to use some scissors to cut hang straps from a dress being used for a wedding. We were informed that hotel security measures prevented bringing up scissors or me going downstairs and getting them for use in the room.

While the location is great there are more customer friendly options available for the same cost.

title: Centrally located hotel
text: Great central location within walking distance to restaurants, central park and around the corner from Time Square. Food in the hotel restaurant was good. Grab and Go breakfast was nice and for $5 you can order off a specia; section and dine in the restaurant. Our room was rather dimley lit and faced other room windows. If you want a view, you would need to upgrade.

title: Mai più! Sconsigliato
text:
No way.
Rooms unconfortable...and we took the new one, imagine the old one.
No answers by mail or better...answers not satisfided.
Haidryer was broken and it takes more then one hour to changed it.

Personale accogliente all'inizio, sgorbutico dopo
Camere strette e senza aria...finestre sporche che non si possono nemmeno aprire. 
Giusto la posizione, ma non si può dormire, sempre rumori durante la notte.
Sconsigliatissimo

title: Hotel Edison
text:
Wifi never worked, roof top bar was not open which was not advertised. Room small and no storage space. Reception staff charged us twice for the first night. Breakfast facility and variety of food very poor. 

. . . . . . . . . . . . .

title: Fantastic location
text: Stayed here for four nights, excellent location and a lovely hotel.  We arrived before check in time but was able to leave our luggage behind reception. (Charged $1 per bag). Our room was large and very clean. Could do with some more light, very dark due to buildings all around outside. We had an issue with some guests causing unnecessary noise in the early hours, we called reception and security sorted the issue promptly, they also rang our room later on to check we were ok. Staff were friendly and always spoke on leaving/entering the hotel. We had the $5 breakfast and the grab and go,both were very tasty. If we return to NYC, we would definitely stay here again.

title: Excellent hotel in great location
text:
Excellent location
Staff friendly and professional 
Room clean and king size bed very comfortable.
Will recommend this hotel to all my family and friends 
Will return to this hotel once back in newyork.

title: Excellent service.
text: The hotel staff made you feel welcome, the staff were kind & courteous.  The rooms were very clean. It was a great experience & would go back. The grab & go breakfast included was very good as well as the sit down breakfast at Friedmans Cafe.

title: Rooms need to be updated
text: Hotel is in a great location. Rooms are in need of serious update. Lighting and Wifi are not the best. I would recommend if you are staying merely for the location proximity to Times Square. Had to open ticket for Wifi

title: NYC tourist
text: Only real complaints are the tub in the bathroom was not safe. Very slippery and felt like I would break through it. And was disappointed they charged fees and BS on the backend of the stay. When people pay for things up front they should pay for everything up front, don't hand them a bill for fees whencthey check out. It is disrespectful and makes me not want to stay here again.

title: BEWARE of the time delays in return of bond
text:
Location is good, but the room had an incredibly noisy air con unit that i had to unplug so i could sleep. 

Very poor response to several emails (took about 2 weeks to get a reply) asking about the bond i was advised would be returned in 2 weeks.  One month later and they still owe me $300 and have no idea when it will be returned.

title: Great location.
text: Super location to Times Square and the theaters.  Large room with two comfortable queen size beds.  Restaurants on premises were excellent with food and service. Friendly staff. Appreciated the security measures within the hotel. Downer: Very loud construction started at 11 pm across the street each night.  Hopefully, it's completed soon.

title: Girls Trip to NYC - 2 night stay at Edison Hotel was perfect
text: I had an amazing 2 night stay at Edison Hotel. The location is perfect, just a few steps from Times Square, right by the Red Stairs. The room was very spacious, we stayed at the 17th floor, room with a balcony, leaving room and really spacious bathroom. We got to try Bond 45 Restaurant and I swear, their lasagna was the best I ever had, and trust me, I lived in Italy for a month so it was that good haha. Breakfast was good too, basic but great to start the day. Everyone working there was super friendly and nice to us. I will definitely come back.

title: Overall good but front staff ruined experience from start
text: Girl who checked me in ruined my experience from beginning as she was incredibly rude and snotty to me because my bank had a security measure first time it ran my card. Incredibly rude. The rest of the experience was not bad but it definitely set a tone.

title: Mostly great.
text: Other than a faulty bathroom receptacle and no heat in a cold room, the hotel was very good for our short stay. The location was close to Broadway shows and the Bond 35 restaurant was excellent. We enjoyed the stay at Hotel Edison over all.

title: Breakfast rip off
text:
The included breakfast actually requires payment of a resort fee and $5 if you want to sit down!?
Location was great for Times Square and Broadway shows. I recommend & Juliet and if you like special effects, Harry Potter

title: Great location, but tired
text: The Hotel Edison is in a fantastic location.  The rooms were definitely not what we were used to.  The paint was peeling on the doors.  The bathroom was tiny and the tub is very old so never seems quite clean.  The cleaners did a great job so the beds were clean and comfortable.  It was extremely noisy at night as there was construction directly across the street and there was constant loud beeping outside.  It sounded like the windows were open the whole time even though they were sealed shut.  There were a lot of additional fees at checkout.

title: A perfect stay in NYC
text:
The most perfect stay in NYC couldn’t fault the hotel, the staff and food all excellent in a safe environment. 
We stayed for our honeymoon and I would not hesitate to recommend the hotel to anyone travelling to New York who would like to stay in Time Square such a central location.

title: Lovely hotel in an excellent location
text: Lovely hotel, that was clean and comfortable in an excellent location. The hotel is very close to Times Square and Broadway but far enough away from the noise. Staff were incredibly kind and helpful. They offer a take out breakfast with the cafe down the road, which had tasty food. I would 100% stay here again.

title: Couldn't fault a thing.
text:
Location ...perfect
Staff .... approachable and welcoming
           especially the doormen
Room..... bed comfortable, room clean, 
          could do with a kick of paint & 
          upgrade, bathroom small, but we 
          didn't spent much time there so 
          didn't bother us 
Food...... used the grab & go breakfast, 
            and Bond perfect for a drink. 
Would definitely use the hotel again.

title: Excelente opción
text: excelente opción super cerca a time square y con  muchas estaciones del metro cerca con la facilidad de moverse hacia cualquier parte , ademas a 4 cuadras del Houdson yard  lo que te permite conocer mucho sin necesidad de transporte.   buena atención , el desayuno es un poco limitado pero suficiente.

title: Great Location
text: Everything was great just our room had a really small bathroom but it didn't stop us to have a great time, location is perfect just a few steps from times square, price was to high for me but the best for the average in that area

title: Excellent stay
text:
Hotel Edison was a perfect location for our week stay in NY City.
Idealy located in Times Square with convenient access to Broadway - theatre district, walking distance to main attractions and subway.
Big thanks to all very professional staff and especially to Concierge Fehat Begolli, who was always at his best for everything we needed. His excellent advice and professional service made our stay even more enjoyable! Will be back!

title: Great service, great location
text: Stayed  this past weekend with my adult daughter. Front desk was great, location was perfect. Hotel is a little older, but rooms have been updated. (I stayed here as a kid in 1989). Late checkout of noon was helpful and the bellman kept our bags for a $1 each while we attended a show on Broadway. Upon check-in we had dinner at Bond 45 in the hotel - a little pricey but the food and atmosphere are good. We also had the Grab & Go breakfast from Carve and it was really good. Would 100% stay again!

title: Buena ubicación y limpieza
text: Muy buena ubicación cerca del metro y Times Square. Las habitaciones son cómodas y se limpian a diario. El restaurante debajo del hotel, Bond 45, algo caro pero excelente. Nos sobró que nos cobraran 1$ por maleta el último dia para guardarlas después de estar alojados toda la semana.

title: Too expensive for the room and there was a block party blasting noise until almost midnight on a week night!
text: I reserved this room because its cost seemed a bit better than others I could choose from, but somehow by the time I finished the reservation process it was about 50% higher than I really wanted to spend.  I hate the "amenities fee" when the internet was useless and I never used the gym and I was only in the building from 5 p.m. until 11 a.m. Plus, after the show we saw we returned to the room and couldn't get to sleep because there was a very loud black party going on blaring rap and hip hop music that was so loud it felt like our windows were wide open.  Didn't stop until around midnight.  So that's what an almost $900 per night room is like?  I don't think so.  I've been to NYC many times to see a show and stay and this was one of my worst hotel stays and yet one of the most expensive.

title: Excellent
text: Great location but the city noise is everywhere. Friedman’s was expensive and overrated. The service folks were all wonderful. The room was clean and spacious but there was no hairdryer or mini fridge!

title: Toller Service und erstklassige Lage!
text:
Die Zimmer Ansich sind nichts besonderes, der Service ist allerdings besonders hervorzuheben! Jeder ist stets super freundlich und bemüht, es so angenehm wie möglich zu gestalten.

Die Lage ist hervorragend, ich glaube fast eine bessere gibt es nicht. 

Würde das Hotel völlig bedenkenlos noch mal buchen.

Die wine hour ist wirklich nett und unterhaltsam!

title: Horrible - stay far far away from this place
text: Dirty room with filthy dirty light switches and AC unit is probably a health hazard that hasn’t been cleaned out in years. I wore sandals in my room the entire time…The sheets smelled sour and my stay was JUST awful. It was like a scene out of a horror film. They also charged 2$ to hold my luggage for 1 hour, which is unheard of…

title: Great location
text: The noise outside our room was unbearable. The construction started at 10 PM and went through till late morning. If not for the noise, I would stay at the Edison again. But not until the construction is complete.

title: Bring ear plugs
text: Noisy rooms not sound proofed. Breakfast is in a paper bag in your room. Very crowded hotel, in very busy street. Rooms are clean and water is hot, but for over 3000$ for six nights  I expected better quality for money.

title: Siendo tres te dan desayuno para dos?????
text:
Bien ubicado. Decepcionadas con el desayuno. No por la calidad, si no pq siendo tres personas solo teníamos  desayuno dos. Al hacer la reserva con el buscador poníamos tres personas. Porqué el desayuno es solo para dos????
Desayunar en New York en esa zona es caro.

title: Watch out!
text:
Be very careful, the hotel charged us an extra $280 of “facilities fees” (?!)  , which we noticed once back home, without EVER mentioning this to us, in fact all expenses and taxes were pre-paid before we travelled to the US. We are back home in the UK now and seeking legal advice about this.

Disgusting! Rip off! Never again!

title: Très bruyant et accueil déplorable.
text:
Nous sommes arrivés le 13/09 vers 11.30 pm . Il y avait 2 employés à l'acueil dont un fort occupé par un groupe . L'autre faisait quelques apparitions au comptoir et disparaissait par une porte . Il y avait une queue pour le check in . Au bout de 45 mn, les gens devant moi ont été "servis". Je me suis avancé et le gentil monsieur m'a dit qu'il n'était pas prèt et que je devais retourner dans la queue. Le tout sur un ton peu amène. Puis il a disparu par la fameuse porte. Il a fallu attendre que sa collègue en ait terminé avec son groupe pour qu' enfin au bout d'une heure , nous puissions gagner notre chambre.( Elle a pris l'empreinte de ma carte de crédit comme c'est l'usage.)
L'hotel est situé près de Times Square. L'avantage est que c'est central . Mais c'est extrèmement bruyant le soir et la nuit car la rue est constituée de bars, discothèques et music halls. Ca plus les sirènes de police et d'ambulances, plus les travaux dans l'immeuble d'en face qui commencent à 4 h du matin , essayez un peu de dormir. Le jour du départ, au check out, la dame m'a dit que tout était règlé. Je m'attendais pourtant à payer quelque chose pour les cafés pris dans la chambre. E n arrivant à mon domicile, j'ai constaté que mon compte avait été débité de 300 Euros par l'hôtel. Je ne sais absolument pas à quoi cela correspond, je n'ai pas eu de facture ou de justificatif. 
Donc pour moi, cet hçotel est à fuir.

title: Shaun Cassidy was in her dreams.
text: My wife had seen Shaun Cassidy back when she was in 8th grade. This was a birthday trip to see him again. She last saw him in Portland, Maine. She even got to touch his hand!! Video proof is available!! 😂

title: A stay in the big apple
text: Overall it was a comfortable stay and the inclusion of breakfast options was great. But don't expect anything too much or you'll be disappointed. It's the ideal accommodation if you want to stay in the middle of all the action that is Time Square and don't mind a lot of noise and chaos. It is located centrally in Manhattan with easy access to most of the iconic tourist attractions otherwise buses taxis and the subway are all easy to access.

title: Treated like Royalty!!
text:
A quick note to express my profound admiration for the Edison Hotel staff!

ROYALTY!!!!

We were treated like Royalty!!

Let me introduce myself; I am Debra Ovall, Co-Producer of Singles in the City-DC, Philanthropist Awarded Movie Actress with JCL Productions, International Commercial Model, Awarded Runway Fashion Model, all Published.  So, I recognize Royal treatment!!

I usually stay at Embassy Suites when I return to New York (still love you ES) but after my last stay during New York Fashion Week I have found a new Love, The Edison Hotel!!

New York Fashion Week along with “9-11” and general tourism, must be one of the busiest times in NYC and yet the Edison Hotel staff happily and eagerly encouraged me to let them know if anything was needed to help my stay be successful; even giving me phone numbers or business cards to reach them if needed …. Unbelievable, yet true! 

As a Runway Model for several designers and shows, including at Gotham Hall, and the Official Make-Up Artist (MUA) for Randhawa Brands, it was a very busy time for me.  I also assisted in care of the Models as well as myself.  Having such an extraordinary atmosphere of Royalty presented by the Edison Hotel staff made my stay Easy & Successful.  Thank You!
•	Fehat Begolli ex:7203 (was AMAZING)
•	Rommel Gopez – Area Director of Guest Relations
•	Luidin De Los Santos – Hotel Manager
•	Mellisa – front desk
•	Frances
•	Marco
•	John (JB) – security. The story to this is that JB helped get All of my luggage as well as a purchase I made and misplaced.  He made sure that my luggage was picked up by a co-model friend that was coming back to Virginia.  This was a tremendous help!  JB called back when he said he would and checked cameras to locate all my things.  Thank you, JB!!!
These are the Staff members who I am recognizing and recommend for abundant financial increase because they truly use their very special gifts for the good of the Client and for The Edison Hotel!  Thank you!

Great Success!
Debra Ovall
 (Rm. 1017)
IMDB:  Debra Ovall
IG:  Debralovall / Debraovall.TV / Debraovall
YouTube: Debra Ovall

title: I wouldn’t come back
text:
No vents in the bathroom don’t bring a date if you’re planning on going number 2. 

Wi-Fi doesn’t work 95% of the time.

Bell boys outside are very unpardonable and unfriendly. 

Bath tubs are slippery and my mom took a slip, very dangerous.

Front desk staff unfriendly and y accommodating. 

Security staff unprofessional.

title: Agréable mais bruyant
text:
Quartier extrêmement bruyant.
Hotel bien placé et confortable.  Un peu usine aux heures de pointe. Ascenseur nombreux, petits déjeuners agréable.  Literie de qualité sauf pour le canapé lit très limité et ancien. Service payant de transfert aéroport pratique.

title: Not the best
text: This is hotel is not worth the money, far too busy and so noisy.  The staff were not the most helpful and the lady concierge was so rude to people.  The cleaning staff were excellent and so friendly.  Not worth the money and defiantly wouldn't recommend it to people.  Nicer hotels in the area and also cheaper.

title: Good experience !
text: It's was our first time in NY and it's was amazing ! The hotel was very cool and cleanliness. Breakfast it's a little problem because we had just two tickets per day for the room whereas we were 5 people in one room. This is just the negativ point.

title: Travel
text:
Lokasyon çok iyi
Odalar özelikle ön odalar çok gürültülü 
Oda servis çok iyi
Temizlik odalar için güzel
Kahvaltıda üç kişi kaldık iki kişilik kahvaltı veriliyor bu konu düzeltilmelidir. Rezervasyon da yazılı olduğunu farketmeden oteli almıştım. Kaç kişi kalıyor ise o kadar kişiye kahvaltı verilmesi gerekiyor.Aslında bu durumu resepsiyona açıkladığımda üç kişi için yeterli kahvaltı fişini verdiler. Mağdur olmadık.

title: American Horror Story Hotel
text: Only stayed here because everything was so experience in the city this week and I had a discount code for the Edison. Awful experience. It was like being inside American Horror Story Hotel. Will not stay here again. I’ll just pay more to go somewhere else. I love art deco decor and they could have really made something special with this hotel, but it’s just grungy and so disgusting compared to the surrounding hotels

title: Great location for all the tourist sites
text: Brilliant location, so close to everything Broadway, times square and easy to get subway to all other tourist sites.  Good food and service.  Rooms have nice beds, and clean, but building and fittings showing their age.  Street traffic over weekend and construction next door, made room noisy at times.

title: Hotel Edison - Location, locaton, location
text:
The Hotel Edison Times Square is a very comfortable, safe, and friendly hotel.  The staff were always helpful to your needs.  Being located in the center of Times Square allowed us to walk to all the Broadway theatres as well as Rockefeller Center.  Subway access is also close by.  We had issues with our accessible bathroom, but I feel regular room bathrooms would be fine.
I would return without question.

title: Good location as your base
text:
Excellent hotel as a base close to Time Square, yes the hotel rooms are a little tired but they are clean. Rooms are cleaned daily and you have your choice of places for breakfast, a couple of grab and go places and another you can sit while you prepare for your day. Carve on 47th and 8th was the best of the 3. 
    Hotel can be noisy at night as a roof top bar and theatre across the road.
    All in a great base staff are all very helpful and also onsite you can book tours.

title: FANTASTIC ART DECO HOTEL ALMOST ON TIMES SQUARE
text:
Hotel has a beautiful art deco interior. Lifts were always fast. Clean and spacious rooms with water provided daily. Housekeeping daily and all toiletries provided. The hotel has basic amenities, however everything you need when you will spend most of your time out on the streets exploring. I had to do work while I was here and the Wi-Fi was great. 3 Breakfast options (Carve being our favorite) 
Don’t miss the really cool rum bar called rum house at the front. We had a fantastic stay and highly recommend.

title: Great Experience just next to Times Sq
text: The staff was really attentive, everything was clean, the express checkin/checkout service is super fast and useful. Also, the food at the restaurant was amazing. The location of the hotel is on point.

title: NYC Nice!
text: A wonderful property, professionally managed with staff who are courteous and caring.  Food services very or $5 sit down breadfast were ideally and really a good start to a busy day of touring in NYC!  I'll be back!

title: Excellent experience
text:
The beds  were comfortable and room was clean. Housekeeping came each morning.
Staff was very friendly and extremely helpful. The transportation team were excellent as well. The were very helpful after we had a flight issue. Restaurants on site also good.

title: Mediocre hotel in a great location.
text: Bed was very comfortable. Room was very dark. No storage for clothing. Roach in bathroom. Breakfast to go was convenient. Location is excellent. It was fine but I wouldn’t stay there again. Probably the only negative of our entire trip. It wasn’t terrible and at least the bed was comfortable.

title: Theatre district must stay
text: Excellent location for our day in the City— excellent customer service from Hanniel at check in!! Perfect experience to round out a perfect 36 hours in the big Apple. Breakfast voucher was a nice feature and great to go option to get to our train.

title: Watch Tuesday Night Noise
text: The concierge Bennie is fabulous as are her team members. We paid for an upgrade and it was not on Tuesday night. There is a band across the street that gets louder each hour until midnight when they stop. Management said they cannot control the noise outside noise. True. They could have removed the upgrade charge for Tuesday night. It wasn’t. It was a downgrade.

title: Terrible attitude, bad food, rude service
text: From the front office staff to the restaurant and housekeeping, they have a terrible attitude. They make you feel like you're not a customer of their hotel. They treat you like you're a homeless person and they are providing you with shelter. This isn't a place you want to stay.

title: Hotel at Times Square
text:
Central located at Times Square, near to metro and a lot of theatre's.
Clean and functional hotel with restaurants, but noisy. Some of the rooms should be renovated to reach the current hotel standard.

title: A Times Square Home Away from Home
text: My two sisters and I spent a week at the Edison. The staff was friendly and helpful and the location was perfect for attending Broadway shows, enjoying find dining or experiencing midtown Manhattan on foot.

title: Hotel Edison
text: The staff was friendly.  Great location if you want to be close to Times Square and all transportation- lots to do within walking distance. The grab and go breakfast tasted good and was convenient.  The room was very basic and the beds were comfortable.  The only complaint I have about the room is that the AC kept shutting off at night and the room seemed hot to me... I like a really cold room, though!

title: Excellent Stay
text: Location just next to Times Square. Two minutes walk to subway station, with a lot of places to eat around. 15 minutes walk away from Rockefeller . Staff always happy to help even though their hotel is so busy.

title: Super Lage, Zimmer mit Blick auf eine Wand
text: Super Lage, Zimmer mit Blick auf eine Wand. Recht teuer. Reception schlecht organisiert. Einchecken erst um 15 Uhr. Dann eine lange Schlange. Zimmer sehr steril und in die Jahre gekommen. Blick auf eine Wand (Zi. 633) Lage absolut top, direkt am Times Square und doch leise.

title: Trip to Manhattan
text: One should find a way to pay without using your credit card as they put a HOLD on deposits for two weeks.  This is far too long to hold folks funds.  The staff was well trained and delivered good service.

title: Hotel Edison a Winner!
text: Hotel Edison ideally located in Times Square with convenient access to the theater district and subways.  Immaculate accommodations and attentive housekeepers (Kim on 8th floor) who provided extra water and coffee supplies as husband and I are huge coffee drinkers.  Appreciated the 24-hour security guards checking room keys for elevator access - I’ve only ever seen this done during evening hours at other hotels.  Big thanks for TWO luggage racks in the room - greatly appreciated and needed as husband and I are senior citizens and constant bending can be challenging.  Breakfast coupons at Friedman’s  were a nice touch - excellent food and service with convenient access through hotel lobby.  My husband and I have already committed to making Hotel Edison our hotel of choice if we ever return to New York City.

title: Excelente ubicación y servicio
text:
A 50 metros del time Square.                              
Buen desayuno.           
Buen equipamiento de baño. 
Excelente servicio de cafetería en la habitación 
Predisposición del personal para resolver problemas (tuvimos que extender la estadía y nos ubicaron más días sin cambiar de habitación )

title: Things to CHANGE
text:
The charge for holding baggage while waiting for checkin/checkout is a NO GO. Plus the $89 for early check in
making people wait in the lobby all day is ridiculous. Construction outside
Very dangerous in front of Hotel.

title: Unbelievable accommodating
text: I had booked with the Edison through a second party app. There were some issues with the app and incorrect information, when I got to the hotel. The problems that presented themselves were resolved quickly with the the help of Justina . She was very friendly understanding accommodating just a wonderful front desk attendant- also the concierge Vashon was so friendly and attentive -he made us feel so welcome and was incredibly helpful. I cannot say enough good things about our experience at the hotel Edison. Just a top notch staff from the front desk to the housekeeping staff were so friendly and a pleasure to speak with!!  ⭐️ ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

title: Excelente localização
text:
Custo benefício muito bom para o local.
Hotel antigo mas tem todo conforto que o turista precisa. Ele não é aquele hotel requintado e moderno mas atende as expectativas para turistas que querem ficar perto da Times Square. Quando fiz a reserva, consegui o menor valor da diária nas redondezas.
tem restaurantes na saída e próximos, que fazem parceria para oferecer o café da manhã quando estiver incluído na diária.

title: Ok room, great location
text: Ok, no frills room. Use online checkin/checkout to save yourself time, it was very convenient. great location to Times Square, but a far walk from Madison Square Garden. Doormen we’re prompt and always helped with getting transportation.

title: It’s a NO for me.
text: Rude staff. Never willing to help, always willing to enforce. Very Unorganized. Kiosk weren’t working, which happens, but I asked 2 different concierges to help me and they both said “you’ll have to find someone else” Just didn’t have a nice stay. Room was nice, but that’s all. No fridge. I’ll never stay here again.

title: Fun Stay in New York!
text: Some hiccoughs initially, but overall it was a decent experience.  Started out unhappy before I even got to the hotel, but in the end the issue was resolved.  Some of the staff went all out to ensure we had a pleasant stay were fully satisfied, and I appreciated that.

title: Room Oversold, “free upgrade” to moldy room
text: Room was oversold that was booked 2 months prior to arrival (Room with Balcony) free upgrade by hotel into a Suite with Balcony. Room was not ready at check in time (3pm) waited until 3:45. During our wait we noticed the hotel staff turning many people away. Once we entered the room a pungent smell hit us. The entire sitting room area carpet was covered in water from a leaking wall mounted A/C unit. The smell was awful. It was absolutely insane that a hotel staff wouldn’t say anything. We stayed here for 2 days. We paid a lot of money for excursions around the city and didn’t want to spend more staying outside of the city for our trip. That’s why we pre-booked everything 2 months ahead of time. We were worried that if we said something. The hotel would just tell us to leave and had no choice to deal with it. For almost $500 a night for the hotel room. We have a reason to be upset about this.

title: Do not stay here if you like sleep
text: Music was blaring most of the night (Tuesday night) and felt like it was in my room, which was on the 18th floor! Management offered me ear plugs…so this is obviously a frequent occurance. Also, room was either freezing or super hot bc AC is too big for size of the room.

title: Great stay at Hotel Edison NYC
text: Great place to stay when visiting New York! It's at the city's heart, Times Square is on your doorstep and the same with Broadway theatres. We were staying 11 days,  we were not happy with our room we met up with Jeau-Calvin,  who arranged for us to move rooms,  to level 19,  the new room was brilliant, he was very accommodating and extremely helpful.  Staff are very helpful!,  we enjoyed Friedmans restaurant and bar staff were excellent, the singing was simply beautiful. Rum bar is must, also Bond 45  and tours desk were helpful,  as well the Bell boys especially the Captain keep up your great work,  thank you for a great stay, p.s I forgot to mention the Housekeeping brilliant jobs guys regards Barb & Albert 13/9/23

title: A great, good value hotel with lovely staff
text: We upgraded to a Signature Queen room for my husbands 60th birthday. The room was lovely and Kezia the Guest Relations Ambassador had very kindly left us a bottle of wine and some nibbles, so thank you once again Kezia, that was a lovely gesture. We loved all the art deco in the hotel and the staff, especially in the restaurants and bars, were very helpful & friendly. Hanniel checked us in and was very informative & friendly too. We would definitely visit Hotel Edison again.

title: Worst Hotel Experience of My Life!
text: EXTREMELY overpriced for the quality. The room is tiny, dirty, and had 1 outlet. The A/C runs all night to keep a 290 sq ft. room at 72°. The stay is wildly rude. Will try every way to get your money.

title: Right At Times Square
text: You can't beat the location of this hotel.  We were shocked how close it was to walk to all the tourist sights we wanted to see.  While it costs a bit more than hotels further away, it makes sense when you factor in transportation costs.

title: Disgusted by the lack of professionalism and empathy
text:
I have never been treated so poorly and embarrassed by any management, EVER! 
A girl that was rooming with us, got her period throughout the night and bled on the sheets. Housekeeping was notified immediately after waking up. The following day, after hours of exploring the city, security was guarding our door and escorted us to the front desk, like a bunch of criminals, refusing to explain what the issue was. Two managers arrived questioning why there was blood on the bed…in front of the entire full lobby. They proceeded to explain that there was also a coffee spill on the sheets and will need to charge $500 for disposal and cleaning. Mind you, one of the managers was a female and made the teenager feel ashamed about her period. This poor girl was so embarrassed and ashamed, which broke my heart. I understand from a business standpoint but how dare you make this child feel ashamed of her womanhood, let alone, something out of her control.  Completely disgusted how the situation was handled and the lack of respect, empathy and professionalism.

title: Good location and really good service
text: I think Edison is a good hotel for a first visit. Its really well located and the staff are really good. We stayed at the hotel for a week and was a good experience. We stayed as a family (3 adults and 1 baby), they don't have baby bed, but all the staff was really careful with us.

title: Good place
text: They did not give me the breakfasts that my reservation included.In general it is a central hotel if you want to enjoy Time Square. The cleaning service was excellent. My room was always clean and tidy.

title: Nice stay
text:
You get a little bit more than you expect. Very kind reception and management team 
Good value for money, great situation. 
Rooms are not new but still acceptable. 
Breakfast better pay extra money to sit down.

title: Breakfast grab and go
text: Quando reservamos o hotel com café da manhã não sabíamos que era para escolher 3 itens e comer no quarto. Para sentar tinha que pagar 5 dólares por pessoa e além disso não dão o café da manhã para a família toda.

title: 2nd time here , brilliant location good service
text:
We stayed at this hotel last year and I liked its location and the art deco feeling so we returned again this year. We checked in very late due to an issue with our flight and baggage so we were given room 216. The room was ok but it was very loud as was by the air con units for the hotel and next door to the housekeeping  supply room.  at 6.30am the room began to vibrate with noise. We got up and went to reception and asked for an alternative room. They had one later that afternoon once people had checked out and changed it no problem, this time we got room 1617 which was perfect. The hotel is very clean , we were there during the heatwave so were having 2 showers a day , we asked our cleaning lady for 4 bath towels a day which was no problem at all , she kept our room spotless and really looked after us. 
We will use this hotel again

title: Nice old school NYC hotel!
text: Convenient Times Square location. I loved the Friedman’s restaurant! And, this hotel is an amazing value for NYC. Great restaurants in the hotel and all over the neighborhood. My room was a little dated, but it was clean.

title: Women: please read
text:
The one perk? It’s steps from Times Square. The rest leaves so much to be said.
Upon returning to the room today, we were met by security. Then we were escorted to the managers, a male and female. We were being “talked to” for biohazard. I sneezed earlier, spilled a little coffee and when housekeeping came in, I asked them to come back after I was dressed. They didn’t. $150.00 because of an unplanned period that left a small stain. Be aware of these ridiculous charges if you have a baby who spits up, a potential seizure that’s out of your control, if you drool in your sleep, etc. The irony is that the male manager was much more understanding than the female who, in my opinion, was beyond robotic and lacked empathy. Her approach to me, “Did something happen in the room you’d like to tell us about?” As if I shattered mirrors, broke things, lit a cigarette, etc. A flipping accident occurred. I felt like I was in the principals office. I travel often and I have NEVER experienced such embarrassment for such a minor issue that could’ve been easily resolved upon check out. If you’re a woman who menstrates or a person who has a baby or epilepsy, be aware you may face a financial penalty for any accidents that may occur BEYOND YOUR CONTROL!

title: Don't Stay Here
text: Horrible hotel...no interaction with staff, all automated. Rooms were gross, hallways were steamy and smelled like armpit. Floors not vacuumed. Hotel lobby is a cluster f***. Only interaction with hotel staff was the elevator bouncer asking rudely to show my room key. Do yourself a favor and stay at AC Hotel by Mariott which was so upscale at nearly half the price.

title: Not satisfied.
text: Room very small. Breakfast very bad. Location exelent. Staff are not bad. Price very High. Busy hotel. They took 5 dollar for breakfast over the prices they took already. They took 3o usd and told to be returned later which I think they can took it by cache and return them by cash also. Really strange hotel.

title: Just ok
text: Small room with crappy view.  They advertises 250 square feet in the booking, but was small.  Our view was some noisy air conditioning units. But the beds were comfortable and the room was clean.  We loved the location.

title: Hotel bem localizado
text:
Hotel bem localizado , perto do metrô e da Times Square, tem café da manhã bem razoável , e uma starbucks na esquina ! 
O quarto é pequeno e o banheiro menor ainda !
Mas a cama era muito boa ! 
Funcionários bem atenciosos , guardamos nossas malas quando chegamos até o horário do checkin e na saída fizemos o mesmo por 1 dólar !
Voltaria a me hospedar !

title: Very disappointing.
text: We arrived 1 hour before check in and were told it would be $89.00 to check in early.  They charged us an additional $300. For I don’t know what.  The lady working the desk couldn’t even tell me.  We were charged an additional $50. For buying theater tickets. The room had 1 lamp and the street noise was horrible.  I will never stay there again.

title: Great Location but Average Everything Else
text:
I chose the Hotel Edison primarily for location / cost. If you’re looking for a property close to Times Square and looking to save a few dollars, then you might consider this property. 

Beds were comfortable and clean. 

I was disappointed about a few things but some of these are as expected for NYC:

1) Staff were not so friendly. We requested fresh towels and explained we were in a rush out to see a show. After 20mins, we ended up using our old towels to get ready. We told the staff member on our way out that we no longer needed the towels and he rolled his eyes. 

2) We requested fresh towels later that evening. After 45mins I called reception again. After a further 20mins the towels finally arrived.

3) The property charges a random USD$35 per night “Facility Fee” for a range of “benefits” which are fairly pointless. If they’re going to invent fees for stuff they should just add this to the booking cost so you know how much the stay will cost. 

4) Rooms are small but does have a private bathroom which is nice, but also small.

5) The property feels very dated which is charming in the lobby and hallways but not so charming in your room. Room decor and bathroom felt tired and just “clean enough”.  Rooms need a bit of a refresh. 

6) No fridge in the room was a real disappointment. Even a tiny bar fridge would have been enough to keep a couple of drinks / snacks cold and fresh. 

All up an average experience but I did pay an average price so maybe it’s a case of you get what you pay for. To be expected in NYC if you’re not paying $1,500 - $2,000 per night.

title: Good,nice relaxing hotel to stay with friendly helpful staff.
text: Second time at the Edison Hotel. Centrel for most attraction quiet considering location.However,no kettle or cups in room. Request them had to wait until next day.Was given kettle Earl Grey tea which not to everyone's taste, powdered milk 2 cups. For rest of week, no cups teabags or anything in room.Apart from that enjoyed stay.

title: Hotel Edison times Square has good location
text: Everything was good, but room doesn't have fridge, it's not good, hotel has good location nice staff and rooms are comfortable, my room doesn't have view just closed to another building for that reason I closed all shades for all times.

title: Wonderful location
text: This hotel is centrally located for the theater, shopping, Times Square and food.  The hotel staff was friendly and helpful.  This is our new go to hotel when we visit New York City.  Beds are comfortable, plenty of fluffy pillows and towels are generous.

title: Get as high up as you can!
text:
my review is 4 of 5 because....
35$ facility fee and unfair way to hide your true room rates.
the breakfast was great, and the location was amazing. This hotel is steps away from the theater where Sweeney Todd is playing.
There is nonstop construction and garbage emptying trucks banging ALL NIGHT and a woman screaming- it was not a restful night either night and we were on the 6th floor. The floors below us must not have slept a wink!
The bellhops, front desk and security were not very engaging or friendly. they were all efficient at their jobs but could have smiled and been way more friendly.  The front door men were tasked with keeping people from parking illegally and not helpful with calling a cab over.
The room was clean and fresh smelling, really comfortable beds. towels and sheets were top notch. The bathroom products were weird smelling, and I was glad I had brought my own. No FRIDGE in the room was a bummer for sure.
The Wifi was SSLLOOWW!!!!!!!! i disconnected and went with the 2 bars on the phone. 
Overall, we had a wonderful stay! I would definitely stay here again. the location was amazing. 
If you are into show-tunes, dinner at Freidman's does not disappoint.

title: 2023 Road trip
text: Best in NYC close to the square and entertainment. Staff excellent and accommodations were wonderful. I would highly recommend staying here. I did not like having to pay extra foe parking but being in that big city I would foe security

title: Classic old hotel in a great location
text: We choose this hotel for the location and price. It was suprisingly acomidating. It even included a coupon for a discount breakfast. We would definately consider staying there again if we return to New York.

title: Great Times Square Hotel
text: I love the Hotel Edison!  Convenient Times Square location for theatre goers.  Valet Parking is a breeze.  Security is excellent.  Grab and Go Breakfast adds value to your reservation.  Rooms range in size and many of the bathrooms are small.  This property does have some bathtubs, but you have to ask. Front Desk Staff is courteous and efficient.  There are multiple on-site dining options and nice wine hours twice a week. Beds are comfortable, rooms clean, amenities adequate. You will be in the heard of Times Square, so some rooms are loud.  Ample elevators that are quick, so getting in and out is easy.  The Bell Staff is excellent- helpful and efficient, friendly and most have been there for years. I highly recommend and will be back!

title: Great staff and location
text: We were welcomed from the time we stepped on property. The staff was great and the location was perfect for us. The room size was good (the bathroom was a little tight, but hey, I knew I wasn’t booking a spa).

title: Good if you want to be close to Broadway Theatres
text: Good hotel for the location.  A bit old, rooms are small and some of the rooms are down a long lonely corridor so if you’re travelling alone you might want to request one close to the elevators.  The service was good and I like that you could buy show tickets I. The lobby.

title: Great service and location in Times Square!
text:
Wonderful service at this hotel, which has a lot of history and character to it. It reminds me of something you would see in the old, glamorous, black and white movies from the 1930s and '40s. From the minute we came into the lobby to check in, the staff was very helpful. They were there to assist at the self-check kiosk, and very thorough at the front desk when I went down later to get extra keys and our breakfast vouchers. Housekeeping came each day and was very good about cleaning the room and checking to see when would be a convenient time for us to have her come clean.  We booked a king suite through the hotel website since they were offering a special rate, and they had the cookies from Schmackary's and a custom Hershey's bar waiting for us, as part of our package.

Breakfast vouchers were also included with our hotel suite reservation, which is a nice option.  My daughter had a breakfast sandwich from the Grab n Go breakfast at Bond 45. My husband and I used the ones for Friedman's (which is an extra $5/person charge since they seat you there), where I enjoyed a granola and fruit parfait, and my husband had a bagel and cream cheese.  I've posted pictures of the menus for the voucher breakfast selections. I did not try out the free breakfast voucher for Carve, which is down the block on the corner.

It was nice having a suite, even though it was on the small side - but that's what you would expect in a big city hotel like New York. The rooms were clean. King bed was comfy. Sofa bed was typical sofabed - not great but can sleep on it if you have to. The only thing we really did not care for was that the bathroom door was just a frosted glass door. So it did not feel very private, since everybody in the bedroom could still see a hazy version of you and everything you were doing in there, and how much clothing you had or did not have on. It made our daughters very uncomfortable when they had to use it. Also, because it is a glass door, when you turn on the light in the bathroom at night, it  lights up the whole bedroom, too. And yes, the shower does not have a door on it either, but it's designed to be that way, with a partially open shower, and we had no trouble with it.

The location of the hotel is right in the heart of Times Square, so it is defnitely a busy and noisy area, but it was very convenient for us since we were going to dinner and seeing shows while there. It was great being able to walk back to our hotel after the shows. We also had dinner at Friedmans and definitely appreciate that almost everything on their menu is gluten free.

Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Edison, and if you plan to stay in Times Square, this is a wonderful historic hotel with excellent service.

title: Best location ever
text: I spend 6 days there. If your thing is the Broadway shows, this Hotel y a great option since you are right there, close to all the theatres. Metro and Bus stations are also close by. CVS and Walgreens are also close for water and snacks. The vending machine in the second floor did not accepted credit cards. Time Square is right around the corner, but is not much to do there really... This is a crowded Hotel. The lines, mattress and pillows are of very high quality and the cleanliness was good. The bathroom is to small and the shower pressure is not high. I was in 1502, so early in the morning the noise of kids waiting for the elevator wake me up sometimes. New York is constantly growing, so not be surprise if you hear some machinery noise overnight. The included breakfast is good, but you will be treated like a second-class person once you show the vouchers at Friedman's, the restaurant in the lobby. You will get the worst table and just a small sample of orange juice. Overall I think is a goos place to stay.

title: Lack-luster
text:
Acknowledging that all hotel rooms are typically small (other than high-end) in Manhattan. The Edison Hotel was Lack luster. Especially for a  place with a great history. Small, dark , and basic. Location is great if you are going to some shows. Also you can walk to Central park, Grand Central Station.
Room rates where comparable however, the NY taxes and fees add almost another 200 dollars.

title: Wonderful hotel!
text: The hotel was amazing. The staff were super friendly and helpful. I am pretty picky, especially when it comes to cleanliness and this hotel surpassed my expectations. I was told before we left that hotel rooms are extremely small in New York; however, to my surprise the room was larger than I thought it would be. I highly recommend staying at this hotel. . .only steps away from Time Square.

title: NYC Retirement Trip
text:
Three of us, friends from graduate school days, decided to celebrate our retirement with a trip to NYC. The Edison was the perfect place to stay. The location was fantastic for everything we wanted to do--go to the theater to see Moulon Rouge, go to the Morgan Library and the MOMA, go on the Nature Conservancy tour of Central Park.
      We loved the room arrangement--two connecting rooms with one bed in one room and two in the other.  We enjoyed all being together in a comfortable setting. We thoroughly enjoyed the walking tour provided free by the hotel. The breakfasts at Friedman's in the hotel was absolutely perfect and well-priced. We loved the Art Deco feel of the hotel. Everyone was welcoming and helpful.
       On our last night, there was some loud construction noise outside in the street, but that was certainly not the fault of the hotel.
        Overall,  I would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Estructura
text: La estructura deberían remodelarla especialmente los baños, colocar más espejos y más iluminación en las habitaciones, el personal debe ser más empatico, no pudieron coordinar Uber al momento de salir

title: Family holiday
text:
Hotel was lovely central location, would stay again.
Location was brilliant few steps to time square, restaurants etc.
You could walk to most places, we walked to Central Park was lovely taking in the views of everything.

title: Truffatori
text: Costi extra addebitati dopo il soggiorno. Comportamento scorretto. Check in poco chiaro, check out ancora meno. Consiglierei la struttura per queste manovre strane. Rumore in finestra alto almeno per noi al 4 piano

title: Perfect place!
text: We loved this hotel. It was very convenient for all of the Broadway shows. It was also really easy to get to the subway entrance. We loved being close to Times Square. We also loved the restaurant choices that the hotel gave us.

title: Hotel
text: Overall I would highly recommend this hotel! Minutes from time square and restaurants! Very clean and friendly staff! Felt safe and comfortable while staying there! Comfy bed and big rooms! Will book again if planning to travel back to New York!

title: Excllent location
text: excellent location to buses / time square / central park. Clean and comfortable rooms.  Grab n go breakfast is a great add on and start to the day.  Staff is friendly, use the concierge service to book hop on /off buses - service fees are lower then through the company directly

title: Péssimo
text: Hotel velho, o banheiro fede a mofo e exala cheiro ruim pela ralo. Prédio envelhecido  e a cama é bem ruim também. Localização ruim pois é no meio da  confusão de time square, o os prestadores de serviço são educados e o preço é ok mas só isso … e o café da manhã que alegam ter é uma mentira … nos dão um voucher diário que dá direito a uma porcaria !

title: Perfect hotel at the perfect location
text: This hotel is perfectly located in the center of Times Square and in walking distance of excellent shopping, the Broadway Theater district and terrific restaurants. The rooms are clean and well maintained. The staff is both friendly and efficient. Breakfast is included which is a great perk. Kezia was especially helpful when we were doing online checkout with our two rooms. I highly recommend Hotel Edison. Once I found this gem, I never stay at any other hotel when visiting NYC.

title: Wouldn’t do it again
text:
After you book your room. And get there they diced to charge you and extra $35 a DAY. Maybe they should mention this before.  If you get there don’t look under the air conditioner it’s disgusting. 
Our shower was missing a door. 
No mini fridge for our baby’s milk. And the door man running a scam gang with cab drivers.cab driver had to go back at 1:45 (he said ) to pay the door man his cut. 
 Half way through to the airport cab driver said we have to pay cash. And then charged us over $20 extra than regular fair 
This is the cab drivers. Cab number
 7f65

title: Recomendable pero pagando cosas que pensabamos teniamos incluidas
text: Te cobran por todo..... cuando llegas te piden una tarjeta de crédito para cobrarte unas taxas....luego teniamos desayuno en el precio...pero si querias desayunar sentado en el restaurante te cobraban 5 euros por persona si te querías sentar...te cobran por maleta si te la guardan el último dia al dejar la habitación y tu vuelo no sale hasta la tarde noche

title: just ok
text:
just ok - not pleased with shower (very weird setup) and not having a convenient way to store my things - there is no dresser, drawers or shelves - had to live out of my suitcase
I would not recommend for a stay longer than a day or two

title: Great stay, good value
text: This hotel was a great value for the price point. We are a family of four (parents, 11-year-old, and 16-year-old) and had a king suite. It was incredibly roomy and so nice for the 16 year old to have his own separate room with a pull out couch. The bathroom was nice sized, with plenty of counter space and wide window sills that served as more storage room. Everything was clean and updated. Our room on the 19th floor was very quiet. My only complaint was that we could have used some instruction on how to use our key in the elevator. Check-in is at a kiosk, so no one to explain it. More noticeable signage would have helped. We would definitely stay here again. Location can't be beat and the size of our room, by NYC hotel standards, was huge.

title: Good location
text:
This hotel is in a great location right in the middle of all the Times Square action.  The view from the lower level rooms is a brick wall so if you want any type of street view request a higher level room.  We were traveling with a person who uses a wheelchair and requested an accessible room but they had none available for our dates.  I ended up reserving a king suite so that we would have enough room for her to move around and enough room for the chair.  We were put in a room with a narrow hallway leading from the entry door to the bathroom and the living room area.  So narrow the wheels of the chair were scraping against the walls to get it through.  I called and requested a room like the one that was in the picture on line when I reserved it and we were moved to a higher floor with a larger room that was similar to the picture online.  However the room was larger but the bathroom was extremely small which again was a problem when you have a person with a mobility disability.  Sadly, they allow people with no disabilities to rent ADA rooms and sadly people without disabilities request ADA rooms because they think they are getting a bigger room fo the same price of a smaller room.  These people are pieces of crap and if you are one of them stop doing it!  You are taking that room for a person who needs the extra space because they have a wheelchair and they need the accessible bathroom so they can shower safely.  I don't know whats wrong with society but you people are unbelievable.  
Anyway, the king suite was nice once we were moved to the one that was advertised, but the King suite did not have a King bed.  It was a double bed.

title: Amazing Weekend at the Edison !!
text: We had such a wonderful time at the Edison Hotel. The staff was most helpful, they arranged tickets for Hamilton, made dinner reservations at the Tamarind. The suite was spacious with the most comfortable bed. I would recommend the Edison Hotel  to everyone. We will be back soon. Thank you  Edward Z.

title: A great stay at Edison!
text: We had a great stay. The rooms were very clean and well-kept. We had an adjoining room and both rooms were wonderfully appointed. The art deco décor was nicely done. The staff were friendly and accommodating. The breakfast vouchers were a great option - we were able to get some great grab-and-go options for the train ride home. There was some quite a bit of construction outside the hotel but that seems to be the norm in many parts of the city right now. The location was great - not far from the hustle and bustle of Time Square. My family and I will definitely stay here again on my next trip to NYC.

title: Worth visiting
text:
Location - Service - Staff - Restaurant and a lot more .. the hotel is alive full of people it reflects the city in a smaller scale .. loved it 
If am coming again to the big apple this hotel will be on top of my list ..  not to forget 
Boby ( doorman ) the first face you see when you arrive and the last face you see when you leave with his smile, advises and comments.. thanks Boby 😀

title: Hotel Edison is a delight!
text: Great location, size of room was perfect, free wine hours with entertainment was enjoyable, free walking tours informative. Loved the trendy art throughout the hotel. Staff was friendly, helpful and had guests’ safety foremost on their minds. Would definitely refer my friends and also stay again myself.

title: Not impressed
text: Title says it all. Better places to stay.  Desk staff were not overly helpful or professional. Don’t get the breakfast. Totally not worth it. Better off going elsewhere for breakfast. Told staff about a broken hair dryer. They weren’t the least bit concerned and no apology. Sink had no water pressure to speak of.

title: Unique and historic hotel
text: Loved the ambiance of this unique hotel.  Perhaps a little dated, but this didn't detract from our stay.  The location is perfect for being in the thick of the craziness of NY city.  The staff were very helpful and friendly.  We even received vouchers for free breakfasts which was a pleasant and unexpected surprise.  Would stay there again.

title: Great location in Times Square!
text:
This was my first stay at Hotel Edison.  I really enjoyed my time there.  The location is perfect if you want to go to the theatre and restaurants in Midtown West.  Don't even have to walk through Times Square.  
Friedman's restaurant is so good, and the voucher breakfast is very nice.  It's so convenient to have two restaurants attached to the hotel.  Our room was pretty small, but it was clean with a nicely remodeled bathroom and nice beds.  I would've like a chair or two to sit on rather than having to sit on the bed.  The little desk chair was used by my roommate, so I didn't have another chair.  
All the staff was very helpful and professional.  I will return to this property again.

title: Great stay!
text:
We chose this hotel for two main reasons:  1) location and 2) we needed two connecting rooms, and they had the option to have one room with a king and the other with two queen beds.

The location is right next to Times Square and I was a little worried about noise but it wasn't an issue at all. Yes there was some music, car horns etc but from around 11pm-7am it was pretty quiet and we all slept well. The beds and pillows were very comfortable. In fact it may be the most comfortable hotel bed I've slept in, though that's my personal preference.

If you are seeing Hamilton the theater is literally steps away out the back entrance of the hotel. It was super convenient. 

The lobby is almost always busy but there was plenty of staff to assist and we didn't have to wait long to check in or out. We used valet and I was impressed with how smooth the process went even with all of our bags (there were 6 of us travelling together). The doormen, bell hops, desk staff, housekeeping, etc were all very friendly.

The free breakfast was a great perk. We went to Bond the first day and the food was great but the coffee cups were very small and only half full. The second day we went to Carve and had bagels which were delicious. Our last day we chose the sit down breakfast at Friedman's. Even though it was busy the food came out very quickly. You HAVE to try the French toast. It was so good we dubbed it OMG French toast. I wish the hotel provided a list of menu options for each restaurant that you can use the coupons. We could have chosen what we wanted ahead of time and not felt rushed at the order counter.

Overall we had a great stay and would definitely go back.

title: Avoid at all costs!
text:
We arrived at this hotel, and it felt like a bus depot.  I have never seen so many people with bags, other than in a transport centre.
 
On attempting to check in, I waited in the line for over 20 minutes, despite there being four clerks on the desk, who were sat on their computers, not on the phone, nor helping any other guests.  The man in front of me, was extremely agitated about the amount of time he had been waiting.
 
On arrival in our room, it was dank and dark and quite frankly miserable.  We have stayed in New York on a number of occasions previously, and this is the worst hotel I have stayed at.  The room was in desperate need of maintenance.  The paint was chipped off all the woodwork.  The bath looked grimy.  And when we were checking the room to check out, we found other guests dirty washing.
 
We stayed at the front of the hotel, and there was building work going on next door.  I'm not sure who allows building contractors to start work in the early hours of the morning, but between the trucks reversing (and their beeping), the general clattering, as well as the almighty crash of something, it was definitely not peaceful.  We expected there to be some noise - after all, we were in New York and not far from Time Square, but this was on another scale!
 
On checking out we stood waiting for our transfer.  Unfortunately there had been a mix up, and given we had travelled from overseas, I was struggling to call the company.  I went back into the hotel to ask if I could use their line.  I was informed that, as they hadn't arranged the transfer, they wouldn't be able to help.  Given I'd just spent hundreds of dollars staying the previous few nights, I thought this was disgusting. 
 
We will never be returning, and we be telling our friends to avoid it too.

title: Delusione
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato presso l'Hotel Edison per 7 notti, pagando una cifra davvero spropositata per noi italiani, ma in linea con le cifre di N.Y.  soprattutto nella zona centrale, ma volendo visitare il più possibile la scelta è stata quasi obbligata.

Ci aspettavamo cordialità; una ricca colazione (dato che avevamo pagato anche quella) ed una camera un po più spaziosa ed invece abbiamo ricevuto pochissima cordialità ed assistenza senza alcuna spiegazione chiara di cosa stessero prelevando dalla carta di credito; la colazione consisteva in un sacchetto da asporto con un cornetto + panino + succo da consumare o in camera o fuori dall'Hotel; una camera talmente piccola che per aprire 2 valigie dovevamo muoverci come i granchi.

E per chiudere questa grande delusione aggiungo che per lasciare le valigie per qualche ora prima della partenza hanno chiesto 1 dollaro per valigia. 

Hotel deludente sotto tutti i punti di vista, l'unica nota positiva è la posizione.

title: Kathy M
text: I very much enjoyed my stay at Hotel Edison. From the moment we arrived, the staff was welcoming and very helpful. Our room was spacious, clean and bright!! The beds were incredibly comfortable.  The room had everything we could need. The air conditioner kept the room very comfortable in the warm, humid August weather. The different types of breakfast vouchers for breakfast made it easy for us to grab something quick and head out or sit for a leisurely meal when we didn’t have to leave early. We were seeing a few Broadway Shows and Hotel Edison is in a perfect location to easily walk to most theaters. Check out was very easy with several different ways to do quick checkout. We will definitely be staying at Hotel Edison again, and I highly recommend them to anyone looking for a great hotel in the Times Square area of New York City.

title: A times square hôtel
text: Overall, it's a well-located hotel for visiting Manhattan. I find it too expensive considering the overall quality of the service; the room and furniture are very old, and there's no dedicated restaurant for breakfast. It's a tourist-oriented establishment. A major issue with sound insulation, making sleep difficult due to the loud noise from the radiators.

title: Très bien
text:
Très bien dans l’ensemble nous étions au 6ieme donc assez bruyant . Assurément mieux Pita haut. 
Lit très confortable mais pas de frigo dans la chambre point faible pour nous !!

 Bien situé à deux pas de Time Square

title: Very dissapointed
text:
A lot of problems with the cleaning of the room, the safe wasn't worked well and the service of the reception staff
The money we paid was simply not worth the room we got and if we could we would just move to another hotel.

title: Tradicional Hotel a metros de Times Square
text: Es un hotel antiguo pero refaccionado y muy bonito. Limpieza 10/10. La habitación confortable. El único aspecto negativo que descarto es que no poseen minibar. El baño estuvo bien al igual que la ducha. Buen aire acondicionado. Ponen café, té y botellas de agua todos los días en forma gratuita. En cuanto al desayuno sí deseas tomarlo en el restaurante tienes que pagar cinco dólares extra por persona por mesa. Sinó, lo llevas a tu habitación. El desayuno continental es aceptable. Podés elegir una fruta que puede ser banana manzana o mandarina o una medialuna, luego te dan elegir o yogurt con granola o sandwich de panceta y huevo y por último eliges entre jugo de naranja, café, agua o té. Para entrar a la zona de los ascensores que llevan a las habitaciones hay que mostrar la tarjeta de la habitación. Buena atención de la recepción se mostraron serviciales cuando pedimos un cambio de habitación por ruidos molestos. A su vez en todos los pisos hay Dispenser de hielo y agua. Tiene seis ascensores que son más que suficientes ya que no hay que esperar los más de unos segundos. En cuánto a la ubicación del hotel tener en cuenta que está a escasos metros de la tribuna de Times Square lo que hace que la zona sea muy concurrida y bulliciosa. Destaco la amabilidad de la mucama Saba en el piso 16.

title: Friendliest NYC Hotel!
text:
I had the pleasure of visiting NYC and staying at the Hotel Edison in August 2023. The Edison is a grand old Art Deco hotel in a fabulous location in Times Square. 

The location was great but what really stood out was the caliber of employees. Shkurte at the front desk handled a problem with my first room with aplomb and professionalism and a smile on her face. The doorman was incredibly pleasant and helpful on a number of occasions when I needed directions or information (don't recall his name but I won't forget his face - smiling, older, maybe a redhead in his younger days). Then I met Danny from Security and again, was left with a feeling of being with people you would want to be friends with. This is truly remarkable. In this day and age when people are not always friendly or helpful or kind, Hotel Edison is a stand out.

I applaud the management of this hotel and wish other hotels had the opportunity to learn how they treat their guests so well.

title: Hotel Edison. Excellent.
text: The beds are really comfortable, service great! Room was clean. Front desk very helpful. Ate at Friedmans a few times and food was great! The location is perfect in Times Square or you can walk to all the shows easily and you’re right in the heart of everything.

title: Perfect October Visit 2022
text:
First time in New York, for the experience. I am glad we chose this hotel for its location alone, right by Times Square and short walks to the usual attractions (We personally did, Empire, top of the rock, boat trip, 9/11 and the Museum with Bus Trip.) 

The Hotel rooms are very dated, but clean which is good, It is a busy city as you can imagine, so its just a place to sleep, having said that, the bed was super comfy, Reception always busy, but thats because they are very attentive and do help you as much as possible.

Restaurant in the Lobby that also faces the street, we actually spent a lot of time there, food was lovely and vaired, Breakfast pancakes delicious. Good bar staff , Beer was Bud Light but americans cant handle good beer! ;)

Nice adult bar in the lobby too, very american, very cosy though.
Great hotel for a New York trip.

title: Location and value
text: My second stay in this hotel. Overall good value. You are right in the heart of Times Square. Good for family vacation . Staff are friendly and helpful. Easy check in and check out. I stayed at the suite room but no microwave or refrigerator. I expected more but we got a welcome chocolate bar and cookies.

title: Good
text: I always choose Edison when I travel to NYC, great location and good service , open 24/7 . This time I also tried the grab and go breakfast at the restaurant Bond 45, that was included in my reservation and that was good.

title: Excellent Hotel at Times Square, NY
text:
This was my fifth time at the Edison Hotel NY and the third time in only 12 months. Love this Hotel in Times Square. The Edison Hotel has its own personality and identity, which make it different and unique compared to many anonymous hotels in Times Square. I love the fact that it has a double entrance on 46th and 47th streets, as well as the magnificent lobby with 30s floors.
Excellent breakfasts at Bond45, an Italian restaurant with a pleasantly American soul, located on the ground floor of the Hotel Edison. The hotel has provided us with precious vouchers that have allowed us to have a quality breakfast at Bond45 with considerable savings and at a very advantageous prices. One more reason to choose this Hotel.
The staff of the Edison hotel is extremely kind: the check-in staff, the technical staff, the laundry staff. I had a problem with the Wi-Fi and were able to fix it in no time. 
The Edison is truly a wonderful hotel in the center of Manhattan. I invite you to try it.

title: Amazing.
text:
from the Moment I walked into Hotel Edison I felt like I was in a movie star hotel,
it was so clean and beautiful. The staff were very Friendly and gave you there full attention. I was very impressed with our check in staff, he was very helpful and pleasant and didn't let another guest interrupt us. they have a very nice organized system. I also liked that the key you have for your room only allows you to go to the correct Floor. 5 stars is my rating and I highly recommend people to stay here. you cant beat the location.

title: Great hotel.
text:
Great hotel, have used many times and will use again, great welcome from staff who actually care..Good choice of food and good value for money.
Great central location, Times Square only a five minute walk and close to many subway stations.so easy access to from all locations.

title: Excellent Hotel
text:
Excellent hotel, ideally places for all sights , staff helpful and polite.
Had a great time in newyork. I would recommend a visit and a stay at the Edison.
Lots of eateries and things todo in and around the hotel. Rooms clean and spacious.

This ideally situated hotel should me be passed over, give it a try.

title: Bel hôtel avec situation centrale
text:
Hôtel situé à 100 m de Times Square. Nous étions en chambre signature. Petite chambre mais suffisante toute rénovée avec une belle salle de bain un dressing une grande télé. Le ménage est fait tous les jours et des bouteilles d'eau sont distribuées tous les jours. Personnel très professionnel et très agréable mention spéciale à Aminata qui parle français et qui est adorable. Le PDJ est très bon et il y a le choix. Perso nous le prenions en chambre. 
Notre chambre donnait sur un mur mais ce n'était pas trop gênant vu qu'on y était que pour dormir. En par contre côté rue je pense que c'est beaucoup plus bruyant. Sinon vous avez tout à disposition à proximité

title: Nice and Great location!
text: Really enjoyed the stay here. It was right next to time square which made getting everywhere accessible via bus or subway. I would recommend and stay there again. Plus it was way cheaper than other hotels. Totally worth it!

title: OUR EXPERIENCE
text: go for the Signature rooms and not the Standard rooms...they were recently renovated and much more comfortable...go to the Carve restaurant for breakfast for better value than the others even though they give you breakfast vouchers.

title: New York rimane sempre con il fantastico fascino
text: La struttura si presenta fatiscente, unico lato positivo è dove si trova, la camera dove alloggio , c’è un mini condizionatore a finestra rumoroso, due ospiti un solo un accappatoio, poi come completare la prima colazione è compresa ma non sapevo che è al sacco , poi infine $300 di cauzione.

title: New York
text:
I took my wife here for her 40th birthday…
I can’t fault the hotel,the room was very spacious with views of Times Square. Perfect location. The bed was very comfortable,the staff were very friendly. 
The take out breakfasts are great and very filling.

title: Linda and Susan and their excellent vacation
text: The Hotel Edison is now our "go to " hotel in NYC.  Don't miss happy hour with Rashawn Parris as host and Brianna gracefully pouring the libations.  Key in security is a godsend.  Friendly staff, efficient service and centrally located.  Breakfast in the hotel is a great way to start the day

title: Love love love!!!
text: Location was epic! Staff was amazing! Just truly cannot say enough about this hotel! The staff read that it was my birthday brought me a cold bottle of champagne and snacks to say happy birthday! I will forever recommend this hotel!

title: Al rientro spese addebitate senza neanche saperlo
text: Da evitare albergo solo come posizione ottima per il resto potete tranquillamente evitarlo stanze picccole, colazione pagata ma solo da portare in stanza se vuoi sederti devi pagare e in più la sorpresa al rientro ti ritrovi dei costi sulla carta di credito senza neanche saperlo costi per colazione già pagati in precedenza, tasse, servizi tour della zona sconosciuti, trionfo dell ora del vino sconosciuto, accesso al centro fitness sconosciuto, wify premium in camera mai utilizzato e sconosciuto al cliente, arrivi al check-in e nessuno ti informa di niente di questi servizi assurdo, quando fai il check-out chiedi appunto se tutto apposto e di non avere costi sulla carta e ti rispondono che ti sarà sbloccata la cauzione e non c’è nulla da pagare assurdo da evitare. Nonostante fatto notare tutto tramite email a chi di competenza rispondono che sono costi da pagare essendo informati all’arrivo. Se leggete hotel Edison andate oltre scegliete altro sconsigliato non sono seri

title: Truffaldini
text: Truffatori seriali. Addebitano 35$ al giorno a camera per servizi extra tra cui anche il WiFi (!!!) ma lo scopri solo due giorni dopo essere tornato a casa. Al check-in ti richiedono 300$ di cauzione e non ti informano che da questa cauzione preleveranno la tariffa extra quotidiana. Scopriamo duo giorni dopo il check-out che hanno addebitato 240$ per servizi di cui nessuna sapeva nulla come ad esempio: palestra, SPA, visita guidata del quartiere, osservatorio con vista all'ultimo piano, ora degustazione del vino gratuita, Wi-Fi e colazione da asporto...ma il bello viene adesso: noi la colazione l'avevamo già pagata nella prenotazione in regime di bed& breakfast!!! Praticamente fanno pagare una misera colazione dove decidono loro cosa devi mangiare o bere per due volte e non informano alcun cliente su tutti i servizi di cui godere con la tariffa extra della quale non viene fatta alcuna menzione in fase di prenotazione! Questi americani mi sa che sono peggio degli italiani che vengono messi alla graticola per due euro di taglio del toast! Non tornerò mai più a New York perché pare che sia una brutto vizietto ovunque quello di fregare in questo modo il cliente. Pessimi in tutto e aggiungo anche poco educati. Voto 2

title: The Best Place to Stay in Times Square!
text: We love this hotel!  We stayed here back in Nov. 2016. Although the price has gone up including the Resort Fee, it still is an excellent place to stay, Grab & Go Breakfast each morning, two restaurant options & a small bar w/an evening jazz band! Gotta Love it!

title: bon hotel mais
text: bien placé mais toujours c'est taxes à ajouter pour avoir du wifi et une bouteille d'eau c'est un peu la base et les petits déjeuner dans le bar du coin si vous voulez dans l'hotel il faut ajouter 5$ par personnes

title: Incorrect website listing
text: We booked the 2 connecting family suite directly through their website. Said it slept 9 (4 queen plus twin sofa bed). They do not have sofa beds. Paid a premium for the extra bed which they didn't have

title: Great hotel...great location...great service
text:
After reading some of the other reviews I was very nervous but I was pleasantly surprised.  Here are some highlights:

Pros: STAFF: nothing short of AMAZING.  The lady who greeted me and the lady who checked me in was very friendly and approachable. Location: EXCELLENT especially if you are going to see Hamilton, Book of Mormon, or Six    All centrally located in that area to avoid Times Square night crowd. ROOM:  cute, clean, and up-to-date.  It is on the small side (but it's Manhattan people...it is what it is and get's the job done!) Wish I took a picture but I was tired. We were on 18th floor. I  did read a lot of reviews about the elevators being slow but I did not find that to be the case.  They had 10 elevators all working with little to no wait time. 

CON: Check-in was a nightmare. The electronic feature did not check me in all the way so I had to wait 35 minutes at the reception desk.  They will not check you in before 3P.  PARKING: in a word EXPENSIVE!!! No in/out privileges. Once you're in you stay.   You do get a discount if you have card stamped (again found out the hard way upon leaving... someone should have told us we needed to get that done). My companion had asked the manager to park in the loading zone while I sorted out check-in.  The manager said yes but the bellman started yelling at him to move which almost got him cussed out. The manager sorted it out but it was a little crazy.

title: Good Hotel but too many scaffolding outside
text: We arrived early to the hotel and wanted to deposit our bags for $1. However the receptionist told us she could upgrade us to a much better room and check us in early for $101 (approx.). We thought this was a good deal and went for it, however, when we went to the room it was adequate but no where near what we expected. The room was small and two people couldn't even fit into the bathroom as once. This made us feel robbed and wondered what our original room would have been like. However, been British, we didn't enquire what our original room would have been like if we hadn't upgraded. This was slightly disappointing.

title: LOVE THIS HOTEL-PERFECT LOCATION & GREAT HOSPITALITY
text: Everything from booking online to check-in at arrival, dining, sleeping, check out, it was ALL spectacular. Room was clean and surprisingly not loud even though it's located in the busiest section of the Theatre District. Even though there are 700+ rooms, this feels like a familiar boutique hotel... they remembered us, spoke to us, asked about our day, the team that works there is simply the BEST!!!!  All were genuine, helpful, professional and hospitable! Thank you to the whole team at Hotel Edison, we will  be back!!!

title: Prime spot with everything needed!
text:
ANOTHER perfect stay. Prime spot with everything needed just feet away.
Room is just the right size for a NYC room. 
Security is excellent. 3 restaurants to choose from and another dozen within 30 yards.
