I stay here everything. Staff is excellent and its nice to come here and feel appreciated.

Thank you!

title: Hidden Gem
text: I had a wonderful few days here with my daughter and grandson.  It's a great location.  We stayed in a mini-suite.  Pull out sofa in a small living room, and a separate, large bedroom with a king bed.  The room was clean, clean, clean.  The only off putting thing is that the bathroom, which is off of the living area,  has a frosted glass pocket door, which you can semi see through. Bad idea!  Six elevators which are speedy so you're never waiting.  All of the staff was pleasant and helpful.  One of the highlights was eating at Friedman's, just off the hotel lobby.  The food was yummy and the wait staff and hostess went out of their way to accommodate a child and an adult with a lot of food allergies.  I will stay here again for sure!

title: Vacation in NYC
text:
The Hotel was ok, the grab and go breakfast was very disappointing but overall is a nice hotel for a first timer in NYC!
Room was quiet and quite clean, reception staff could improve and also the gym in very small e some of the equipment didn’t work for the whole week

title: A wonderful experience!
text: I had a wonderful stay at The Edison! The staff were very helpful and friendly, and the hotel is clearly well taken care of. My room was very clean, spacious, and comfortable. And you cannot beat the location! Perfect for staying in New York City for your first time or your hundredth.

title: Historical and beautiful
text: This hotel is Amazing for anyone who is coming to NY and wants to be IN the city for their stay. The staff is extremely helpful and nice, and there is plenty to do in the area. This was the best experience I have ever had with a hotel in my entire life. I look forward to returning!

title: Excellent hotel for NYC weekend getaway
text: Great service and location at a relatively reasonable price.  Great combination made for a wonderful weekend getaway.  Need to check out the Rum Bar - very nice atmosphere with a highly knowledgeable bar tender that made very tasty drinks.  Highly recommend.

title: My first New York experience
text: I like the fact that everything close to many different shops/nightlife/ food and travel accommodations.The hotel was decent to be an older hotel. Improvements to the older rooms are suggested. Staff were superb! Nice and very informative throughout my stay.

title: Clean but small
text: We got a 2 Queen room for 4 people. It was clean, but bathroom was tiny.  Only one mirror in the room and it was over the sink in the tiny bathroom so it made getting ready harder for everyone.  It looked like  a wall mirror was missing on the wall in the room.  Front desk staff were not very friendly.. definitely not “Service with a smile”  but then again.. it’s not the south. Location was very convenient to everything so that was a plus.

title: Hotel Edison no pone al cliente al centro
text: Pésima atención, recepcionistas muy poco amigabled, no subian maletas ni te ayudaban con la puerta, no reponian jabon, habitación pequeña y el desayuno lo peor, mejor llamarlo ayuno y encima había que ir a buscarlo a la calle. Lo único bueno la ubicación

title: The Edison is an excellent hotel.
text:
The Edison Hotel staff was all very friendly and went out of their way to help everyone even those that did not speak English. The location is excellent if you are exploring Times Square and going to Bway musicals.  Having a fine reasonable restaurant right off the lobby was wonderful!  The food and the evening entertainment were excellent.  Enjoy Friedman's for both breakfast and for dinner.  

My only suggestion would be to add a shuttle to different sites in NY for a reasonable price.  Also, encourage your guests to purchase their Bway show tickets right at the theater box offices the day before or on the performance date.  Also, employ a friendly person to suggest different fun things to do in your wonderful city or suggest great places to eat reasonably.  Thanks for a great stay!

title: Nice stay in signature room
text: We stayed in a signature room on the 22nd floor. Spacious room, newly renovated and they added a baby bed for my 1 year old. Great location in the middle of Time Square closed by the MMS Store and the red stairs, you can seat to check the view of the site. Breakfast is basic and not of lot of choices compared to the menue on the website of Bonds 45.  Friendly employees. We really liked our stay there.

The location was great but the quality of the hotel was outdated and rooms were small. The washrooms were small. We had staff barging into the room while we were asleep when no one called for housekeeping..

title: Great location for a first time visit to New York
text:
I've rated this hotel as excellent, in the context of the price paid. For us the Edison was great for our fist stay in New York, being right in the heart of Broadway, Times Square and within walking distance of many points of interest. 
The rooms are clean, comfortable and quiet enough to get a good nights sleep. As I understand it NYC hotel rooms can be on the small side with minimal storage and the Edison fits that description, however we found our King room adequate for the weeks stay. The numerous elevators (lifts) are very efficient with very little waiting about.
The included breakfast was a great benefit, however we did pay $5 each to convert from grab & go to a sit down breakfast in the restaurant. For us well worth it. The menu choices are limited at this price, but we found it good enough. Friedman's was our preference of the 2 possible restaurants. 
We found the staff to be friendly and helpful. The gentleman on the front door deserves a special mention (Steve I think?).
The adjoining Run Bar has a nice atmosphere and live jazz most nights. My only complaint, was the pompous guy who seemed to be in charge, but we can't all be perfect!
As others have mentioned the public spaces are art décor which gives the hotel a nice vibe of a bygone era.
Would we stay at the Edison again? Without hesitation.

title: Great location, terrible room.
text: We booked a terrace suite thinking we’d be able to see Times Square. It was not as advertised. The AC in the room didn’t work, it made horribly loud noises at night and didn’t cool, so we didn’t sleep.

title: Room safety is concerning
text: Someone from the hotel staff did not document that we had checked in so 24 hours after I stay someone was able to walk into a room plus the hotel rooms do not have double locks which pose a huge security risk for safety. Wallpaper with shipping carpet was dirty room is not clean sufficiently.

title: Great location, poor first impression
text: Perfectly located, good breakfast included.  The doormen were very helpful, as were the people behind the front desk, but we had a shocking experience upon arrival with the gentleman screening room keys at the elevator.  My child is a wheelchair user and realized their tires were very low (they use a motorized chair at home and brought their manual chair on the trip).  When they asked the staffer at the elevator if he knew of a bike shop nearby, he snapped, "You know Google is free, right?"  It left a very poor first impression of what turned out to be otherwise a very enjoyable stay that could not be more convenient to TKTS, the theatres we attended, and the restaurants where we ate.

title: Great stay at Hotel Edison
text: For theatre goes and fans of Times Square, this hotel was perfect! Literally steps away from everything we needed and wanted. Great restaurants attached to the hotel, great staff and good sized rooms. Air conditioning was very much appreciated on hot August days! We would definitely stay here again. Price point was good for the location!

title: Vacation trip
text: Nice place to stay. Right in the middle of Time Square. Very confortable bed. Breakfast plan ok. There are parking lot in front of the hotel but a little expensive so you have to go a few bloc around to find something affordable.

title: Ruido en las habitaciones
text:
Algunas habitaciones tienen falta de mantenimiento.
Como sea hora de entrada y salida del hotel puedes esperar un ascensor hasta 15 min. 
Se filtra el ruido de la maquinaria de aire de fuera. Si tienes el sueño lijero no vayas a este hotel.

title: Best location
text: We had a great experience at the hotel. It is in a great location for Broadway shows. Security was excellent. Rooms were clean & I felt larger than normal for older NY hotel. We would definitely return!

title: Disappointing hotel
text:
Very disappointing hotel. 
Rooms are v small - way below standard. Tired and dated. Bathroom is minuscule - with missing bath enamel and dirty grouting in places. 
No tea or coffee facilities- no fridge. The wifi is at best intermittent. There a charge for using the safe. 
Staff are unenthusiastic. 
Extra charge to sit and eat breakfast which you have already paid for. 
Bars were shut at 10pm. 
Location is excellent - Edison’s only plus.

title: NYC 2023 August
text: Excellent location especially for theater goers.  Enjoyed a good breakfast at Friedmans.  Don’t miss the Rum Bar - staff is outstanding as are the cocktails- try a Negroni.  The rooms are clean and the housekeeping staff is eager to please…

title: Hotel Edison
text: Hotel location is excellent. Staff was courteous and very efficient room service. Facilities were good, we opted for grab and go breakfast which has limited but relevant options for all ages. Overall we had a memorable stay at hotel.

title: Great Customer,  terrible quality of rooms.
text: Customer service was above and beyond.  Quality  of the rooms for the price was definitely lacking.  I seen 3 rooms including a Suite and all three were  worn down.  Chipped paint, worn out finishes on dressers and night stands.  Broken out windows.  AC not working properly, tears and rips in carpet. I wouldn't count the state that these rooms were in as 4 star rooms.  More like motel quailty.

title: Short visit to NYC
text:
Hotel is right next to Times Square , so very busy . 
Retro entrance but rooms were basic probably could do with a little refurbishment, vouchers to redeem for breakfast . 
Staff were pleasant & helpful .

title: Stay here
text: Everything was great. It is in the middle of everything so super convenient , rooms can be loud at night due to all the street activity but that aspected and part of the experience. Would recommend and plan to stay again

title: Edison Hotel was exceptional
text: Staying at Hotel Edison was an exceptional experience. The hotel is in a fantastic location. The rooms were clean and extremely comfortable. The bed in particular was terrific. The staff were helpful, friendly and the hotel facilities outstanding. We would recommend this hotel to any travelers going to New York.

title: Awesome Hotel
text: This was a beautiful hotel in the heart of Manhattan! The staff was great, the bed was super comfy, restaurants were great and The Rum Bar was superb! We will definitely be back! This was a 60 Birthday trip for 2 couples and was absolutely perfect!

title: Great place, good location and nice employees.
text: Would recommend to family and friend anytime.  From valet parking all the way to cleaning staff, everyone was polite helpfull and very nice.  Room was clean and bed very compfortable.  Will book there next Time for shure, Right beside Time square, just great!

title: Good Location-nothing special
text: Central to Times Square and Broadway. Nothing special. Room wasn’t as clean as we would have expected. Street noise was prevalent. AC unit provided white noise but didn’t work properly. Overall felt it was ok but for the $$ spent, was a bit disappointing

title: Centrally Hotel
text: This Hotel is located 100 meters from Timesquare.  The Hotel is old and traditionally. We felt safe at the Hotel. When We arrived We got breakfast-tickets and free to go-breakfast. That was ok. The Hotel offer transport to the air-port, but it costed 110$ for 4 person excluding tip.

title: ,Safe Quiet, comfortable & super friendly staff!.
text: The room was so comfortable, quiet and relaxing. Shout out to Rommel who was so friendly & helped us get situated and made sure we went to the wine happy hour, which was nice before traveling the streets. Also the welcome letter and gifts for returning guest is a SUPER nice treat! Love the Edison, in the heart of the city yet quiet and SAFE! Till next time!

title: Great location. Comfortable hotel
text: We had a great experience at this hotel. The staff were excellent, the rooms and beds were comfortable and the Hotel was in a great location. We would definitely stay there again when we return to New York and we would recommend this property to anyone going to this iconic city.

title: Great location!!
text: Great location, a few doors down from time square and walking distance to everywhere.  Our broadway show theatre was just right across the street.  Clean rooms and friendly staff.  Hot grab and go breakfast sandwich was good.  Highly recommended!!

title: An Oasis on Times Square
text: Warm welcoming staff. Grab’n’Go breakfast was great for on-the-go picnic. Quiet, well maintained and supplemented room. Cleaned daily by courteous staff. Good Midtown base for subway & NYC sights. Recommended.

title: Hotel Edison near Times Square
text: I was in NYC to see Broadway shows. The Edison is on W. 47th and is perfectly located for walking to theaters. There are two restaurants and a cocktail bar in the Hotel, and the $5 price fixe breakfast is a real bargain. Hotel staff and employees are friendly and helpful. The room was small but not tiny. I highly recommend Hotel Edison.

title: A Special Experience
text: My daughter and I stayed at the Edison when we traveled to NYC to enjoy a few Broadway shows, the Broadway Museum, Rise NY and an escape room.  We chose the Edison for it's location and nostalgia.  My parents spent a week at the Edison or their honeymoon in September 1948.  I brought their original bill with me and showed it to the young lady that checked us in.  Much to my surprise she was very excited and interested and took it back to share with the manager who came out to talk to me and give me a little history!  He made copies of the bill and is going to hang them in the nostalgia room at the hotel!  They really made my day!  The room was comfortable and a decent size for NYC.  The grab and go breakfast was very good and much more than I expected.  We will return for sure on our next Broadway trip!

title: Great location in Times Square
text: Excellent location in Times Square. Clean rooms and friendly front desk. Offers valet parking. Includes stop and go breakfast which is very convenient on checkout day. Security a huge plus at elevators.

title: Weeks family holiday
text:
Hotel is great but Times Square VERY busy in Aug.
Didn't have any problems with noise etc room 1421 and staff were great.
We had booked "bed & breakfast" with UK travel agent yet presents with $5 breakfast vouchers at hotel.
Had breakfast one morning in hotel off the "breakfast voucher" EXTREMELY basic menu (no bacon/sausage etc) and ended up with bill for $66!!!!!!!
Three extra slices of bacon for each person cost $9 ($3 EACH slice!!!!!)
Ended up rest of the week getting the "grab&go" breakfast and eating outside on street or in your hotel room!!!!!!
Most times when used our vouchers in "Carve Deli" close by which was good but this "arrangement" is NOT what you expect from a 4star hotel !!!!!!!!!!!
Hotel Edison need to make this aware to customers who book "bed&breakfast" as my UK travel agent are seeking an explanation from hotel ref this as even they weren't aware!!!!

title: Excellent Location, Great Staff!
text: We stayed for a week, for a family vacation. This hotel is perfectly located near Times Square. All staff we encountered were always very kind and helpful. The rooms are a bit small for a family with luggage (from what we are normally used to), but it's NY, so it's understandable. They did have upgraded room options, so something to consider for next time. We would definitely recommend and would love to stay again!

title: Location is So Central to Broadway
text: This is my 4th time at the Hotel Edison. I love the location and ease of traveling in and out from the subway system. I appreciated the breakfast that was included with my room. These special touches really put them ahead of other hotels. Plus, it’s clean and comfortable inside. Nice place for families.

title: super helpful staff!
text: The hotel has very helpful and kind staff. I actually forgot money in the safe at departure and the team were able to locate and mail the money to me at my home address. Great customer service and nice clean rooms.

title: Good cost / benefit
text: Hotel is very good and extremely well located. Small issue only with the noise coming from Times Square. Breakfast is ok. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Overall it was a pleasant experience to be at very charming Hotel Edison.

title: Best stay in NYC
text: We had the best stay at this hotel. All hotel employees were friendly and helpful - super easy check in and check out process! The location was perfect and the security at the elevators was a comfort. The room and bathroom was very clean - house keeping came each day and did a fantastic job!  I was very impressed by the hotel - we had the best time and cannot wait to visit again!

title: Séjour en famille
text: Hôtel très bien situé. Chambres spacieuses. Petits déjeuners corrects avec choix entre fruit ou croissant ; sandwich salé ou yaourt céréales ; jus d'orange ou café ou thé; ou lait froid . Habitués plutôt au petits déjeuners buffet, même mes 4 grands ados ont été satisfaits. Quartier animé donc bruyant évidemment, mais c'est Times Square ! Fenêtres fermées, clim arrêtée, et fatigue oblige (!) nous avons tous bien dormis !   Seul bémol : nous n'avions pas de réfrigérateur dans les chambres, alors qu'ils étaient prévus dans la location. Mais nous n'en aurions pas eu besoin particulièrement. L'hôtel peut en fournir si besoin. Pour les fumeurs > chambre avec terrasse obligatoire !

title: A great location with history!
text: This hotel is rich in history and is a great location if you want to be in the heart of New York.  The room was a great size however it can do with some renovations to the walls. The bathrooms are very small I was a bit taken back at the size. The bond 45 complimentary breakfast (especially the sandwich) was not good at all. I did love the coffee and I got the chance to eat breakfast at the other restaurant which was 100% better. Overall it was a great stay the pros out weighted the cons.

title: Sons 18th Birthday in NYC.
text: The location is perfect, the start of Broadway and Time Square a few yards away! Unlike your usual hotel chains this place has a real character,  it feels very personal and warming. The staff were very attentive and delt with all our needs very very efficiently and nothing seemed too much trouble. My biggest concern was my connection from JFK to get my family to safely to the hotel, Hotel Edison arranged all this for us and it all went to plan perfectly.  Would not hesitate to stay here again, clean rooms and comfortable beds with amazing staff, please don't change anything it was perfect and way beyond our expectations.

title: Worst theatre district experience I’ve had
text: Clean is about the only nice thing I can say.  Room was tiny (friend had anxiety from claustrophobic area).  Bathroom was same size as closet.  Also, missing half of shower door.  Unhelpful staff.  Booking errors.  grab & go breakfast worse than a continental at a 2* hotel.  Couldn’t get more than one coffee per person.  Very few options.

title: A week at the Edison
text: Shame about all the scaffolding outside but work needs to be done. Room needed a freshen up but was clean and bed was comfortable, it had a hairdryer, iron and a safe. Location of this hotel is perfect for all sightseeing.

title: Very good
text: Specially the location was great. Value for money. Staff has been very friendly and supportive. Cleanliness is fairly satisfactory. However check out line was too long and it took lot of time before the check out process was completed

title: A hotel with character & great staff right next to Time Square.
text: Lovely hotel with character, the staff here were so helpful and friendly. Anything I needed was resolved very efficiently and there is the added bonus of two excellent restaurants integrated should you prefer to stay near by.

title: Very near to Time Square and located in the center
text: It's very central, and it was very close to Time Square and public transportation. The location wan just amazing! but the breakfast and room was not as good as I expected. Maybe because I have got to much expectation anyway overall it was nice experience

title: Average place
text: It was not worth it for the price. I would recommend Hilton which was next door. It was crazy expensive. Staff were either rude or dismissive. The Wi-Fi didn't work and we were on the phone for forty minutes to get it to work. They didn't give us a fridge and it was a suite. We had to go through a chain to get one.

title: Stay at edison
text: It was very loud dringend nicht. No showerfloor in the small bathroom. The breakfast was finde, but additional costs for sitting in eatingroom. The personel was very friendly and the location is very near by the times square.

title: Great Location
text: Great Location to Theatre District. Restaurants at the hotel were very good. Staff was excellent. Overall positive experience .  Able to walk to all activities. Close to Times Square .  Procedures provide secure environment for travelers

title: Girls Trip
text: We had a great girls weekend. Beds were comfortable and room was clean. Great location. Tiny bathroom but incredible $5 breakfast at Friedman’s with hotel voucher. It was excellent! All the theaters are so close and you are right at Times Square! I’d love it if updated, but I would go back. Very very busy lobby.

title: A First Class Act
text: This is my second stay at Hotel Edison. The staff is very efficient and attentive. The rooms are very nice and those pillows are so soft. The grab and go breakfast is delicious. Also, all of the theatres were in walking distance. I am already looking forward to my next visit to stay at Hotel Edison because they are a first class act.

title: Outdated but good location
text: Some years ago we also stayed at Edison hotel so easy to compare and the service is still implacable but the hotel misses and upgrade bringing it to todays standard and comfort for it's guests (Noise in room and Wifi are a MAJOR point for improvement)

title: Not the experience I wanted to experience.
text:
Hotel Edison is located in the heart of Time Square. It is a busy lively tourist area with plenty of shops, restaurants, theatres and other places of interest. It is also triangulated with nearby Time Sq, 50 St & Rockefeller Centre subways which makes it easy to hop on and off for exploring Manhattan. 

Our stay at the Hotel Edison was somewhat disappointing. It looked outdated but acceptable in its Art Deco styling. Our first room on the 2nd floor was ok but very dark and dingy and had a horrible musty smell. The noise outside was unbearable at night/early hours. Noise from traffic, service and construction vehicles, and sirens from emergency vehicles were not great for a good night’s sleep. It felt like we were sleeping outside on the pavement.

We woke up the next day very tired and headed to the reception desk to complain, one member of staff was cleaning his desk and kept nodding his head to go over to the other desk. No 'good morning' or 'how may I help', just a rude nodding. We spoke to the other staff who was helpful and concerned about us not having slept very much in a smelly room, he offered a room on the 3rd floor and asked us to go and take a look and see if it was any better.
Before moving we opted to have breakfast in the hotel at the Bond 45 Kitchen & Bar, we paid an additional $5 x 3 to sit and eat but the options were limited. My wife selected French toast and after some 5 minutes, the waiter told her they didn't have any. Slightly annoyed my wife requested toast and the waiter gave her an option of seeded bread. Tea & orange juice had been brought to our table when another waiter came to inform, us that they were unable to provide substitutions, so no seeded toast for my wife unless we paid extra. WOW!!!!
Now in the UK (and take note Hotel Edison) customer service is paramount, in a situation like this, an eatery would have provided the choice offered to them to keep the customer happy. The fact that it was breakfast and French toast was on the menu I would expect it to be available and served. In the end, fed up and hungry we left. 
I really do not understand the logic, the restaurant LOST money with the tea and orange juice served to us whilst we waited for our breakfast. I'm guessing it was being prepared and would have had to be thrown away in the end. All this for a couple of slices of toast - unbelievable! We then headed for the complimentary 'grab & go' breakfast.

Our second room was lovely and spacious, well-lit with the addition of a sofa and extra storage space. This felt like an upgrade. We unpacked and has a busy day of sightseeing. We returned back to the hotel late at night and in need of a good night’s sleep, but the noise from outside was still bad. In the morning I discovered a ventilation gap, allowing noise to come through into our room. The windows had been secured meaning they could not open and therefore we could not ‘resolve’ the ventilation gap. 
After another start to the day of feeling tired, we headed for breakfast, this time at the hotel's Friedman's eatery, this was a pleasant experience to the one we had at Bond 45. My wife was still very annoyed with not having much sleep and found a very sympathetic manager Nowell. We’d spoken to a couple earlier and asked them if the noise bothered them and said no as they were on the 23rd floor. So, Nowell offered us a room (now 3rd) on the 21st floor which would be ready in the afternoon. 
Again, we packed our belongings into suitcases to be taken down and stored as the room has to be cleaned first. My daughter informed one member of staff Juan that some of her makeup solution was leaking in a small bag and if they would be kind enough to keep it upright. Juan informed a colleague (Patrick I think) and rudely said ‘Can’t guarantee it’ and walked off. Uncomfortable, Juan promptly told us he’ll take care of it and enjoy the rest of the day.

We returned later that afternoon and found Juan to collect our luggage, Juan joked that he stayed with the bag to avoid the makeup bottle from leaking. Nothing had leaked and that little joke from him brought a big smile to our faces. This showed that Juan cared even for those small and less important things. Things that Patrick dismissed and had no time!

We moved into our 3rd room and Nowell had left a complimentary bottle of wine and chocolates for us. The room was sadly a downgrade from the others with no storage, cupboards or bedside units other than a couple of so small shelves. This meant that much of our clothing had to stay in our suitcases and anything we could hang went into the very small wardrobe. The shower screen for the walking shower was not long enough which caused the water to wet the floor and made me slip and hurt my ankle causing it to swell for several days. In the we had to put down towels to soak up the water, we were so fed up of these rooms there was no point complaining again and put up with this unpleasant experience. We did however have a restful noise free couple of nights' sleep. 

Overall, Hotel Edison fell short of our expectations. We found staff lacked courteous and professional customer service. Bond 45 needs to be flexible when THEY fail to accommodate customers and have a friendly manner towards them. To have customers walk out over some seeded toast is a joke!
Nowell and Juan were exceptional and praise them for their care and attention. They were both very helpful and genuinely made an effort to help us. I understand NYC is a busy city with a large flow of traffic, daily commuters and construction activity but the noise coming through the ventilation gap in the windows was far too loud for us, meaning it disrupted some much-needed rest.

title: Family of Five
text: The family suite is a great room for families of 5 or 6. King bed plus two Queen beds. Only issue is the single bathroom, but we managed. Staff are great. Parking is right across the street, don't bother with valet.

title: Great for the price but too noisy
text:
It was a great experience, considering the price and amenities, of course location for tourists was very good.
Restaurant downstairs was amazing with very friendly people. 
If you get bigger rooms, they are very nice comparing to New York hotels.
It could be better the smell, it’s like an old building with smelly carpets, lots of cigarets and no ventilation.
The air con from rooms were awfully. Talking about the temperature, that was OK, but the noise was extremely annoying, it was impossible to sleep and no wake up at the middle of the night.

title: Basic
text: We were in a classic queen room on the 10th floor pictures on website are very misleading. It was tiny, big long corridor in the room then just a queen bed. Room was dark as was facing out to other buildings and couldn't leave blind up as would have no privacy. The bathroom was so small and toilet was literally 3ft from the bed. Toilet was so loud when flushed and also the noise of the pipe from other rooms above us when the toilets were flushed was so loud it would wake us at night. Bed was comfortable that was about it. Yes it was just a place to sleep and shower for us but I dont think it was worth the price as well as $160 extra we has to pay for resort fee for 4 nights. Paid a total of $300 at check in which included deposit which was returned few days after checking in. Check in process was so slow we waited atleast 20 minutes to be checked in and then spent another 10-15 minutes checking in. If you want to stay in heart of times square it's ideal. Personally wouldn't stay in times Square again as felt so sketchy outside the hotel at night. The included breakfast vouchers were grab and go breakfast from Bond 45 was tasteless and sit down breakfast in Friedmans for $5 was basically just any type of eggs, toast and disgusting hashbrown(more like boiled potatoes). We also wanted latte and that was $6pp more exclusive of tax and tips 🙄.  I wouldn't stay here again or recommend it to family or friends.

title: Great family trip / stay!
text:
We came to New York to celebrate our daughter’s birthday. We mentioned the birthday in the reservation, and they gave us an amazing room with a view of Time Square, a little teddy bear, and a sweet treat. 
The location is perfect!  The room was great, and service was impeccable. 
Will definitely return here!  Thank you!

title: A hotel with immense potential !
text: I would have stayed at this hotel from 23rd July to 27th July and wasn’t it a mixed bag ! The hotel is at a great location ! However my first observation was that the bathrooms do not lock ! I think coming from the Caribbean this is a strange thing for me. The WiFi was atrocious in my room and I constantly had to reload and disconnect and reconnect to the WiFi. The bathroom amenities were good however I found myself having to call as they were not replenished everyday. The bed was comfortable and the view was great. Staff was quite attentive and very nice. Anyone staying here should take advantage of the various offers they have in the lobby as the discounts are quite good ( especially the coupon book from the mall ).

title: Sheer joy throughout our stay
text: Central location, around the corner from Times Square. Small rooms that to be honest need upgrading a little. But what do you need in NYC other than a bed and a shower!! The staff are so friendly. Big shout out to the ladies working on the tenth floor. Beware of the run lunch served in the bar downstairs as it's lethal in a good aT folks. Meals, well two options. We ended using the game and go option as it set you up  for the day. Try it yourself soon
